imgui_internal.h
1// dear imgui, v1.92.0 WIP
2// (internal structures/api)

4// You may use this file to debug, understand or extend Dear ImGui features but we don't provide any guarantee of
5// forward compatibility.
6
7/*
8
9Index of this file:
10
11// [SECTION] Header mess
12// [SECTION] Forward declarations
13// [SECTION] Context pointer
14// [SECTION] STB libraries includes
15// [SECTION] Macros
16// [SECTION] Generic helpers
17// [SECTION] ImDrawList support
18// [SECTION] Style support
19// [SECTION] Data types support
20// [SECTION] Widgets support: flags, enums, data structures
21// [SECTION] Popup support
22// [SECTION] Inputs support
23// [SECTION] Clipper support
24// [SECTION] Navigation support
25// [SECTION] Typing-select support
26// [SECTION] Columns support
27// [SECTION] Box-select support
28// [SECTION] Multi-select support
29// [SECTION] Docking support
30// [SECTION] Viewport support
31// [SECTION] Settings support
32// [SECTION] Localization support
33// [SECTION] Error handling, State recovery support
34// [SECTION] Metrics, Debug tools
35// [SECTION] Generic context hooks
36// [SECTION] ImGuiContext (main imgui context)
37// [SECTION] ImGuiWindowTempData, ImGuiWindow
38// [SECTION] Tab bar, Tab item support
39// [SECTION] Table support
40// [SECTION] ImGui internal API
41// [SECTION] ImFontAtlas internal API
42// [SECTION] Test Engine specific hooks (imgui_test_engine)
43
44*/

46#pragma once
47#ifndef IMGUI_DISABLE
48
49//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
50// [SECTION] Header mess
51//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
52
53#ifndef IMGUI_VERSION
54#include "imgui.h"
55#endif
56
57#include <stdio.h> // FILE*, sscanf
58#include <stdlib.h> // NULL, malloc, free, qsort, atoi, atof
59#include <math.h> // sqrtf, fabsf, fmodf, powf, floorf, ceilf, cosf, sinf
60#include <limits.h> // INT_MIN, INT_MAX
61
62// Enable SSE intrinsics if available
63#if (defined __SSE__ || defined __x86_64__ || defined _M_X64 || (defined(_M_IX86_FP) && (_M_IX86_FP >= 1))) && \
64 !defined(IMGUI_DISABLE_SSE)
65#define IMGUI_ENABLE_SSE
66#include <immintrin.h>
67#if (defined __AVX__ || defined __SSE4_2__)
68#define IMGUI_ENABLE_SSE4_2
69#include <nmmintrin.h>
70#endif
71#endif
72// Emscripten has partial SSE 4.2 support where _mm_crc32_u32 is not available. See
73// https://emscripten.org/docs/porting/simd.html#id11 and #8213
74#if defined(IMGUI_ENABLE_SSE4_2) && !defined(IMGUI_USE_LEGACY_CRC32_ADLER) && !defined(__EMSCRIPTEN__)
75#define IMGUI_ENABLE_SSE4_2_CRC
76#endif
77
78// Visual Studio warnings
79#ifdef _MSC_VER
80#pragma warning(push)
81#pragma warning(disable : 4251) // class 'xxx' needs to have dll-interface to be used by clients of struct 'xxx' // when
82 // IMGUI_API is set to__declspec(dllexport)
83#pragma warning( \
84 disable \
85 : 26812) // The enum type 'xxx' is unscoped. Prefer 'enum class' over 'enum' (Enum.3). [MSVC Static Analyzer)
86#pragma warning( \
87 disable \
88 : 26495) // [Static Analyzer] Variable 'XXX' is uninitialized. Always initialize a member variable (type.6).
89#if defined(_MSC_VER) && _MSC_VER >= 1922 // MSVC 2019 16.2 or later
90#pragma warning(disable : 5054) // operator '|': deprecated between enumerations of different types
91#endif
92#endif
93
94// Clang/GCC warnings with -Weverything
95#if defined(__clang__)
96#pragma clang diagnostic push
97#if __has_warning("-Wunknown-warning-option")
98#pragma clang diagnostic ignored "-Wunknown-warning-option" // warning: unknown warning group 'xxx'
99#endif
100#pragma clang diagnostic ignored "-Wunknown-pragmas" // warning: unknown warning group 'xxx'
101#pragma clang diagnostic ignored "-Wfloat-equal" // warning: comparing floating point with == or != is unsafe // storing
102 // and comparing against same constants ok, for ImFloor()
103#pragma clang diagnostic ignored "-Wold-style-cast" // warning: use of old-style cast
104#pragma clang diagnostic ignored "-Wzero-as-null-pointer-constant" // warning: zero as null pointer constant
105#pragma clang diagnostic ignored \
106 "-Wdouble-promotion" // warning: implicit conversion from 'float' to 'double' when passing argument to function
107#pragma clang diagnostic ignored \
108 "-Wimplicit-int-float-conversion" // warning: implicit conversion from 'xxx' to 'float' may lose precision
109#pragma clang diagnostic ignored \
110 "-Wmissing-noreturn" // warning: function 'xxx' could be declared with attribute 'noreturn'
111#pragma clang diagnostic ignored \
112 "-Wdeprecated-enum-enum-conversion" // warning: bitwise operation between different enumeration types ('XXXFlags_'
113 // and 'XXXFlagsPrivate_') is deprecated
114#pragma clang diagnostic ignored "-Wunsafe-buffer-usage" // warning: 'xxx' is an unsafe pointer used for buffer access
115#pragma clang diagnostic ignored "-Wnontrivial-memaccess" // warning: first argument in call to 'memset' is a pointer to
116 // non-trivially copyable type
117#elif defined(__GNUC__)
118#pragma GCC diagnostic push
119#pragma GCC diagnostic ignored "-Wpragmas" // warning: unknown option after '#pragma GCC diagnostic' kind
120#pragma GCC diagnostic ignored "-Wfloat-equal" // warning: comparing floating-point with '==' or '!=' is unsafe
121#pragma GCC diagnostic ignored \
122 "-Wclass-memaccess" // [__GNUC__ >= 8] warning: 'memset/memcpy' clearing/writing an object of type 'xxxx' with no
123 // trivial copy-assignment; use assignment or value-initialization instead
124#pragma GCC diagnostic ignored \
125 "-Wdeprecated-enum-enum-conversion" // warning: bitwise operation between different enumeration types ('XXXFlags_'
126 // and 'XXXFlagsPrivate_') is deprecated
127#endif
128
129// In 1.89.4, we moved the implementation of "courtesy maths operators" from imgui_internal.h in imgui.h
130// As they are frequently requested, we do not want to encourage to many people using imgui_internal.h
131#if defined(IMGUI_DEFINE_MATH_OPERATORS) && !defined(IMGUI_DEFINE_MATH_OPERATORS_IMPLEMENTED)
132#error Please '#define IMGUI_DEFINE_MATH_OPERATORS' _BEFORE_ including imgui.h!
133#endif
134
135// Legacy defines
136#ifdef IMGUI_DISABLE_FORMAT_STRING_FUNCTIONS // Renamed in 1.74
137#error Use IMGUI_DISABLE_DEFAULT_FORMAT_FUNCTIONS
138#endif
139#ifdef IMGUI_DISABLE_MATH_FUNCTIONS // Renamed in 1.74
140#error Use IMGUI_DISABLE_DEFAULT_MATH_FUNCTIONS
141#endif
142
143// Enable stb_truetype by default unless FreeType is enabled.
144// You can compile with both by defining both IMGUI_ENABLE_FREETYPE and IMGUI_ENABLE_STB_TRUETYPE together.
145#ifndef IMGUI_ENABLE_FREETYPE
146#define IMGUI_ENABLE_STB_TRUETYPE
147#endif

149//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
150// [SECTION] Forward declarations
151//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
152
153// Utilities
154// (other types which are not forwarded declared are: ImBitArray<>, ImSpan<>, ImSpanAllocator<>, ImPool<>,
155// ImChunkStream<>)
156struct ImBitVector; // Store 1-bit per value
157struct ImRect; // An axis-aligned rectangle (2 points)
158struct ImGuiTextIndex; // Maintain a line index for a text buffer.
159
160// ImDrawList/ImFontAtlas
161struct ImDrawDataBuilder; // Helper to build a ImDrawData instance
162struct ImDrawListSharedData; // Data shared between all ImDrawList instances
163
164// ImGui
165struct ImGuiBoxSelectState; // Box-selection state (currently used by multi-selection, could potentially be used by
166 // others)
167struct ImGuiColorMod; // Stacked color modifier, backup of modified data so we can restore it
168struct ImGuiContext; // Main Dear ImGui context
169struct ImGuiContextHook; // Hook for extensions like ImGuiTestEngine
170struct ImGuiDataTypeInfo; // Type information associated to a ImGuiDataType enum
171struct ImGuiDeactivatedItemData; // Data for IsItemDeactivated()/IsItemDeactivatedAfterEdit() function.
172struct ImGuiDockContext; // Docking system context
173struct ImGuiDockRequest; // Docking system dock/undock queued request
174struct ImGuiDockNode; // Docking system node (hold a list of Windows OR two child dock nodes)
175struct ImGuiDockNodeSettings; // Storage for a dock node in .ini file (we preserve those even if the associated dock
176 // node isn't active during the session)
177struct ImGuiErrorRecoveryState; // Storage of stack sizes for error handling and recovery
178struct ImGuiGroupData; // Stacked storage data for BeginGroup()/EndGroup()
179struct ImGuiInputTextState; // Internal state of the currently focused/edited text input box
180struct ImGuiInputTextDeactivateData; // Short term storage to backup text of a deactivating InputText() while another is
181 // stealing active id
182struct ImGuiLastItemData; // Status storage for last submitted items
183struct ImGuiLocEntry; // A localization entry.
184struct ImGuiMenuColumns; // Simple column measurement, currently used for MenuItem() only
185struct ImGuiMultiSelectState; // Multi-selection persistent state (for focused selection).
186struct ImGuiMultiSelectTempData; // Multi-selection temporary state (while traversing).
187struct ImGuiNavItemData; // Result of a keyboard/gamepad directional navigation move query result
188struct ImGuiMetricsConfig; // Storage for ShowMetricsWindow() and DebugNodeXXX() functions
189struct ImGuiNextWindowData; // Storage for SetNextWindow** functions
190struct ImGuiNextItemData; // Storage for SetNextItem** functions
191struct ImGuiOldColumnData; // Storage data for a single column for legacy Columns() api
192struct ImGuiOldColumns; // Storage data for a columns set for legacy Columns() api
193struct ImGuiPopupData; // Storage for current popup stack
194struct ImGuiSettingsHandler; // Storage for one type registered in the .ini file
195struct ImGuiStyleMod; // Stacked style modifier, backup of modified data so we can restore it
196struct ImGuiStyleVarInfo; // Style variable information (e.g. to access style variables from an enum)
197struct ImGuiTabBar; // Storage for a tab bar
198struct ImGuiTabItem; // Storage for a tab item (within a tab bar)
199struct ImGuiTable; // Storage for a table
200struct ImGuiTableHeaderData; // Storage for TableAngledHeadersRow()
201struct ImGuiTableColumn; // Storage for one column of a table
202struct ImGuiTableInstanceData; // Storage for one instance of a same table
203struct ImGuiTableTempData; // Temporary storage for one table (one per table in the stack), shared between tables.
204struct ImGuiTableSettings; // Storage for a table .ini settings
205struct ImGuiTableColumnsSettings; // Storage for a column .ini settings
206struct ImGuiTreeNodeStackData; // Temporary storage for TreeNode().
207struct ImGuiTypingSelectState; // Storage for GetTypingSelectRequest()
208struct ImGuiTypingSelectRequest; // Storage for GetTypingSelectRequest() (aimed to be public)
209struct ImGuiWindow; // Storage for one window
210struct ImGuiWindowDockStyle; // Storage for window-style data which needs to be stored for docking purpose
211struct ImGuiWindowTempData; // Temporary storage for one window (that's the data which in theory we could ditch at the
212 // end of the frame, in practice we currently keep it for each window)
213struct ImGuiWindowSettings; // Storage for a window .ini settings (we keep one of those even if the actual window wasn't
214 // instanced during this session)
215
216// Enumerations
217// Use your programming IDE "Go to definition" facility on the names of the center columns to find the actual flags/enum
218// lists.
219enum ImGuiLocKey : int; // -> enum ImGuiLocKey // Enum: a localization entry for translation.
220typedef int ImGuiDataAuthority; // -> enum ImGuiDataAuthority_ // Enum: for storing the source authority (dock node
221 // vs window) of a field
222typedef int ImGuiLayoutType; // -> enum ImGuiLayoutType_ // Enum: Horizontal or vertical
223
224// Flags
225typedef int ImGuiActivateFlags; // -> enum ImGuiActivateFlags_ // Flags: for navigation/focus function (will be for
226 // ActivateItem() later)
227typedef int ImGuiDebugLogFlags; // -> enum ImGuiDebugLogFlags_ // Flags: for ShowDebugLogWindow(), g.DebugLogFlags
228typedef int ImGuiFocusRequestFlags; // -> enum ImGuiFocusRequestFlags_ // Flags: for FocusWindow()
229typedef int ImGuiItemStatusFlags; // -> enum ImGuiItemStatusFlags_ // Flags: for g.LastItemData.StatusFlags
230typedef int ImGuiOldColumnFlags; // -> enum ImGuiOldColumnFlags_ // Flags: for BeginColumns()
231typedef int ImGuiLogFlags; // -> enum ImGuiLogFlags_ // Flags: for LogBegin() text capturing function
232typedef int ImGuiNavRenderCursorFlags; // -> enum ImGuiNavRenderCursorFlags_//Flags: for RenderNavCursor()
233typedef int ImGuiNavMoveFlags; // -> enum ImGuiNavMoveFlags_ // Flags: for navigation requests
234typedef int ImGuiNextItemDataFlags; // -> enum ImGuiNextItemDataFlags_ // Flags: for SetNextItemXXX() functions
235typedef int ImGuiNextWindowDataFlags; // -> enum ImGuiNextWindowDataFlags_// Flags: for SetNextWindowXXX() functions
236typedef int ImGuiScrollFlags; // -> enum ImGuiScrollFlags_ // Flags: for ScrollToItem() and navigation requests
237typedef int ImGuiSeparatorFlags; // -> enum ImGuiSeparatorFlags_ // Flags: for SeparatorEx()
238typedef int ImGuiTextFlags; // -> enum ImGuiTextFlags_ // Flags: for TextEx()
239typedef int ImGuiTooltipFlags; // -> enum ImGuiTooltipFlags_ // Flags: for BeginTooltipEx()
240typedef int ImGuiTypingSelectFlags; // -> enum ImGuiTypingSelectFlags_ // Flags: for GetTypingSelectRequest()
241typedef int ImGuiWindowRefreshFlags; // -> enum ImGuiWindowRefreshFlags_ // Flags: for SetNextWindowRefreshPolicy()
242

244// [SECTION] Context pointer
245// See implementation of this variable in imgui.cpp for comments and details.
246//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

248#ifndef GImGui
249extern IMGUI_API ImGuiContext *GImGui; // Current implicit context pointer
250#endif

256// Internal Drag and Drop payload types. String starting with '_' are reserved for Dear ImGui.
257#define IMGUI_PAYLOAD_TYPE_WINDOW "_IMWINDOW" // Payload == ImGuiWindow*
258
259// Debug Printing Into TTY
260// (since IMGUI_VERSION_NUM >= 18729: IMGUI_DEBUG_LOG was reworked into IMGUI_DEBUG_PRINTF (and removed framecount from
261// it). If you were using a #define IMGUI_DEBUG_LOG please rename)
262#ifndef IMGUI_DEBUG_PRINTF
263#ifndef IMGUI_DISABLE_DEFAULT_FORMAT_FUNCTIONS
264#define IMGUI_DEBUG_PRINTF(_FMT, ...) printf(_FMT, __VA_ARGS__)
265#else
266#define IMGUI_DEBUG_PRINTF(_FMT, ...) ((void)0)
267#endif
268#endif
269
270// Debug Logging for ShowDebugLogWindow(). This is designed for relatively rare events so please don't spam.
271#define IMGUI_DEBUG_LOG_ERROR(...) \
272 do \
273 { \
274 if (g.DebugLogFlags & ImGuiDebugLogFlags_EventError) \
275 IMGUI_DEBUG_LOG(__VA_ARGS__); \
276 else \
277 g.DebugLogSkippedErrors++; \
278 } while (0)
279#define IMGUI_DEBUG_LOG_ACTIVEID(...) \
280 do \
281 { \
282 if (g.DebugLogFlags & ImGuiDebugLogFlags_EventActiveId) \
283 IMGUI_DEBUG_LOG(__VA_ARGS__); \
284 } while (0)
285#define IMGUI_DEBUG_LOG_FOCUS(...) \
286 do \
287 { \
288 if (g.DebugLogFlags & ImGuiDebugLogFlags_EventFocus) \
289 IMGUI_DEBUG_LOG(__VA_ARGS__); \
290 } while (0)
291#define IMGUI_DEBUG_LOG_POPUP(...) \
292 do \
293 { \
294 if (g.DebugLogFlags & ImGuiDebugLogFlags_EventPopup) \
295 IMGUI_DEBUG_LOG(__VA_ARGS__); \
296 } while (0)
297#define IMGUI_DEBUG_LOG_NAV(...) \
298 do \
299 { \
300 if (g.DebugLogFlags & ImGuiDebugLogFlags_EventNav) \
301 IMGUI_DEBUG_LOG(__VA_ARGS__); \
302 } while (0)
303#define IMGUI_DEBUG_LOG_SELECTION(...) \
304 do \
305 { \
306 if (g.DebugLogFlags & ImGuiDebugLogFlags_EventSelection) \
307 IMGUI_DEBUG_LOG(__VA_ARGS__); \
308 } while (0)
309#define IMGUI_DEBUG_LOG_CLIPPER(...) \
310 do \
311 { \
312 if (g.DebugLogFlags & ImGuiDebugLogFlags_EventClipper) \
313 IMGUI_DEBUG_LOG(__VA_ARGS__); \
314 } while (0)
315#define IMGUI_DEBUG_LOG_IO(...) \
316 do \
317 { \
318 if (g.DebugLogFlags & ImGuiDebugLogFlags_EventIO) \
319 IMGUI_DEBUG_LOG(__VA_ARGS__); \
320 } while (0)
321#define IMGUI_DEBUG_LOG_FONT(...) \
322 do \
323 { \
324 if (g.DebugLogFlags & ImGuiDebugLogFlags_EventFont) \
325 IMGUI_DEBUG_LOG(__VA_ARGS__); \
326 } while (0)
327#define IMGUI_DEBUG_LOG_INPUTROUTING(...) \
328 do \
329 { \
330 if (g.DebugLogFlags & ImGuiDebugLogFlags_EventInputRouting) \
331 IMGUI_DEBUG_LOG(__VA_ARGS__); \
332 } while (0)
333#define IMGUI_DEBUG_LOG_DOCKING(...) \
334 do \
335 { \
336 if (g.DebugLogFlags & ImGuiDebugLogFlags_EventDocking) \
337 IMGUI_DEBUG_LOG(__VA_ARGS__); \
338 } while (0)
339#define IMGUI_DEBUG_LOG_VIEWPORT(...) \
340 do \
341 { \
342 if (g.DebugLogFlags & ImGuiDebugLogFlags_EventViewport) \
343 IMGUI_DEBUG_LOG(__VA_ARGS__); \
344 } while (0)
345
346// Static Asserts
347#define IM_STATIC_ASSERT(_COND) static_assert(_COND, "")
348
349// "Paranoid" Debug Asserts are meant to only be enabled during specific debugging/work, otherwise would slow down the
350// code too much. We currently don't have many of those so the effect is currently negligible, but onward intent to add
351// more aggressive ones in the code.
352// #define IMGUI_DEBUG_PARANOID
353#ifdef IMGUI_DEBUG_PARANOID
354#define IM_ASSERT_PARANOID(_EXPR) IM_ASSERT(_EXPR)
355#else
356#define IM_ASSERT_PARANOID(_EXPR)
357#endif
358
359// Misc Macros
360#define IM_PI 3.14159265358979323846f
361#ifdef _WIN32
362#define IM_NEWLINE \
363 "\r\n" // Play it nice with Windows users (Update: since 2018-05, Notepad finally appears to support Unix-style
364 // carriage returns!)
365#else
366#define IM_NEWLINE "\n"
367#endif
368#ifndef IM_TABSIZE // Until we move this to runtime and/or add proper tab support, at least allow users to compile-time
369 // override
370#define IM_TABSIZE (4)
371#endif
372#define IM_MEMALIGN(_OFF, _ALIGN) \
373 (((_OFF) + ((_ALIGN) - 1)) & \
374 ~((_ALIGN) - 1)) // Memory align e.g. IM_ALIGN(0,4)=0, IM_ALIGN(1,4)=4, IM_ALIGN(4,4)=4, IM_ALIGN(5,4)=8
375#define IM_F32_TO_INT8_UNBOUND(_VAL) \
376 ((int)((_VAL) * 255.0f + ((_VAL) >= 0 ? 0.5f : -0.5f))) // Unsaturated, for display purpose
377#define IM_F32_TO_INT8_SAT(_VAL) ((int)(ImSaturate(_VAL) * 255.0f + 0.5f)) // Saturated, always output 0..255
378#define IM_TRUNC(_VAL) ((float)(int)(_VAL)) // ImTrunc() is not inlined in MSVC debug builds
379#define IM_ROUND(_VAL) ((float)(int)((_VAL) + 0.5f)) //
380#define IM_STRINGIFY_HELPER(_X) #_X
381#define IM_STRINGIFY(_X) IM_STRINGIFY_HELPER(_X) // Preprocessor idiom to stringify e.g. an integer.
382#ifndef IMGUI_DISABLE_OBSOLETE_FUNCTIONS
383#define IM_FLOOR IM_TRUNC
384#endif
385
386// Hint for branch prediction
387#if (defined(__cplusplus) && (__cplusplus >= 202002L)) || (defined(_MSVC_LANG) && (_MSVC_LANG >= 202002L))
388#define IM_LIKELY [[likely]]
389#define IM_UNLIKELY [[unlikely]]
390#else
391#define IM_LIKELY
392#define IM_UNLIKELY
393#endif
394
395// Enforce cdecl calling convention for functions called by the standard library, in case compilation settings changed
396// the default to e.g. __vectorcall
397#ifdef _MSC_VER
398#define IMGUI_CDECL __cdecl
399#else
400#define IMGUI_CDECL
401#endif
402
403// Warnings
404#if defined(_MSC_VER) && !defined(__clang__)
405#define IM_MSVC_WARNING_SUPPRESS(XXXX) __pragma(warning(suppress : XXXX))
406#else
407#define IM_MSVC_WARNING_SUPPRESS(XXXX)
408#endif
409
410// Debug Tools
411// Use 'Metrics/Debugger->Tools->Item Picker' to break into the call-stack of a specific item.
412// This will call IM_DEBUG_BREAK() which you may redefine yourself. See https://github.com/scottt/debugbreak for more
413// reference.
414#ifndef IM_DEBUG_BREAK
415#if defined(_MSC_VER)
416#define IM_DEBUG_BREAK() __debugbreak()
417#elif defined(__clang__)
418#define IM_DEBUG_BREAK() __builtin_debugtrap()
419#elif defined(__GNUC__) && (defined(__i386__) || defined(__x86_64__))
420#define IM_DEBUG_BREAK() __asm__ volatile("int3;nop")
421#elif defined(__GNUC__) && defined(__thumb__)
422#define IM_DEBUG_BREAK() __asm__ volatile(".inst 0xde01")
423#elif defined(__GNUC__) && defined(__arm__) && !defined(__thumb__)
424#define IM_DEBUG_BREAK() __asm__ volatile(".inst 0xe7f001f0")
425#else
426#define IM_DEBUG_BREAK() \
427 IM_ASSERT(0) // It is expected that you define IM_DEBUG_BREAK() into something that will break nicely in a debugger!
428#endif
429#endif // #ifndef IM_DEBUG_BREAK
430
431// Format specifiers, printing 64-bit hasn't been decently standardized...
432// In a real application you should be using PRId64 and PRIu64 from <inttypes.h> (non-windows) and on Windows define
433// them yourself.
434#if defined(_MSC_VER) && !defined(__clang__)
435#define IM_PRId64 "I64d"
436#define IM_PRIu64 "I64u"
437#define IM_PRIX64 "I64X"
438#else
439#define IM_PRId64 "lld"
440#define IM_PRIu64 "llu"
441#define IM_PRIX64 "llX"
442#endif
443
444//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
445// [SECTION] Generic helpers
446// Note that the ImXXX helpers functions are lower-level than ImGui functions.
447// ImGui functions or the ImGui context are never called/used from other ImXXX functions.
448//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
449// - Helpers: Hashing
450// - Helpers: Sorting
451// - Helpers: Bit manipulation
452// - Helpers: String
453// - Helpers: Formatting
454// - Helpers: UTF-8 <> wchar conversions
455// - Helpers: ImVec2/ImVec4 operators
456// - Helpers: Maths
457// - Helpers: Geometry
458// - Helper: ImVec1
459// - Helper: ImVec2ih
460// - Helper: ImRect
461// - Helper: ImBitArray
462// - Helper: ImBitVector
463// - Helper: ImSpan<>, ImSpanAllocator<>
464// - Helper: ImPool<>
465// - Helper: ImChunkStream<>
466// - Helper: ImGuiTextIndex
467// - Helper: ImGuiStorage
468//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
469
470// Helpers: Hashing
471IMGUI_API ImGuiID ImHashData(const void *data, size_t data_size, ImGuiID seed = 0);
472IMGUI_API ImGuiID ImHashStr(const char *data, size_t data_size = 0, ImGuiID seed = 0);
473
474// Helpers: Sorting
475#ifndef ImQsort
476static inline void ImQsort(void *base, size_t count, size_t size_of_element,
477 int(IMGUI_CDECL *compare_func)(void const *, void const *))
478{
479 if (count > 1)
480 qsort(base, count, size_of_element, compare_func);
481}
482#endif
483
484// Helpers: Color Blending
485IMGUI_API ImU32 ImAlphaBlendColors(ImU32 col_a, ImU32 col_b);
486
487// Helpers: Bit manipulation
488static inline bool ImIsPowerOfTwo(int v)
489{
490 return v != 0 && (v & (v - 1)) == 0;
491}
492static inline bool ImIsPowerOfTwo(ImU64 v)
493{
494 return v != 0 && (v & (v - 1)) == 0;
495}
496static inline int ImUpperPowerOfTwo(int v)
497{
498 v--;
499 v |= v >> 1;
500 v |= v >> 2;
501 v |= v >> 4;
502 v |= v >> 8;
503 v |= v >> 16;
504 v++;
505 return v;
506}
507static inline unsigned int ImCountSetBits(unsigned int v)
508{
509 unsigned int count = 0;
510 while (v > 0)
511 {
512 v = v & (v - 1);
513 count++;
514 }
515 return count;
516}
517
518// Helpers: String
519#define ImStrlen strlen
520#define ImMemchr memchr
521IMGUI_API int ImStricmp(const char *str1, const char *str2); // Case insensitive compare.
522IMGUI_API int ImStrnicmp(const char *str1, const char *str2,
523 size_t count); // Case insensitive compare to a certain count.
524IMGUI_API void ImStrncpy(char *dst, const char *src,
525 size_t count); // Copy to a certain count and always zero terminate (strncpy doesn't).
526IMGUI_API char *ImStrdup(const char *str); // Duplicate a string.
527IMGUI_API char *ImStrdupcpy(char *dst, size_t *p_dst_size,
528 const char *str); // Copy in provided buffer, recreate buffer if needed.
529IMGUI_API const char *ImStrchrRange(const char *str_begin, const char *str_end,
530 char c); // Find first occurrence of 'c' in string range.
531IMGUI_API const char *ImStreolRange(const char *str, const char *str_end); // End end-of-line
532IMGUI_API const char *ImStristr(const char *haystack, const char *haystack_end, const char *needle,
533 const char *needle_end); // Find a substring in a string range.
534IMGUI_API void ImStrTrimBlanks(char *str); // Remove leading and trailing blanks from a buffer.
535IMGUI_API const char *ImStrSkipBlank(const char *str); // Find first non-blank character.
536IMGUI_API int ImStrlenW(const ImWchar *str); // Computer string length (ImWchar string)
537IMGUI_API const char *ImStrbol(const char *buf_mid_line, const char *buf_begin); // Find beginning-of-line
538IM_MSVC_RUNTIME_CHECKS_OFF
539static inline char ImToUpper(char c)
540{
541 return (c >= 'a' && c <= 'z') ? c &= ~32 : c;
542}
543static inline bool ImCharIsBlankA(char c)
544{
545 return c == ' ' || c == '\t';
546}
547static inline bool ImCharIsBlankW(unsigned int c)
548{
549 return c == ' ' || c == '\t' || c == 0x3000;
550}
551static inline bool ImCharIsXdigitA(char c)
552{
553 return (c >= '0' && c <= '9') || (c >= 'A' && c <= 'F') || (c >= 'a' && c <= 'f');
554}
555IM_MSVC_RUNTIME_CHECKS_RESTORE
556
557// Helpers: Formatting
558IMGUI_API int ImFormatString(char *buf, size_t buf_size, const char *fmt, ...) IM_FMTARGS(3);
559IMGUI_API int ImFormatStringV(char *buf, size_t buf_size, const char *fmt, va_list args) IM_FMTLIST(3);
560IMGUI_API void ImFormatStringToTempBuffer(const char **out_buf, const char **out_buf_end, const char *fmt, ...)
561 IM_FMTARGS(3);
562IMGUI_API void ImFormatStringToTempBufferV(const char **out_buf, const char **out_buf_end, const char *fmt,
563 va_list args) IM_FMTLIST(3);
564IMGUI_API const char *ImParseFormatFindStart(const char *format);
565IMGUI_API const char *ImParseFormatFindEnd(const char *format);
566IMGUI_API const char *ImParseFormatTrimDecorations(const char *format, char *buf, size_t buf_size);
567IMGUI_API void ImParseFormatSanitizeForPrinting(const char *fmt_in, char *fmt_out, size_t fmt_out_size);
568IMGUI_API const char *ImParseFormatSanitizeForScanning(const char *fmt_in, char *fmt_out, size_t fmt_out_size);
569IMGUI_API int ImParseFormatPrecision(const char *format, int default_value);
570
571// Helpers: UTF-8 <> wchar conversions
572IMGUI_API const char *ImTextCharToUtf8(char out_buf[5], unsigned int c); // return out_buf
573IMGUI_API int ImTextStrToUtf8(char *out_buf, int out_buf_size, const ImWchar *in_text,
574 const ImWchar *in_text_end); // return output UTF-8 bytes count
575IMGUI_API int ImTextCharFromUtf8(unsigned int *out_char, const char *in_text,
576 const char *in_text_end); // read one character. return input UTF-8 bytes count
577IMGUI_API int ImTextStrFromUtf8(ImWchar *out_buf, int out_buf_size, const char *in_text, const char *in_text_end,
578 const char **in_remaining = NULL); // return input UTF-8 bytes count
579IMGUI_API int ImTextCountCharsFromUtf8(const char *in_text,
580 const char *in_text_end); // return number of UTF-8 code-points (NOT bytes count)
581IMGUI_API int ImTextCountUtf8BytesFromChar(
582 const char *in_text, const char *in_text_end); // return number of bytes to express one char in UTF-8
583IMGUI_API int ImTextCountUtf8BytesFromStr(
584 const ImWchar *in_text, const ImWchar *in_text_end); // return number of bytes to express string in UTF-8
585IMGUI_API const char *ImTextFindPreviousUtf8Codepoint(const char *in_text_start,
586 const char *in_text_curr); // return previous UTF-8 code-point.
587IMGUI_API int ImTextCountLines(const char *in_text,
588 const char *in_text_end); // return number of lines taken by text. trailing carriage
589 // return doesn't count as an extra line.
590
591// Helpers: File System
592#ifdef IMGUI_DISABLE_FILE_FUNCTIONS
593#define IMGUI_DISABLE_DEFAULT_FILE_FUNCTIONS
594typedef void *ImFileHandle;
595static inline ImFileHandle ImFileOpen(const char *, const char *)
596{
597 return NULL;
598}
599static inline bool ImFileClose(ImFileHandle)
600{
601 return false;
602}
603static inline ImU64 ImFileGetSize(ImFileHandle)
604{
605 return (ImU64)-1;
606}
607static inline ImU64 ImFileRead(void *, ImU64, ImU64, ImFileHandle)
608{
609 return 0;
610}
611static inline ImU64 ImFileWrite(const void *, ImU64, ImU64, ImFileHandle)
612{
613 return 0;
614}
615#endif
616#ifndef IMGUI_DISABLE_DEFAULT_FILE_FUNCTIONS
617typedef FILE *ImFileHandle;
618IMGUI_API ImFileHandle ImFileOpen(const char *filename, const char *mode);
619IMGUI_API bool ImFileClose(ImFileHandle file);
620IMGUI_API ImU64 ImFileGetSize(ImFileHandle file);
621IMGUI_API ImU64 ImFileRead(void *data, ImU64 size, ImU64 count, ImFileHandle file);
622IMGUI_API ImU64 ImFileWrite(const void *data, ImU64 size, ImU64 count, ImFileHandle file);
623#else
624#define IMGUI_DISABLE_TTY_FUNCTIONS // Can't use stdout, fflush if we are not using default file functions
625#endif
626IMGUI_API void *ImFileLoadToMemory(const char *filename, const char *mode, size_t *out_file_size = NULL,
627 int padding_bytes = 0);
628
629// Helpers: Maths
630IM_MSVC_RUNTIME_CHECKS_OFF
631// - Wrapper for standard libs functions. (Note that imgui_demo.cpp does _not_ use them to keep the code easy to copy)
632#ifndef IMGUI_DISABLE_DEFAULT_MATH_FUNCTIONS
633#define ImFabs(X) fabsf(X)
634#define ImSqrt(X) sqrtf(X)
635#define ImFmod(X, Y) fmodf((X), (Y))
636#define ImCos(X) cosf(X)
637#define ImSin(X) sinf(X)
638#define ImAcos(X) acosf(X)
639#define ImAtan2(Y, X) atan2f((Y), (X))
640#define ImAtof(STR) atof(STR)
641#define ImCeil(X) ceilf(X)
642static inline float ImPow(float x, float y)
643{
644 return powf(x, y);
645} // DragBehaviorT/SliderBehaviorT uses ImPow with either float/double and need the precision
646static inline double ImPow(double x, double y)
647{
648 return pow(x, y);
649}
650static inline float ImLog(float x)
651{
652 return logf(x);
653} // DragBehaviorT/SliderBehaviorT uses ImLog with either float/double and need the precision
654static inline double ImLog(double x)
655{
656 return log(x);
657}
658static inline int ImAbs(int x)
659{
660 return x < 0 ? -x : x;
661}
662static inline float ImAbs(float x)
663{
664 return fabsf(x);
665}
666static inline double ImAbs(double x)
667{
668 return fabs(x);
669}
670static inline float ImSign(float x)
671{
672 return (x < 0.0f) ? -1.0f : (x > 0.0f) ? 1.0f : 0.0f;
673} // Sign operator - returns -1, 0 or 1 based on sign of argument
674static inline double ImSign(double x)
675{
676 return (x < 0.0) ? -1.0 : (x > 0.0) ? 1.0 : 0.0;
677}
678#ifdef IMGUI_ENABLE_SSE
679static inline float ImRsqrt(float x)
680{
681 return _mm_cvtss_f32(_mm_rsqrt_ss(_mm_set_ss(x)));
682}
683#else
684static inline float ImRsqrt(float x)
685{
686 return 1.0f / sqrtf(x);
687}
688#endif
689static inline double ImRsqrt(double x)
690{
691 return 1.0 / sqrt(x);
692}
693#endif
694// - ImMin/ImMax/ImClamp/ImLerp/ImSwap are used by widgets which support variety of types: signed/unsigned int/long long
695// float/double (Exceptionally using templates here but we could also redefine them for those types)
696template <typename T>
697static inline T ImMin(T lhs, T rhs)
698{
699 return lhs < rhs ? lhs : rhs;
700}
701template <typename T>
702static inline T ImMax(T lhs, T rhs)
703{
704 return lhs >= rhs ? lhs : rhs;
705}
706template <typename T>
707static inline T ImClamp(T v, T mn, T mx)
708{
709 return (v < mn) ? mn : (v > mx) ? mx : v;
710}
711template <typename T>
712static inline T ImLerp(T a, T b, float t)
713{
714 return (T)(a + (b - a) * t);
715}
716template <typename T>
717static inline void ImSwap(T &a, T &b)
718{
719 T tmp = a;
720 a = b;
721 b = tmp;
722}
723template <typename T>
724static inline T ImAddClampOverflow(T a, T b, T mn, T mx)
725{
726 if (b < 0 && (a < mn - b))
727 return mn;
728 if (b > 0 && (a > mx - b))
729 return mx;
730 return a + b;
731}
732template <typename T>
733static inline T ImSubClampOverflow(T a, T b, T mn, T mx)
734{
735 if (b > 0 && (a < mn + b))
736 return mn;
737 if (b < 0 && (a > mx + b))
738 return mx;
739 return a - b;
740}
741// - Misc maths helpers
742static inline ImVec2 ImMin(const ImVec2 &lhs, const ImVec2 &rhs)
743{
744 return ImVec2(lhs.x < rhs.x ? lhs.x : rhs.x, lhs.y < rhs.y ? lhs.y : rhs.y);
745}
746static inline ImVec2 ImMax(const ImVec2 &lhs, const ImVec2 &rhs)
747{
748 return ImVec2(lhs.x >= rhs.x ? lhs.x : rhs.x, lhs.y >= rhs.y ? lhs.y : rhs.y);
749}
750static inline ImVec2 ImClamp(const ImVec2 &v, const ImVec2 &mn, const ImVec2 &mx)
751{
752 return ImVec2((v.x < mn.x) ? mn.x : (v.x > mx.x) ? mx.x : v.x, (v.y < mn.y) ? mn.y : (v.y > mx.y) ? mx.y : v.y);
753}
754static inline ImVec2 ImLerp(const ImVec2 &a, const ImVec2 &b, float t)
755{
756 return ImVec2(a.x + (b.x - a.x) * t, a.y + (b.y - a.y) * t);
757}
758static inline ImVec2 ImLerp(const ImVec2 &a, const ImVec2 &b, const ImVec2 &t)
759{
760 return ImVec2(a.x + (b.x - a.x) * t.x, a.y + (b.y - a.y) * t.y);
761}
762static inline ImVec4 ImLerp(const ImVec4 &a, const ImVec4 &b, float t)
763{
764 return ImVec4(a.x + (b.x - a.x) * t, a.y + (b.y - a.y) * t, a.z + (b.z - a.z) * t, a.w + (b.w - a.w) * t);
765}
766static inline float ImSaturate(float f)
767{
768 return (f < 0.0f) ? 0.0f : (f > 1.0f) ? 1.0f : f;
769}
770static inline float ImLengthSqr(const ImVec2 &lhs)
771{
772 return (lhs.x * lhs.x) + (lhs.y * lhs.y);
773}
774static inline float ImLengthSqr(const ImVec4 &lhs)
775{
776 return (lhs.x * lhs.x) + (lhs.y * lhs.y) + (lhs.z * lhs.z) + (lhs.w * lhs.w);
777}
778static inline float ImInvLength(const ImVec2 &lhs, float fail_value)
779{
780 float d = (lhs.x * lhs.x) + (lhs.y * lhs.y);
781 if (d > 0.0f)
782 return ImRsqrt(d);
783 return fail_value;
784}
785static inline float ImTrunc(float f)
786{
787 return (float)(int)(f);
788}
789static inline ImVec2 ImTrunc(const ImVec2 &v)
790{
791 return ImVec2((float)(int)(v.x), (float)(int)(v.y));
792}
793static inline float ImFloor(float f)
794{
795 return (float)((f >= 0 || (float)(int)f == f) ? (int)f : (int)f - 1);
796} // Decent replacement for floorf()
797static inline ImVec2 ImFloor(const ImVec2 &v)
798{
799 return ImVec2(ImFloor(v.x), ImFloor(v.y));
800}
801static inline int ImModPositive(int a, int b)
802{
803 return (a + b) % b;
804}
805static inline float ImDot(const ImVec2 &a, const ImVec2 &b)
806{
807 return a.x * b.x + a.y * b.y;
808}
809static inline ImVec2 ImRotate(const ImVec2 &v, float cos_a, float sin_a)
810{
811 return ImVec2(v.x * cos_a - v.y * sin_a, v.x * sin_a + v.y * cos_a);
812}
813static inline float ImLinearSweep(float current, float target, float speed)
814{
815 if (current < target)
816 return ImMin(current + speed, target);
817 if (current > target)
818 return ImMax(current - speed, target);
819 return current;
820}
821static inline float ImLinearRemapClamp(float s0, float s1, float d0, float d1, float x)
822{
823 return ImSaturate((x - s0) / (s1 - s0)) * (d1 - d0) + d0;
824}
825static inline ImVec2 ImMul(const ImVec2 &lhs, const ImVec2 &rhs)
826{
827 return ImVec2(lhs.x * rhs.x, lhs.y * rhs.y);
828}
829static inline bool ImIsFloatAboveGuaranteedIntegerPrecision(float f)
830{
831 return f <= -16777216 || f >= 16777216;
832}
833static inline float ImExponentialMovingAverage(float avg, float sample, int n)
834{
835 avg -= avg / n;
836 avg += sample / n;
837 return avg;
838}
839IM_MSVC_RUNTIME_CHECKS_RESTORE
840
841// Helpers: Geometry
842IMGUI_API ImVec2 ImBezierCubicCalc(const ImVec2 &p1, const ImVec2 &p2, const ImVec2 &p3, const ImVec2 &p4, float t);
843IMGUI_API ImVec2 ImBezierCubicClosestPoint(const ImVec2 &p1, const ImVec2 &p2, const ImVec2 &p3, const ImVec2 &p4,
844 const ImVec2 &p,
845 int num_segments); // For curves with explicit number of segments
846IMGUI_API ImVec2 ImBezierCubicClosestPointCasteljau(
847 const ImVec2 &p1, const ImVec2 &p2, const ImVec2 &p3, const ImVec2 &p4, const ImVec2 &p,
848 float tess_tol); // For auto-tessellated curves you can use tess_tol = style.CurveTessellationTol
849IMGUI_API ImVec2 ImBezierQuadraticCalc(const ImVec2 &p1, const ImVec2 &p2, const ImVec2 &p3, float t);
850IMGUI_API ImVec2 ImLineClosestPoint(const ImVec2 &a, const ImVec2 &b, const ImVec2 &p);
851IMGUI_API bool ImTriangleContainsPoint(const ImVec2 &a, const ImVec2 &b, const ImVec2 &c, const ImVec2 &p);
852IMGUI_API ImVec2 ImTriangleClosestPoint(const ImVec2 &a, const ImVec2 &b, const ImVec2 &c, const ImVec2 &p);
853IMGUI_API void ImTriangleBarycentricCoords(const ImVec2 &a, const ImVec2 &b, const ImVec2 &c, const ImVec2 &p,
854 float &out_u, float &out_v, float &out_w);
855inline float ImTriangleArea(const ImVec2 &a, const ImVec2 &b, const ImVec2 &c)
856{
857 return ImFabs((a.x * (b.y - c.y)) + (b.x * (c.y - a.y)) + (c.x * (a.y - b.y))) * 0.5f;
858}
859inline bool ImTriangleIsClockwise(const ImVec2 &a, const ImVec2 &b, const ImVec2 &c)
860{
861 return ((b.x - a.x) * (c.y - b.y)) - ((c.x - b.x) * (b.y - a.y)) > 0.0f;
862}
863
864// Helper: ImVec1 (1D vector)
865// (this odd construct is used to facilitate the transition between 1D and 2D, and the maintenance of some
866// branches/patches)
867IM_MSVC_RUNTIME_CHECKS_OFF
868struct ImVec1
869{
870 float x;
871 constexpr ImVec1() : x(0.0f)
872 {
873 }
874 constexpr ImVec1(float _x) : x(_x)
875 {
876 }
877};
878
879// Helper: ImVec2ih (2D vector, half-size integer, for long-term packed storage)
880struct ImVec2ih
881{
882 short x, y;
883 constexpr ImVec2ih() : x(0), y(0)
884 {
885 }
886 constexpr ImVec2ih(short _x, short _y) : x(_x), y(_y)
887 {
888 }
889 constexpr explicit ImVec2ih(const ImVec2 &rhs) : x((short)rhs.x), y((short)rhs.y)
890 {
891 }
892};
893
894// Helper: ImRect (2D axis aligned bounding-box)
895// NB: we can't rely on ImVec2 math operators being available here!
896struct IMGUI_API ImRect
897{
898 ImVec2 Min; // Upper-left
899 ImVec2 Max; // Lower-right
900
901 constexpr ImRect() : Min(0.0f, 0.0f), Max(0.0f, 0.0f)
902 {
903 }
904 constexpr ImRect(const ImVec2 &min, const ImVec2 &max) : Min(min), Max(max)
905 {
906 }
907 constexpr ImRect(const ImVec4 &v) : Min(v.x, v.y), Max(v.z, v.w)
908 {
909 }
910 constexpr ImRect(float x1, float y1, float x2, float y2) : Min(x1, y1), Max(x2, y2)
911 {
912 }
913
914 ImVec2 GetCenter() const
915 {
916 return ImVec2((Min.x + Max.x) * 0.5f, (Min.y + Max.y) * 0.5f);
917 }
918 ImVec2 GetSize() const
919 {
920 return ImVec2(Max.x - Min.x, Max.y - Min.y);
921 }
922 float GetWidth() const
923 {
924 return Max.x - Min.x;
925 }
926 float GetHeight() const
927 {
928 return Max.y - Min.y;
929 }
930 float GetArea() const
931 {
932 return (Max.x - Min.x) * (Max.y - Min.y);
933 }
934 ImVec2 GetTL() const
935 {
936 return Min;
937 } // Top-left
938 ImVec2 GetTR() const
939 {
940 return ImVec2(Max.x, Min.y);
941 } // Top-right
942 ImVec2 GetBL() const
943 {
944 return ImVec2(Min.x, Max.y);
945 } // Bottom-left
946 ImVec2 GetBR() const
947 {
948 return Max;
949 } // Bottom-right
950 bool Contains(const ImVec2 &p) const
951 {
952 return p.x >= Min.x && p.y >= Min.y && p.x < Max.x && p.y < Max.y;
953 }
954 bool Contains(const ImRect &r) const
955 {
956 return r.Min.x >= Min.x && r.Min.y >= Min.y && r.Max.x <= Max.x && r.Max.y <= Max.y;
957 }
958 bool ContainsWithPad(const ImVec2 &p, const ImVec2 &pad) const
959 {
960 return p.x >= Min.x - pad.x && p.y >= Min.y - pad.y && p.x < Max.x + pad.x && p.y < Max.y + pad.y;
961 }
962 bool Overlaps(const ImRect &r) const
963 {
964 return r.Min.y < Max.y && r.Max.y > Min.y && r.Min.x < Max.x && r.Max.x > Min.x;
965 }
966 void Add(const ImVec2 &p)
967 {
968 if (Min.x > p.x)
969 Min.x = p.x;
970 if (Min.y > p.y)
971 Min.y = p.y;
972 if (Max.x < p.x)
973 Max.x = p.x;
974 if (Max.y < p.y)
975 Max.y = p.y;
976 }
977 void Add(const ImRect &r)
978 {
979 if (Min.x > r.Min.x)
980 Min.x = r.Min.x;
981 if (Min.y > r.Min.y)
982 Min.y = r.Min.y;
983 if (Max.x < r.Max.x)
984 Max.x = r.Max.x;
985 if (Max.y < r.Max.y)
986 Max.y = r.Max.y;
987 }
988 void Expand(const float amount)
989 {
990 Min.x -= amount;
991 Min.y -= amount;
992 Max.x += amount;
993 Max.y += amount;
994 }
995 void Expand(const ImVec2 &amount)
996 {
997 Min.x -= amount.x;
998 Min.y -= amount.y;
999 Max.x += amount.x;
1000 Max.y += amount.y;
1001 }
1002 void Translate(const ImVec2 &d)
1003 {
1004 Min.x += d.x;
1005 Min.y += d.y;
1006 Max.x += d.x;
1007 Max.y += d.y;
1008 }
1009 void TranslateX(float dx)
1010 {
1011 Min.x += dx;
1012 Max.x += dx;
1013 }
1014 void TranslateY(float dy)
1015 {
1016 Min.y += dy;
1017 Max.y += dy;
1018 }
1019 void ClipWith(const ImRect &r)
1020 {
1021 Min = ImMax(Min, r.Min);
1022 Max = ImMin(Max, r.Max);
1023 } // Simple version, may lead to an inverted rectangle, which is fine for Contains/Overlaps test but not for
1024 // display.
1025 void ClipWithFull(const ImRect &r)
1026 {
1027 Min = ImClamp(Min, r.Min, r.Max);
1028 Max = ImClamp(Max, r.Min, r.Max);
1029 } // Full version, ensure both points are fully clipped.
1030 void Floor()
1031 {
1032 Min.x = IM_TRUNC(Min.x);
1033 Min.y = IM_TRUNC(Min.y);
1034 Max.x = IM_TRUNC(Max.x);
1035 Max.y = IM_TRUNC(Max.y);
1036 }
1037 bool IsInverted() const
1038 {
1039 return Min.x > Max.x || Min.y > Max.y;
1040 }
1041 ImVec4 ToVec4() const
1042 {
1043 return ImVec4(Min.x, Min.y, Max.x, Max.y);
1044 }
1045};
1046
1047// Helper: ImBitArray
1048#define IM_BITARRAY_TESTBIT(_ARRAY, _N) \
1049 ((_ARRAY[(_N) >> 5] & ((ImU32)1 << ((_N) & 31))) != \
1050 0) // Macro version of ImBitArrayTestBit(): ensure args have side-effect or are costly!
1051#define IM_BITARRAY_CLEARBIT(_ARRAY, _N) \
1052 ((_ARRAY[(_N) >> 5] &= \
1053 ~((ImU32)1 << ((_N) & \
1054 31)))) // Macro version of ImBitArrayClearBit(): ensure args have side-effect or are costly!
1055inline size_t ImBitArrayGetStorageSizeInBytes(int bitcount)
1056{
1057 return (size_t)((bitcount + 31) >> 5) << 2;
1058}
1059inline void ImBitArrayClearAllBits(ImU32 *arr, int bitcount)
1060{
1061 memset(arr, 0, ImBitArrayGetStorageSizeInBytes(bitcount));
1062}
1063inline bool ImBitArrayTestBit(const ImU32 *arr, int n)
1064{
1065 ImU32 mask = (ImU32)1 << (n & 31);
1066 return (arr[n >> 5] & mask) != 0;
1067}
1068inline void ImBitArrayClearBit(ImU32 *arr, int n)
1069{
1070 ImU32 mask = (ImU32)1 << (n & 31);
1071 arr[n >> 5] &= ~mask;
1072}
1073inline void ImBitArraySetBit(ImU32 *arr, int n)
1074{
1075 ImU32 mask = (ImU32)1 << (n & 31);
1076 arr[n >> 5] |= mask;
1077}
1078inline void ImBitArraySetBitRange(ImU32 *arr, int n, int n2) // Works on range [n..n2)
1079{
1080 n2--;
1081 while (n <= n2)
1082 {
1083 int a_mod = (n & 31);
1084 int b_mod = (n2 > (n | 31) ? 31 : (n2 & 31)) + 1;
1085 ImU32 mask = (ImU32)(((ImU64)1 << b_mod) - 1) & ~(ImU32)(((ImU64)1 << a_mod) - 1);
1086 arr[n >> 5] |= mask;
1087 n = (n + 32) & ~31;
1088 }
1089}
1090
1091typedef ImU32 *ImBitArrayPtr; // Name for use in structs
1092
1093// Helper: ImBitArray class (wrapper over ImBitArray functions)
1094// Store 1-bit per value.
1095template <int BITCOUNT, int OFFSET = 0>
1096struct ImBitArray
1097{
1098 ImU32 Storage[(BITCOUNT + 31) >> 5];
1099 ImBitArray()
1100 {
1101 ClearAllBits();
1102 }
1103 void ClearAllBits()
1104 {
1105 memset(Storage, 0, sizeof(Storage));
1106 }
1107 void SetAllBits()
1108 {
1109 memset(Storage, 255, sizeof(Storage));
1110 }
1111 bool TestBit(int n) const
1112 {
1113 n += OFFSET;
1114 IM_ASSERT(n >= 0 && n < BITCOUNT);
1115 return IM_BITARRAY_TESTBIT(Storage, n);
1116 }
1117 void SetBit(int n)
1118 {
1119 n += OFFSET;
1120 IM_ASSERT(n >= 0 && n < BITCOUNT);
1121 ImBitArraySetBit(Storage, n);
1122 }
1123 void ClearBit(int n)
1124 {
1125 n += OFFSET;
1126 IM_ASSERT(n >= 0 && n < BITCOUNT);
1127 ImBitArrayClearBit(Storage, n);
1128 }
1129 void SetBitRange(int n, int n2)
1130 {
1131 n += OFFSET;
1132 n2 += OFFSET;
1133 IM_ASSERT(n >= 0 && n < BITCOUNT && n2 > n && n2 <= BITCOUNT);
1134 ImBitArraySetBitRange(Storage, n, n2);
1135 } // Works on range [n..n2)
1136 bool operator[](int n) const
1137 {
1138 n += OFFSET;
1139 IM_ASSERT(n >= 0 && n < BITCOUNT);
1140 return IM_BITARRAY_TESTBIT(Storage, n);
1141 }
1142};
1143
1144// Helper: ImBitVector
1145// Store 1-bit per value.
1146struct IMGUI_API ImBitVector
1147{
1148 ImVector<ImU32> Storage;
1149 void Create(int sz)
1150 {
1151 Storage.resize((sz + 31) >> 5);
1152 memset(Storage.Data, 0, (size_t)Storage.Size * sizeof(Storage.Data[0]));
1153 }
1154 void Clear()
1155 {
1156 Storage.clear();
1157 }
1158 bool TestBit(int n) const
1159 {
1160 IM_ASSERT(n < (Storage.Size << 5));
1161 return IM_BITARRAY_TESTBIT(Storage.Data, n);
1162 }
1163 void SetBit(int n)
1164 {
1165 IM_ASSERT(n < (Storage.Size << 5));
1166 ImBitArraySetBit(Storage.Data, n);
1167 }
1168 void ClearBit(int n)
1169 {
1170 IM_ASSERT(n < (Storage.Size << 5));
1171 ImBitArrayClearBit(Storage.Data, n);
1172 }
1173};
1174IM_MSVC_RUNTIME_CHECKS_RESTORE
1175
1176// Helper: ImSpan<>
1177// Pointing to a span of data we don't own.
1178template <typename T>
1179struct ImSpan
1180{
1181 T *Data;
1182 T *DataEnd;
1183
1184 // Constructors, destructor
1185 inline ImSpan()
1186 {
1187 Data = DataEnd = NULL;
1188 }
1189 inline ImSpan(T *data, int size)
1190 {
1191 Data = data;
1192 DataEnd = data + size;
1193 }
1194 inline ImSpan(T *data, T *data_end)
1195 {
1196 Data = data;
1197 DataEnd = data_end;
1198 }
1199
1200 inline void set(T *data, int size)
1201 {
1202 Data = data;
1203 DataEnd = data + size;
1204 }
1205 inline void set(T *data, T *data_end)
1206 {
1207 Data = data;
1208 DataEnd = data_end;
1209 }
1210 inline int size() const
1211 {
1212 return (int)(ptrdiff_t)(DataEnd - Data);
1213 }
1214 inline int size_in_bytes() const
1215 {
1216 return (int)(ptrdiff_t)(DataEnd - Data) * (int)sizeof(T);
1217 }
1218 inline T &operator[](int i)
1219 {
1220 T *p = Data + i;
1221 IM_ASSERT(p >= Data && p < DataEnd);
1222 return *p;
1223 }
1224 inline const T &operator[](int i) const
1225 {
1226 const T *p = Data + i;
1227 IM_ASSERT(p >= Data && p < DataEnd);
1228 return *p;
1229 }
1230
1231 inline T *begin()
1232 {
1233 return Data;
1234 }
1235 inline const T *begin() const
1236 {
1237 return Data;
1238 }
1239 inline T *end()
1240 {
1241 return DataEnd;
1242 }
1243 inline const T *end() const
1244 {
1245 return DataEnd;
1246 }
1247
1248 // Utilities
1249 inline int index_from_ptr(const T *it) const
1250 {
1251 IM_ASSERT(it >= Data && it < DataEnd);
1252 const ptrdiff_t off = it - Data;
1253 return (int)off;
1254 }
1255};
1256
1257// Helper: ImSpanAllocator<>
1258// Facilitate storing multiple chunks into a single large block (the "arena")
1259// - Usage: call Reserve() N times, allocate GetArenaSizeInBytes() worth, pass it to SetArenaBasePtr(), call GetSpan() N
1260// times to retrieve the aligned ranges.
1261template <int CHUNKS>
1262struct ImSpanAllocator
1263{
1264 char *BasePtr;
1265 int CurrOff;
1266 int CurrIdx;
1267 int Offsets[CHUNKS];
1268 int Sizes[CHUNKS];
1269
1270 ImSpanAllocator()
1271 {
1272 memset(this, 0, sizeof(*this));
1273 }
1274 inline void Reserve(int n, size_t sz, int a = 4)
1275 {
1276 IM_ASSERT(n == CurrIdx && n < CHUNKS);
1277 CurrOff = IM_MEMALIGN(CurrOff, a);
1278 Offsets[n] = CurrOff;
1279 Sizes[n] = (int)sz;
1280 CurrIdx++;
1281 CurrOff += (int)sz;
1282 }
1283 inline int GetArenaSizeInBytes()
1284 {
1285 return CurrOff;
1286 }
1287 inline void SetArenaBasePtr(void *base_ptr)
1288 {
1289 BasePtr = (char *)base_ptr;
1290 }
1291 inline void *GetSpanPtrBegin(int n)
1292 {
1293 IM_ASSERT(n >= 0 && n < CHUNKS && CurrIdx == CHUNKS);
1294 return (void *)(BasePtr + Offsets[n]);
1295 }
1296 inline void *GetSpanPtrEnd(int n)
1297 {
1298 IM_ASSERT(n >= 0 && n < CHUNKS && CurrIdx == CHUNKS);
1299 return (void *)(BasePtr + Offsets[n] + Sizes[n]);
1300 }
1301 template <typename T>
1302 inline void GetSpan(int n, ImSpan<T> *span)
1303 {
1304 span->set((T *)GetSpanPtrBegin(n), (T *)GetSpanPtrEnd(n));
1305 }
1306};
1307
1308// Helper: ImPool<>
1309// Basic keyed storage for contiguous instances, slow/amortized insertion, O(1) indexable, O(Log N) queries by ID over a
1310// dense/hot buffer, Honor constructor/destructor. Add/remove invalidate all pointers. Indexes have the same lifetime as
1311// the associated object.
1312typedef int ImPoolIdx;
1313template <typename T>
1314struct ImPool
1315{
1316 ImVector<T> Buf; // Contiguous data
1317 ImGuiStorage Map; // ID->Index
1318 ImPoolIdx FreeIdx; // Next free idx to use
1319 ImPoolIdx AliveCount; // Number of active/alive items (for display purpose)
1320
1321 ImPool()
1322 {
1323 FreeIdx = AliveCount = 0;
1324 }
1325 ~ImPool()
1326 {
1327 Clear();
1328 }
1329 T *GetByKey(ImGuiID key)
1330 {
1331 int idx = Map.GetInt(key, -1);
1332 return (idx != -1) ? &Buf[idx] : NULL;
1333 }
1334 T *GetByIndex(ImPoolIdx n)
1335 {
1336 return &Buf[n];
1337 }
1338 ImPoolIdx GetIndex(const T *p) const
1339 {
1340 IM_ASSERT(p >= Buf.Data && p < Buf.Data + Buf.Size);
1341 return (ImPoolIdx)(p - Buf.Data);
1342 }
1343 T *GetOrAddByKey(ImGuiID key)
1344 {
1345 int *p_idx = Map.GetIntRef(key, -1);
1346 if (*p_idx != -1)
1347 return &Buf[*p_idx];
1348 *p_idx = FreeIdx;
1349 return Add();
1350 }
1351 bool Contains(const T *p) const
1352 {
1353 return (p >= Buf.Data && p < Buf.Data + Buf.Size);
1354 }
1355 void Clear()
1356 {
1357 for (int n = 0; n < Map.Data.Size; n++)
1358 {
1359 int idx = Map.Data[n].val_i;
1360 if (idx != -1)
1361 Buf[idx].~T();
1362 }
1363 Map.Clear();
1364 Buf.clear();
1365 FreeIdx = AliveCount = 0;
1366 }
1367 T *Add()
1368 {
1369 int idx = FreeIdx;
1370 if (idx == Buf.Size)
1371 {
1372 Buf.resize(Buf.Size + 1);
1373 FreeIdx++;
1374 }
1375 else
1376 {
1377 FreeIdx = *(int *)&Buf[idx];
1378 }
1379 IM_PLACEMENT_NEW(&Buf[idx]) T();
1380 AliveCount++;
1381 return &Buf[idx];
1382 }
1383 void Remove(ImGuiID key, const T *p)
1384 {
1385 Remove(key, GetIndex(p));
1386 }
1387 void Remove(ImGuiID key, ImPoolIdx idx)
1388 {
1389 Buf[idx].~T();
1390 *(int *)&Buf[idx] = FreeIdx;
1391 FreeIdx = idx;
1392 Map.SetInt(key, -1);
1393 AliveCount--;
1394 }
1395 void Reserve(int capacity)
1396 {
1397 Buf.reserve(capacity);
1398 Map.Data.reserve(capacity);
1399 }
1400
1401 // To iterate a ImPool: for (int n = 0; n < pool.GetMapSize(); n++) if (T* t = pool.TryGetMapData(n)) { ... }
1402 // Can be avoided if you know .Remove() has never been called on the pool, or AliveCount == GetMapSize()
1403 int GetAliveCount() const
1404 {
1405 return AliveCount;
1406 } // Number of active/alive items in the pool (for display purpose)
1407 int GetBufSize() const
1408 {
1409 return Buf.Size;
1410 }
1411 int GetMapSize() const
1412 {
1413 return Map.Data.Size;
1414 } // It is the map we need iterate to find valid items, since we don't have "alive" storage anywhere
1415 T *TryGetMapData(ImPoolIdx n)
1416 {
1417 int idx = Map.Data[n].val_i;
1418 if (idx == -1)
1419 return NULL;
1420 return GetByIndex(idx);
1421 }
1422};
1423
1424// Helper: ImChunkStream<>
1425// Build and iterate a contiguous stream of variable-sized structures.
1426// This is used by Settings to store persistent data while reducing allocation count.
1427// We store the chunk size first, and align the final size on 4 bytes boundaries.
1428// The tedious/zealous amount of casting is to avoid -Wcast-align warnings.
1429template <typename T>
1430struct ImChunkStream
1431{
1432 ImVector<char> Buf;
1433
1434 void clear()
1435 {
1436 Buf.clear();
1437 }
1438 bool empty() const
1439 {
1440 return Buf.Size == 0;
1441 }
1442 int size() const
1443 {
1444 return Buf.Size;
1445 }
1446 T *alloc_chunk(size_t sz)
1447 {
1448 size_t HDR_SZ = 4;
1449 sz = IM_MEMALIGN(HDR_SZ + sz, 4u);
1450 int off = Buf.Size;
1451 Buf.resize(off + (int)sz);
1452 ((int *)(void *)(Buf.Data + off))[0] = (int)sz;
1453 return (T *)(void *)(Buf.Data + off + (int)HDR_SZ);
1454 }
1455 T *begin()
1456 {
1457 size_t HDR_SZ = 4;
1458 if (!Buf.Data)
1459 return NULL;
1460 return (T *)(void *)(Buf.Data + HDR_SZ);
1461 }
1462 T *next_chunk(T *p)
1463 {
1464 size_t HDR_SZ = 4;
1465 IM_ASSERT(p >= begin() && p < end());
1466 p = (T *)(void *)((char *)(void *)p + chunk_size(p));
1467 if (p == (T *)(void *)((char *)end() + HDR_SZ))
1468 return (T *)0;
1469 IM_ASSERT(p < end());
1470 return p;
1471 }
1472 int chunk_size(const T *p)
1473 {
1474 return ((const int *)p)[-1];
1475 }
1476 T *end()
1477 {
1478 return (T *)(void *)(Buf.Data + Buf.Size);
1479 }
1480 int offset_from_ptr(const T *p)
1481 {
1482 IM_ASSERT(p >= begin() && p < end());
1483 const ptrdiff_t off = (const char *)p - Buf.Data;
1484 return (int)off;
1485 }
1486 T *ptr_from_offset(int off)
1487 {
1488 IM_ASSERT(off >= 4 && off < Buf.Size);
1489 return (T *)(void *)(Buf.Data + off);
1490 }
1491 void swap(ImChunkStream<T> &rhs)
1492 {
1493 rhs.Buf.swap(Buf);
1494 }
1495};
1496
1497// Helper: ImGuiTextIndex
1498// Maintain a line index for a text buffer. This is a strong candidate to be moved into the public API.
1499struct ImGuiTextIndex
1500{
1501 ImVector<int> LineOffsets;
1502 int EndOffset = 0; // Because we don't own text buffer we need to maintain EndOffset (may bake in LineOffsets?)
1503
1504 void clear()
1505 {
1506 LineOffsets.clear();
1507 EndOffset = 0;
1508 }
1509 int size()
1510 {
1511 return LineOffsets.Size;
1512 }
1513 const char *get_line_begin(const char *base, int n)
1514 {
1515 return base + LineOffsets[n];
1516 }
1517 const char *get_line_end(const char *base, int n)
1518 {
1519 return base + (n + 1 < LineOffsets.Size ? (LineOffsets[n + 1] - 1) : EndOffset);
1520 }
1521 void append(const char *base, int old_size, int new_size);
1522};
1523
1524// Helper: ImGuiStorage
1525IMGUI_API ImGuiStoragePair *ImLowerBound(ImGuiStoragePair *in_begin, ImGuiStoragePair *in_end, ImGuiID key);
1526
1527//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
1528// [SECTION] ImDrawList support
1529//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
1530
1531// ImDrawList: Helper function to calculate a circle's segment count given its radius and a "maximum error" value.
1532// Estimation of number of circle segment based on error is derived using method described in
1533// https://stackoverflow.com/a/2244088/15194693 Number of segments (N) is calculated using equation:
1534// N = ceil ( pi / acos(1 - error / r) ) where r > 0, error <= r
1535// Our equation is significantly simpler that one in the post thanks for choosing segment that is
1536// perpendicular to X axis. Follow steps in the article from this starting condition and you will
1537// will get this result.
1538//
1539// Rendering circles with an odd number of segments, while mathematically correct will produce
1540// asymmetrical results on the raster grid. Therefore we're rounding N to next even number (7->8, 8->8, 9->10 etc.)
1541#define IM_ROUNDUP_TO_EVEN(_V) ((((_V) + 1) / 2) * 2)
1542#define IM_DRAWLIST_CIRCLE_AUTO_SEGMENT_MIN 4
1543#define IM_DRAWLIST_CIRCLE_AUTO_SEGMENT_MAX 512
1544#define IM_DRAWLIST_CIRCLE_AUTO_SEGMENT_CALC(_RAD, _MAXERROR) \
1545 ImClamp(IM_ROUNDUP_TO_EVEN((int)ImCeil(IM_PI / ImAcos(1 - ImMin((_MAXERROR), (_RAD)) / (_RAD)))), \
1546 IM_DRAWLIST_CIRCLE_AUTO_SEGMENT_MIN, IM_DRAWLIST_CIRCLE_AUTO_SEGMENT_MAX)
1547
1548// Raw equation from IM_DRAWLIST_CIRCLE_AUTO_SEGMENT_CALC rewritten for 'r' and 'error'.
1549#define IM_DRAWLIST_CIRCLE_AUTO_SEGMENT_CALC_R(_N, _MAXERROR) \
1550 ((_MAXERROR) / (1 - ImCos(IM_PI / ImMax((float)(_N), IM_PI))))
1551#define IM_DRAWLIST_CIRCLE_AUTO_SEGMENT_CALC_ERROR(_N, _RAD) ((1 - ImCos(IM_PI / ImMax((float)(_N), IM_PI))) / (_RAD))
1552
1553// ImDrawList: Lookup table size for adaptive arc drawing, cover full circle.
1554#ifndef IM_DRAWLIST_ARCFAST_TABLE_SIZE
1555#define IM_DRAWLIST_ARCFAST_TABLE_SIZE 48 // Number of samples in lookup table.
1556#endif
1557#define IM_DRAWLIST_ARCFAST_SAMPLE_MAX IM_DRAWLIST_ARCFAST_TABLE_SIZE // Sample index _PathArcToFastEx() for 360 angle.
1558
1559// Data shared between all ImDrawList instances
1560// Conceptually this could have been called e.g. ImDrawListSharedContext
1561// Typically one ImGui context would create and maintain one of this.
1562// You may want to create your own instance of you try to ImDrawList completely without ImGui. In that case, watch out
1563// for future changes to this structure.
1564struct IMGUI_API ImDrawListSharedData
1565{
1566 ImVec2 TexUvWhitePixel; // UV of white pixel in the atlas
1567 const ImVec4 *TexUvLines; // UV of anti-aliased lines in the atlas
1568 ImFont *Font; // Current/default font (optional, for simplified AddText overload)
1569 float FontSize; // Current/default font size (optional, for simplified AddText overload)
1570 float FontScale; // Current/default font scale (== FontSize / Font->FontSize)
1571 float CurveTessellationTol; // Tessellation tolerance when using PathBezierCurveTo()
1572 float CircleSegmentMaxError; // Number of circle segments to use per pixel of radius for AddCircle() etc
1573 float InitialFringeScale; // Initial scale to apply to AA fringe
1574 ImDrawListFlags InitialFlags; // Initial flags at the beginning of the frame (it is possible to alter flags on a
1575 // per-drawlist basis afterwards)
1576 ImVec4 ClipRectFullscreen; // Value for PushClipRectFullscreen()
1577 ImVector<ImVec2> TempBuffer; // Temporary write buffer
1578
1579 // Lookup tables
1580 ImVec2 ArcFastVtx[IM_DRAWLIST_ARCFAST_TABLE_SIZE]; // Sample points on the quarter of the circle.
1581 float ArcFastRadiusCutoff; // Cutoff radius after which arc drawing will fallback to slower PathArcTo()
1582 ImU8 CircleSegmentCounts[64]; // Precomputed segment count for given radius before we calculate it dynamically (to
1583 // avoid calculation overhead)
1584
1585 ImDrawListSharedData();
1586 void SetCircleTessellationMaxError(float max_error);
1587};
1588
1589struct ImDrawDataBuilder
1590{
1591 ImVector<ImDrawList *>
1592 *Layers[2]; // Pointers to global layers for: regular, tooltip. LayersP[0] is owned by DrawData.
1593 ImVector<ImDrawList *> LayerData1;
1594
1595 ImDrawDataBuilder()
1596 {
1597 memset(this, 0, sizeof(*this));
1598 }
1599};
1600
1601//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
1602// [SECTION] Style support
1603//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
1604
1605struct ImGuiStyleVarInfo
1606{
1607 ImU32 Count : 8; // 1+
1608 ImGuiDataType DataType : 8;
1609 ImU32 Offset : 16; // Offset in parent structure
1610 void *GetVarPtr(void *parent) const
1611 {
1612 return (void *)((unsigned char *)parent + Offset);
1613 }
1614};
1615
1616// Stacked color modifier, backup of modified data so we can restore it
1617struct ImGuiColorMod
1618{
1619 ImGuiCol Col;
1620 ImVec4 BackupValue;
1621};
1622
1623// Stacked style modifier, backup of modified data so we can restore it. Data type inferred from the variable.
1624struct ImGuiStyleMod
1625{
1626 ImGuiStyleVar VarIdx;
1627 union {
1628 int BackupInt[2];
1629 float BackupFloat[2];
1630 };
1631 ImGuiStyleMod(ImGuiStyleVar idx, int v)
1632 {
1633 VarIdx = idx;
1634 BackupInt[0] = v;
1635 }
1636 ImGuiStyleMod(ImGuiStyleVar idx, float v)
1637 {
1638 VarIdx = idx;
1639 BackupFloat[0] = v;
1640 }
1641 ImGuiStyleMod(ImGuiStyleVar idx, ImVec2 v)
1642 {
1643 VarIdx = idx;
1644 BackupFloat[0] = v.x;
1645 BackupFloat[1] = v.y;
1646 }
1647};

1649//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
1650// [SECTION] Data types support
1651//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
1652
1653struct ImGuiDataTypeStorage
1654{
1655 ImU8 Data[8]; // Opaque storage to fit any data up to ImGuiDataType_COUNT
1656};
1657
1658// Type information associated to one ImGuiDataType. Retrieve with DataTypeGetInfo().
1659struct ImGuiDataTypeInfo
1660{
1661 size_t Size; // Size in bytes
1662 const char *Name; // Short descriptive name for the type, for debugging
1663 const char *PrintFmt; // Default printf format for the type
1664 const char *ScanFmt; // Default scanf format for the type
1665};
1666
1667// Extend ImGuiDataType_
1668enum ImGuiDataTypePrivate_
1669{
1670 ImGuiDataType_Pointer = ImGuiDataType_COUNT,
1671 ImGuiDataType_ID,
1672};

1674//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
1675// [SECTION] Widgets support: flags, enums, data structures
1676//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
1677
1678// Extend ImGuiItemFlags
1679// - input: PushItemFlag() manipulates g.CurrentItemFlags, g.NextItemData.ItemFlags, ItemAdd() calls may add extra flags
1680// too.
1681// - output: stored in g.LastItemData.ItemFlags
1682enum ImGuiItemFlagsPrivate_
1683{
1684 // Controlled by user
1685 ImGuiItemFlags_Disabled =
1686 1 << 10, // false // Disable interactions (DOES NOT affect visuals. DO NOT mix direct use of this with
1687 // BeginDisabled(). See BeginDisabled()/EndDisabled() for full disable feature, and github #211).
1688 ImGuiItemFlags_ReadOnly =
1689 1 << 11, // false // [ALPHA] Allow hovering interactions but underlying value is not changed.
1690 ImGuiItemFlags_MixedValue =
1691 1 << 12, // false // [BETA] Represent a mixed/indeterminate value, generally multi-selection where values
1692 // differ. Currently only supported by Checkbox() (later should support all sorts of widgets)
1693 ImGuiItemFlags_NoWindowHoverableCheck = 1 << 13, // false // Disable hoverable check in ItemHoverable()
1694 ImGuiItemFlags_AllowOverlap = 1 << 14, // false // Allow being overlapped by another widget. Not-hovered to
1695 // Hovered transition deferred by a frame.
1696 ImGuiItemFlags_NoNavDisableMouseHover = 1 << 15, // false // Nav keyboard/gamepad mode doesn't disable hover
1697 // highlight (behave as if NavHighlightItemUnderNav==false).
1698 ImGuiItemFlags_NoMarkEdited = 1 << 16, // false // Skip calling MarkItemEdited()
1699
1700 // Controlled by widget code
1701 ImGuiItemFlags_Inputable = 1 << 20, // false // [WIP] Auto-activate input mode when tab focused. Currently only
1702 // used and supported by a few items before it becomes a generic feature.
1703 ImGuiItemFlags_HasSelectionUserData = 1 << 21, // false // Set by SetNextItemSelectionUserData()
1704 ImGuiItemFlags_IsMultiSelect = 1 << 22, // false // Set by SetNextItemSelectionUserData()
1705
1706 ImGuiItemFlags_Default_ = ImGuiItemFlags_AutoClosePopups, // Please don't change, use PushItemFlag() instead.
1707
1708 // Obsolete
1709 // ImGuiItemFlags_SelectableDontClosePopup = !ImGuiItemFlags_AutoClosePopups, // Can't have a redirect as we
1710 // inverted the behavior
1711};
1712
1713// Status flags for an already submitted item
1714// - output: stored in g.LastItemData.StatusFlags
1715enum ImGuiItemStatusFlags_
1716{
1717 ImGuiItemStatusFlags_None = 0,
1718 ImGuiItemStatusFlags_HoveredRect =
1719 1 << 0, // Mouse position is within item rectangle (does NOT mean that the window is in correct z-order and can
1720 // be hovered!, this is only one part of the most-common IsItemHovered test)
1721 ImGuiItemStatusFlags_HasDisplayRect = 1 << 1, // g.LastItemData.DisplayRect is valid
1722 ImGuiItemStatusFlags_Edited = 1 << 2, // Value exposed by item was edited in the current frame (should match the
1723 // bool return value of most widgets)
1724 ImGuiItemStatusFlags_ToggledSelection =
1725 1 << 3, // Set when Selectable(), TreeNode() reports toggling a selection. We can't report "Selected", only
1726 // state changes, in order to easily handle clipping with less issues.
1727 ImGuiItemStatusFlags_ToggledOpen = 1 << 4, // Set when TreeNode() reports toggling their open state.
1728 ImGuiItemStatusFlags_HasDeactivated =
1729 1 << 5, // Set if the widget/group is able to provide data for the ImGuiItemStatusFlags_Deactivated flag.
1730 ImGuiItemStatusFlags_Deactivated = 1 << 6, // Only valid if ImGuiItemStatusFlags_HasDeactivated is set.
1731 ImGuiItemStatusFlags_HoveredWindow = 1 << 7, // Override the HoveredWindow test to allow cross-window hover testing.
1732 ImGuiItemStatusFlags_Visible =
1733 1 << 8, // [WIP] Set when item is overlapping the current clipping rectangle (Used internally. Please don't use
1734 // yet: API/system will change as we refactor Itemadd()).
1735 ImGuiItemStatusFlags_HasClipRect = 1 << 9, // g.LastItemData.ClipRect is valid.
1736 ImGuiItemStatusFlags_HasShortcut =
1737 1 << 10, // g.LastItemData.Shortcut valid. Set by SetNextItemShortcut() -> ItemAdd().
1738
1739 // Additional status + semantic for ImGuiTestEngine
1740#ifdef IMGUI_ENABLE_TEST_ENGINE
1741 ImGuiItemStatusFlags_Openable = 1 << 20, // Item is an openable (e.g. TreeNode)
1742 ImGuiItemStatusFlags_Opened = 1 << 21, // Opened status
1743 ImGuiItemStatusFlags_Checkable = 1 << 22, // Item is a checkable (e.g. CheckBox, MenuItem)
1744 ImGuiItemStatusFlags_Checked = 1 << 23, // Checked status
1745 ImGuiItemStatusFlags_Inputable = 1 << 24, // Item is a text-inputable (e.g. InputText, SliderXXX, DragXXX)
1746#endif
1747};
1748
1749// Extend ImGuiHoveredFlags_
1750enum ImGuiHoveredFlagsPrivate_
1751{
1752 ImGuiHoveredFlags_DelayMask_ = ImGuiHoveredFlags_DelayNone | ImGuiHoveredFlags_DelayShort |
1753 ImGuiHoveredFlags_DelayNormal | ImGuiHoveredFlags_NoSharedDelay,
1754 ImGuiHoveredFlags_AllowedMaskForIsWindowHovered =
1755 ImGuiHoveredFlags_ChildWindows | ImGuiHoveredFlags_RootWindow | ImGuiHoveredFlags_AnyWindow |
1756 ImGuiHoveredFlags_NoPopupHierarchy | ImGuiHoveredFlags_DockHierarchy |
1757 ImGuiHoveredFlags_AllowWhenBlockedByPopup | ImGuiHoveredFlags_AllowWhenBlockedByActiveItem |
1758 ImGuiHoveredFlags_ForTooltip | ImGuiHoveredFlags_Stationary,
1759 ImGuiHoveredFlags_AllowedMaskForIsItemHovered =
1760 ImGuiHoveredFlags_AllowWhenBlockedByPopup | ImGuiHoveredFlags_AllowWhenBlockedByActiveItem |
1761 ImGuiHoveredFlags_AllowWhenOverlapped | ImGuiHoveredFlags_AllowWhenDisabled | ImGuiHoveredFlags_NoNavOverride |
1762 ImGuiHoveredFlags_ForTooltip | ImGuiHoveredFlags_Stationary | ImGuiHoveredFlags_DelayMask_,
1763};
1764
1765// Extend ImGuiInputTextFlags_
1766enum ImGuiInputTextFlagsPrivate_
1767{
1768 // [Internal]
1769 ImGuiInputTextFlags_Multiline = 1 << 26, // For internal use by InputTextMultiline()
1770 ImGuiInputTextFlags_MergedItem = 1 << 27, // For internal use by TempInputText(), will skip calling ItemAdd().
1771 // Require bounding-box to strictly match.
1772 ImGuiInputTextFlags_LocalizeDecimalPoint = 1 << 28, // For internal use by InputScalar() and TempInputScalar()
1773};
1774
1775// Extend ImGuiButtonFlags_
1776enum ImGuiButtonFlagsPrivate_
1777{
1778 ImGuiButtonFlags_PressedOnClick = 1 << 4, // return true on click (mouse down event)
1779 ImGuiButtonFlags_PressedOnClickRelease =
1780 1
1781 << 5, // [Default] return true on click + release on same item <-- this is what the majority of Button are using
1782 ImGuiButtonFlags_PressedOnClickReleaseAnywhere =
1783 1 << 6, // return true on click + release even if the release event is not done while hovering the item
1784 ImGuiButtonFlags_PressedOnRelease = 1 << 7, // return true on release (default requires click+release)
1785 ImGuiButtonFlags_PressedOnDoubleClick = 1 << 8, // return true on double-click (default requires click+release)
1786 ImGuiButtonFlags_PressedOnDragDropHold = 1 << 9, // return true when held into while we are drag and dropping
1787 // another item (used by e.g. tree nodes, collapsing headers)
1788 // ImGuiButtonFlags_Repeat = 1 << 10, // hold to repeat -> use ImGuiItemFlags_ButtonRepeat instead.
1789 ImGuiButtonFlags_FlattenChildren = 1 << 11, // allow interactions even if a child window is overlapping
1790 ImGuiButtonFlags_AllowOverlap =
1791 1 << 12, // require previous frame HoveredId to either match id or be null before being usable.
1792 // ImGuiButtonFlags_DontClosePopups = 1 << 13, // disable automatically closing parent popup on press
1793 // ImGuiButtonFlags_Disabled = 1 << 14, // disable interactions -> use BeginDisabled() or
1794 // ImGuiItemFlags_Disabled
1795 ImGuiButtonFlags_AlignTextBaseLine =
1796 1 << 15, // vertically align button to match text baseline - ButtonEx() only // FIXME: Should be removed and
1797 // handled by SmallButton(), not possible currently because of DC.CursorPosPrevLine
1798 ImGuiButtonFlags_NoKeyModsAllowed = 1 << 16, // disable mouse interaction if a key modifier is held
1799 ImGuiButtonFlags_NoHoldingActiveId =
1800 1 << 17, // don't set ActiveId while holding the mouse (ImGuiButtonFlags_PressedOnClick only)
1801 ImGuiButtonFlags_NoNavFocus =
1802 1 << 18, // don't override navigation focus when activated (FIXME: this is essentially used every time an item
1803 // uses ImGuiItemFlags_NoNav, but because legacy specs don't requires LastItemData to be set
1804 // ButtonBehavior(), we can't poll g.LastItemData.ItemFlags)
1805 ImGuiButtonFlags_NoHoveredOnFocus = 1 << 19, // don't report as hovered when nav focus is on this item
1806 ImGuiButtonFlags_NoSetKeyOwner = 1 << 20, // don't set key/input owner on the initial click (note: mouse buttons are
1807 // keys! often, the key in question will be ImGuiKey_MouseLeft!)
1808 ImGuiButtonFlags_NoTestKeyOwner = 1 << 21, // don't test key/input owner when polling the key (note: mouse buttons
1809 // are keys! often, the key in question will be ImGuiKey_MouseLeft!)
1810 ImGuiButtonFlags_PressedOnMask_ = ImGuiButtonFlags_PressedOnClick | ImGuiButtonFlags_PressedOnClickRelease |
1811 ImGuiButtonFlags_PressedOnClickReleaseAnywhere |
1812 ImGuiButtonFlags_PressedOnRelease | ImGuiButtonFlags_PressedOnDoubleClick |
1813 ImGuiButtonFlags_PressedOnDragDropHold,
1814 ImGuiButtonFlags_PressedOnDefault_ = ImGuiButtonFlags_PressedOnClickRelease,
1815};
1816
1817// Extend ImGuiComboFlags_
1818enum ImGuiComboFlagsPrivate_
1819{
1820 ImGuiComboFlags_CustomPreview = 1 << 20, // enable BeginComboPreview()
1821};
1822
1823// Extend ImGuiSliderFlags_
1824enum ImGuiSliderFlagsPrivate_
1825{
1826 ImGuiSliderFlags_Vertical = 1 << 20, // Should this slider be orientated vertically?
1827 ImGuiSliderFlags_ReadOnly = 1 << 21, // Consider using g.NextItemData.ItemFlags |= ImGuiItemFlags_ReadOnly instead.
1828};
1829
1830// Extend ImGuiSelectableFlags_
1831enum ImGuiSelectableFlagsPrivate_
1832{
1833 // NB: need to be in sync with last value of ImGuiSelectableFlags_
1834 ImGuiSelectableFlags_NoHoldingActiveID = 1 << 20,
1835 ImGuiSelectableFlags_SelectOnNav =
1836 1 << 21, // (WIP) Auto-select when moved into. This is not exposed in public API as to handle multi-select and
1837 // modifiers we will need user to explicitly control focus scope. May be replaced with a
1838 // BeginSelection() API.
1839 ImGuiSelectableFlags_SelectOnClick = 1
1840 << 22, // Override button behavior to react on Click (default is Click+Release)
1841 ImGuiSelectableFlags_SelectOnRelease =
1842 1 << 23, // Override button behavior to react on Release (default is Click+Release)
1843 ImGuiSelectableFlags_SpanAvailWidth =
1844 1 << 24, // Span all avail width even if we declared less for layout purpose. FIXME: We may be able to remove
1845 // this (added in 6251d379, 2bcafc86 for menus)
1846 ImGuiSelectableFlags_SetNavIdOnHover = 1 << 25, // Set Nav/Focus ID on mouse hover (used by MenuItem)
1847 ImGuiSelectableFlags_NoPadWithHalfSpacing = 1 << 26, // Disable padding each side with ItemSpacing * 0.5f
1848 ImGuiSelectableFlags_NoSetKeyOwner = 1 << 27, // Don't set key/input owner on the initial click (note: mouse buttons
1849 // are keys! often, the key in question will be ImGuiKey_MouseLeft!)
1850};
1851
1852// Extend ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_
1853enum ImGuiTreeNodeFlagsPrivate_
1854{
1855 ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_ClipLabelForTrailingButton = 1 << 28, // FIXME-WIP: Hard-coded for CollapsingHeader()
1856 ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_UpsideDownArrow =
1857 1 << 29, // FIXME-WIP: Turn Down arrow into an Up arrow, for reversed trees (#6517)
1858 ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_OpenOnMask_ = ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_OpenOnDoubleClick | ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_OpenOnArrow,
1859};
1860
1861enum ImGuiSeparatorFlags_
1862{
1863 ImGuiSeparatorFlags_None = 0,
1864 ImGuiSeparatorFlags_Horizontal =
1865 1 << 0, // Axis default to current layout type, so generally Horizontal unless e.g. in a menu bar
1866 ImGuiSeparatorFlags_Vertical = 1 << 1,
1867 ImGuiSeparatorFlags_SpanAllColumns = 1 << 2, // Make separator cover all columns of a legacy Columns() set.
1868};

1870// Flags for FocusWindow(). This is not called ImGuiFocusFlags to avoid confusion with public-facing ImGuiFocusedFlags.
1871// FIXME: Once we finishing replacing more uses of GetTopMostPopupModal()+IsWindowWithinBeginStackOf()
1872// and FindBlockingModal() with this, we may want to change the flag to be opt-out instead of opt-in.
1873enum ImGuiFocusRequestFlags_
1874{
1875 ImGuiFocusRequestFlags_None = 0,
1876 ImGuiFocusRequestFlags_RestoreFocusedChild = 1 << 0, // Find last focused child (if any) and focus it instead.
1877 ImGuiFocusRequestFlags_UnlessBelowModal = 1 << 1, // Do not set focus if the window is below a modal.
1878};

1881{

1883 ImGuiTextFlags_NoWidthForLargeClippedText = 1 << 0,
1884};

1887{
1888 ImGuiTooltipFlags_None = 0,
1889 ImGuiTooltipFlags_OverridePrevious = 1 << 1, // Clear/ignore previously submitted tooltip (defaults to append)
1890};

1961// Simple column measurement, currently used for MenuItem() only.. This is very short-sighted/throw-away code and NOT a
1962// generic helper.
1963struct IMGUI_API ImGuiMenuColumns
1964{
1965 ImU32 TotalWidth;
1966 ImU32 NextTotalWidth;
1967 ImU16 Spacing;
1968 ImU16 OffsetIcon; // Always zero for now
1969 ImU16 OffsetLabel; // Offsets are locked in Update()
1970 ImU16 OffsetShortcut;
1971 ImU16 OffsetMark;
1972 ImU16 Widths[4]; // Width of: Icon, Label, Shortcut, Mark (accumulators for current frame)
1973
1974 ImGuiMenuColumns()
1975 {
1976 memset(this, 0, sizeof(*this));
1977 }
1978 void Update(float spacing, bool window_reappearing);
1979 float DeclColumns(float w_icon, float w_label, float w_shortcut, float w_mark);
1980 void CalcNextTotalWidth(bool update_offsets);
1981};
1982
1983// Internal temporary state for deactivating InputText() instances.
1984struct IMGUI_API ImGuiInputTextDeactivatedState
1985{
1986 ImGuiID ID; // widget id owning the text state (which just got deactivated)
1987 ImVector<char> TextA; // text buffer
1988
1989 ImGuiInputTextDeactivatedState()
1990 {
1991 memset(this, 0, sizeof(*this));
1992 }
1993 void ClearFreeMemory()
1994 {
1995 ID = 0;
1996 TextA.clear();
1997 }
1998};
1999
2000// Forward declare imstb_textedit.h structure + make its main configuration define accessible
2001#undef IMSTB_TEXTEDIT_STRING
2002#undef IMSTB_TEXTEDIT_CHARTYPE
2003#define IMSTB_TEXTEDIT_STRING ImGuiInputTextState
2004#define IMSTB_TEXTEDIT_CHARTYPE char
2005#define IMSTB_TEXTEDIT_GETWIDTH_NEWLINE (-1.0f)
2006#define IMSTB_TEXTEDIT_UNDOSTATECOUNT 99
2007#define IMSTB_TEXTEDIT_UNDOCHARCOUNT 999
2008namespace ImStb
2009{
2010struct STB_TexteditState;
2011}
2012typedef ImStb::STB_TexteditState ImStbTexteditState;
2013
2014// Internal state of the currently focused/edited text input box
2015// For a given item ID, access with ImGui::GetInputTextState()
2016struct IMGUI_API ImGuiInputTextState
2017{
2018 ImGuiContext *Ctx; // parent UI context (needs to be set explicitly by parent).
2019 ImStbTexteditState *Stb; // State for stb_textedit.h
2020 ImGuiInputTextFlags
2021 Flags; // copy of InputText() flags. may be used to check if e.g. ImGuiInputTextFlags_Password is set.
2022 ImGuiID ID; // widget id owning the text state
2023 int TextLen; // UTF-8 length of the string in TextA (in bytes)
2024 const char *TextSrc; // == TextA.Data unless read-only, in which case == buf passed to InputText(). Field only set
2025 // and valid _inside_ the call InputText() call.
2026 ImVector<char> TextA; // main UTF8 buffer. TextA.Size is a buffer size! Should always be >= buf_size passed by user
2027 // (and of course >= CurLenA + 1).
2028 ImVector<char> TextToRevertTo; // value to revert to when pressing Escape = backup of end-user buffer at the time of
2029 // focus (in UTF-8, unaltered)
2030 ImVector<char> CallbackTextBackup; // temporary storage for callback to support automatic reconcile of undo-stack
2031 int BufCapacity; // end-user buffer capacity (include zero terminator)
2032 ImVec2
2033 Scroll; // horizontal offset (managed manually) + vertical scrolling (pulled from child window's own Scroll.y)
2034 float CursorAnim; // timer for cursor blink, reset on every user action so the cursor reappears immediately
2035 bool CursorFollow; // set when we want scrolling to follow the current cursor position (not always!)
2036 bool SelectedAllMouseLock; // after a double-click to select all, we ignore further mouse drags to update selection
2037 bool Edited; // edited this frame
2038 bool WantReloadUserBuf; // force a reload of user buf so it may be modified externally. may be automatic in future
2039 // version.
2040 int ReloadSelectionStart;
2041 int ReloadSelectionEnd;
2042
2043 ImGuiInputTextState();
2044 ~ImGuiInputTextState();
2045 void ClearText()
2046 {
2047 TextLen = 0;
2048 TextA[0] = 0;
2049 CursorClamp();
2050 }
2051 void ClearFreeMemory()
2052 {
2053 TextA.clear();
2054 TextToRevertTo.clear();
2055 }
2056 void OnKeyPressed(int key); // Cannot be inline because we call in code in stb_textedit.h implementation
2057 void OnCharPressed(unsigned int c);
2058
2059 // Cursor & Selection
2060 void CursorAnimReset();
2061 void CursorClamp();
2062 bool HasSelection() const;
2063 void ClearSelection();
2064 int GetCursorPos() const;
2065 int GetSelectionStart() const;
2066 int GetSelectionEnd() const;
2067 void SelectAll();
2068
2069 // Reload user buf (WIP #2890)
2070 // If you modify underlying user-passed const char* while active you need to call this (InputText V2 may lift this)
2071 // strcpy(my_buf, "hello");
2072 // if (ImGuiInputTextState* state = ImGui::GetInputTextState(id)) // id may be ImGui::GetItemID() is last item
2073 // state->ReloadUserBufAndSelectAll();
2074 void ReloadUserBufAndSelectAll();
2075 void ReloadUserBufAndKeepSelection();
2076 void ReloadUserBufAndMoveToEnd();
2077};
2078
2079enum ImGuiWindowRefreshFlags_
2080{
2081 ImGuiWindowRefreshFlags_None = 0,
2082 ImGuiWindowRefreshFlags_TryToAvoidRefresh = 1 << 0, // [EXPERIMENTAL] Try to keep existing contents, USER MUST NOT
2083 // HONOR BEGIN() RETURNING FALSE AND NOT APPEND.
2084 ImGuiWindowRefreshFlags_RefreshOnHover = 1 << 1, // [EXPERIMENTAL] Always refresh on hover
2085 ImGuiWindowRefreshFlags_RefreshOnFocus = 1 << 2, // [EXPERIMENTAL] Always refresh on focus
2086 // Refresh policy/frequency, Load Balancing etc.
2087};
2088

2090{
2091 ImGuiNextWindowDataFlags_None = 0,
2092 ImGuiNextWindowDataFlags_HasPos = 1 << 0,
2093 ImGuiNextWindowDataFlags_HasSize = 1 << 1,
2094 ImGuiNextWindowDataFlags_HasContentSize = 1 << 2,
2095 ImGuiNextWindowDataFlags_HasCollapsed = 1 << 3,
2096 ImGuiNextWindowDataFlags_HasSizeConstraint = 1 << 4,
2097 ImGuiNextWindowDataFlags_HasFocus = 1 << 5,
2098 ImGuiNextWindowDataFlags_HasBgAlpha = 1 << 6,
2099 ImGuiNextWindowDataFlags_HasScroll = 1 << 7,
2100 ImGuiNextWindowDataFlags_HasWindowFlags = 1 << 8,
2101 ImGuiNextWindowDataFlags_HasChildFlags = 1 << 9,
2102 ImGuiNextWindowDataFlags_HasRefreshPolicy = 1 << 10,
2103 ImGuiNextWindowDataFlags_HasViewport = 1 << 11,
2104 ImGuiNextWindowDataFlags_HasDock = 1 << 12,
2105 ImGuiNextWindowDataFlags_HasWindowClass = 1 << 13,
2106};
