2108// Storage for SetNexWindow** functions
2109struct ImGuiNextWindowData
2110{
2111 ImGuiNextWindowDataFlags HasFlags;
2112
2113 // Members below are NOT cleared. Always rely on HasFlags.
2114 ImGuiCond PosCond;
2115 ImGuiCond SizeCond;
2116 ImGuiCond CollapsedCond;
2117 ImGuiCond DockCond;
2118 ImVec2 PosVal;
2119 ImVec2 PosPivotVal;
2120 ImVec2 SizeVal;
2121 ImVec2 ContentSizeVal;
2122 ImVec2 ScrollVal;
2123 ImGuiWindowFlags WindowFlags; // Only honored by BeginTable()
2124 ImGuiChildFlags ChildFlags;
2125 bool PosUndock;
2126 bool CollapsedVal;
2127 ImRect SizeConstraintRect;
2128 ImGuiSizeCallback SizeCallback;
2129 void *SizeCallbackUserData;
2130 float BgAlphaVal; // Override background alpha
2131 ImGuiID ViewportId;
2132 ImGuiID DockId;
2133 ImGuiWindowClass WindowClass;
2134 ImVec2 MenuBarOffsetMinVal; // (Always on) This is not exposed publicly, so we don't clear it and it doesn't have a
2135 // corresponding flag (could we? for consistency?)
2136 ImGuiWindowRefreshFlags RefreshFlagsVal;
2137
2138 ImGuiNextWindowData()
2139 {
2140 memset(this, 0, sizeof(*this));
2141 }
2142 inline void ClearFlags()
2143 {
2144 HasFlags = ImGuiNextWindowDataFlags_None;
2145 }
2146};
2147
2148enum ImGuiNextItemDataFlags_
2149{
2150 ImGuiNextItemDataFlags_None = 0,
2151 ImGuiNextItemDataFlags_HasWidth = 1 << 0,
2152 ImGuiNextItemDataFlags_HasOpen = 1 << 1,
2153 ImGuiNextItemDataFlags_HasShortcut = 1 << 2,
2154 ImGuiNextItemDataFlags_HasRefVal = 1 << 3,
2155 ImGuiNextItemDataFlags_HasStorageID = 1 << 4,
2156};
2157
2158struct ImGuiNextItemData
2159{
2160 ImGuiNextItemDataFlags HasFlags; // Called HasFlags instead of Flags to avoid mistaking this
2161 ImGuiItemFlags ItemFlags; // Currently only tested/used for ImGuiItemFlags_AllowOverlap and
2162 // ImGuiItemFlags_HasSelectionUserData.
2163
2164 // Members below are NOT cleared by ItemAdd() meaning they are still valid during e.g. NavProcessItem(). Always rely
2165 // on HasFlags.
2166 ImGuiID FocusScopeId; // Set by SetNextItemSelectionUserData()
2167 ImGuiSelectionUserData
2168 SelectionUserData; // Set by SetNextItemSelectionUserData() (note that NULL/0 is a valid value, we use -1 ==
2169 // ImGuiSelectionUserData_Invalid to mark invalid values)
2170 float Width; // Set by SetNextItemWidth()
2171 ImGuiKeyChord Shortcut; // Set by SetNextItemShortcut()
2172 ImGuiInputFlags ShortcutFlags; // Set by SetNextItemShortcut()
2173 bool OpenVal; // Set by SetNextItemOpen()
2174 ImU8 OpenCond; // Set by SetNextItemOpen()
2175 ImGuiDataTypeStorage RefVal; // Not exposed yet, for ImGuiInputTextFlags_ParseEmptyAsRefVal
2176 ImGuiID StorageId; // Set by SetNextItemStorageID()
2177
2178 ImGuiNextItemData()
2179 {
2180 memset(this, 0, sizeof(*this));
2181 SelectionUserData = -1;
2182 }
2183 inline void ClearFlags()
2184 {
2185 HasFlags = ImGuiNextItemDataFlags_None;
2186 ItemFlags = ImGuiItemFlags_None;
2187 } // Also cleared manually by ItemAdd()!
2188};
2189
2190// Status storage for the last submitted item
2191struct ImGuiLastItemData
2192{
2193 ImGuiID ID;
2194 ImGuiItemFlags ItemFlags; // See ImGuiItemFlags_ (called 'InFlags' before v1.91.4).
2195 ImGuiItemStatusFlags StatusFlags; // See ImGuiItemStatusFlags_
2196 ImRect Rect; // Full rectangle
2197 ImRect NavRect; // Navigation scoring rectangle (not displayed)
2198 // Rarely used fields are not explicitly cleared, only valid when the corresponding ImGuiItemStatusFlags are set.
2199 ImRect DisplayRect; // Display rectangle. ONLY VALID IF (StatusFlags & ImGuiItemStatusFlags_HasDisplayRect) is set.
2200 ImRect ClipRect; // Clip rectangle at the time of submitting item. ONLY VALID IF (StatusFlags &
2201 // ImGuiItemStatusFlags_HasClipRect) is set..
2202 ImGuiKeyChord Shortcut; // Shortcut at the time of submitting item. ONLY VALID IF (StatusFlags &
2203 // ImGuiItemStatusFlags_HasShortcut) is set..
2204
2205 ImGuiLastItemData()
2206 {
2207 memset(this, 0, sizeof(*this));
2208 }
2209};
2210
2211// Store data emitted by TreeNode() for usage by TreePop()
2212// - To implement ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_NavLeftJumpsBackHere: store the minimum amount of data
2213// which we can't infer in TreePop(), to perform the equivalent of NavApplyItemToResult().
2214// Only stored when the node is a potential candidate for landing on a Left arrow jump.
2215struct ImGuiTreeNodeStackData
2216{
2217 ImGuiID ID;
2218 ImGuiTreeNodeFlags TreeFlags;
2219 ImGuiItemFlags ItemFlags; // Used for nav landing
2220 ImRect NavRect; // Used for nav landing
2221};

2245struct ImGuiWindowStackData
2246{

2260
2261struct ImGuiPtrOrIndex
2262{
2263 void *Ptr; // Either field can be set, not both. e.g. Dock node tab bars are loose while BeginTabBar() ones are in a
2264 // pool.
2265 int Index; // Usually index in a main pool.
2266
2267 ImGuiPtrOrIndex(void *ptr)
2268 {
2269 Ptr = ptr;
2270 Index = -1;
2271 }
2272 ImGuiPtrOrIndex(int index)
2273 {
2274 Ptr = NULL;
2275 Index = index;
2276 }
2277};

2280struct ImGuiDeactivatedItemData
2281{
2282 ImGuiID ID;
2283 int ElapseFrame;
2284 bool HasBeenEditedBefore;
2285 bool IsAlive;
2286};

2298
2299// Storage for popup stacks (g.OpenPopupStack and g.BeginPopupStack)
2300struct ImGuiPopupData
2301{
2302 ImGuiID PopupId; // Set on OpenPopup()
2303 ImGuiWindow *Window; // Resolved on BeginPopup() - may stay unresolved if user never calls OpenPopup()
2304 ImGuiWindow *RestoreNavWindow; // Set on OpenPopup(), a NavWindow that will be restored on popup close
2305 int ParentNavLayer; // Resolved on BeginPopup(). Actually a ImGuiNavLayer type (declared down below), initialized to
2306 // -1 which is not part of an enum, but serves well-enough as "not any of layers" value
2307 int OpenFrameCount; // Set on OpenPopup()
2308 ImGuiID OpenParentId; // Set on OpenPopup(), we need this to differentiate multiple menu sets from each others (e.g.
2309 // inside menu bar vs loose menu items)
2310 ImVec2 OpenPopupPos; // Set on OpenPopup(), preferred popup position (typically == OpenMousePos when using mouse)
2311 ImVec2 OpenMousePos; // Set on OpenPopup(), copy of mouse position at the time of opening popup
2312
2313 ImGuiPopupData()
2314 {
2315 memset(this, 0, sizeof(*this));
2316 ParentNavLayer = OpenFrameCount = -1;
2317 }
2318};
2319
2320//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
2321// [SECTION] Inputs support
2322//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
2323
2324// Bit array for named keys
2325typedef ImBitArray<ImGuiKey_NamedKey_COUNT, -ImGuiKey_NamedKey_BEGIN> ImBitArrayForNamedKeys;
2326
2327// [Internal] Key ranges
2328#define ImGuiKey_LegacyNativeKey_BEGIN 0
2329#define ImGuiKey_LegacyNativeKey_END 512
2330#define ImGuiKey_Keyboard_BEGIN (ImGuiKey_NamedKey_BEGIN)
2331#define ImGuiKey_Keyboard_END (ImGuiKey_GamepadStart)
2332#define ImGuiKey_Gamepad_BEGIN (ImGuiKey_GamepadStart)
2333#define ImGuiKey_Gamepad_END (ImGuiKey_GamepadRStickDown + 1)
2334#define ImGuiKey_Mouse_BEGIN (ImGuiKey_MouseLeft)
2335#define ImGuiKey_Mouse_END (ImGuiKey_MouseWheelY + 1)
2336#define ImGuiKey_Aliases_BEGIN (ImGuiKey_Mouse_BEGIN)
2337#define ImGuiKey_Aliases_END (ImGuiKey_Mouse_END)
2338
2339// [Internal] Named shortcuts for Navigation
2340#define ImGuiKey_NavKeyboardTweakSlow ImGuiMod_Ctrl
2341#define ImGuiKey_NavKeyboardTweakFast ImGuiMod_Shift
2342#define ImGuiKey_NavGamepadTweakSlow ImGuiKey_GamepadL1
2343#define ImGuiKey_NavGamepadTweakFast ImGuiKey_GamepadR1
2344#define ImGuiKey_NavGamepadActivate \
2345 (g.IO.ConfigNavSwapGamepadButtons ? ImGuiKey_GamepadFaceRight : ImGuiKey_GamepadFaceDown)
2346#define ImGuiKey_NavGamepadCancel \
2347 (g.IO.ConfigNavSwapGamepadButtons ? ImGuiKey_GamepadFaceDown : ImGuiKey_GamepadFaceRight)
2348#define ImGuiKey_NavGamepadMenu ImGuiKey_GamepadFaceLeft
2349#define ImGuiKey_NavGamepadInput ImGuiKey_GamepadFaceUp
2350
2351enum ImGuiInputEventType
2352{
2353 ImGuiInputEventType_None = 0,
2354 ImGuiInputEventType_MousePos,
2355 ImGuiInputEventType_MouseWheel,
2356 ImGuiInputEventType_MouseButton,
2357 ImGuiInputEventType_MouseViewport,
2358 ImGuiInputEventType_Key,
2359 ImGuiInputEventType_Text,
2360 ImGuiInputEventType_Focus,
2361 ImGuiInputEventType_COUNT
2362};
2363
2364enum ImGuiInputSource
2365{
2366 ImGuiInputSource_None = 0,
2367 ImGuiInputSource_Mouse, // Note: may be Mouse or TouchScreen or Pen. See io.MouseSource to distinguish them.
2368 ImGuiInputSource_Keyboard,
2369 ImGuiInputSource_Gamepad,
2370 ImGuiInputSource_COUNT
2371};
2372
2373// FIXME: Structures in the union below need to be declared as anonymous unions appears to be an extension?
2374// Using ImVec2() would fail on Clang 'union member 'MousePos' has a non-trivial default constructor'
2375struct ImGuiInputEventMousePos
2376{
2377 float PosX, PosY;
2378 ImGuiMouseSource MouseSource;
2379};
2380struct ImGuiInputEventMouseWheel
2381{
2382 float WheelX, WheelY;
2383 ImGuiMouseSource MouseSource;
2384};
2385struct ImGuiInputEventMouseButton
2386{
2387 int Button;
2388 bool Down;
2389 ImGuiMouseSource MouseSource;
2390};
2391struct ImGuiInputEventMouseViewport
2392{
2393 ImGuiID HoveredViewportID;
2394};
2395struct ImGuiInputEventKey
2396{
2397 ImGuiKey Key;
2398 bool Down;
2399 float AnalogValue;
2400};
2401struct ImGuiInputEventText
2402{
2403 unsigned int Char;
2404};
2405struct ImGuiInputEventAppFocused
2406{
2407 bool Focused;
2408};
2409
2410struct ImGuiInputEvent
2411{
2412 ImGuiInputEventType Type;
2413 ImGuiInputSource Source;
2414 ImU32 EventId; // Unique, sequential increasing integer to identify an event (if you need to correlate them to other
2415 // data).
2416 union {
2417 ImGuiInputEventMousePos MousePos; // if Type == ImGuiInputEventType_MousePos
2418 ImGuiInputEventMouseWheel MouseWheel; // if Type == ImGuiInputEventType_MouseWheel
2419 ImGuiInputEventMouseButton MouseButton; // if Type == ImGuiInputEventType_MouseButton
2420 ImGuiInputEventMouseViewport MouseViewport; // if Type == ImGuiInputEventType_MouseViewport
2421 ImGuiInputEventKey Key; // if Type == ImGuiInputEventType_Key
2422 ImGuiInputEventText Text; // if Type == ImGuiInputEventType_Text
2423 ImGuiInputEventAppFocused AppFocused; // if Type == ImGuiInputEventType_Focus
2424 };
2425 bool AddedByTestEngine;
2426
2427 ImGuiInputEvent()
2428 {
2429 memset(this, 0, sizeof(*this));
2430 }
2431};
2432
2433// Input function taking an 'ImGuiID owner_id' argument defaults to (ImGuiKeyOwner_Any == 0) aka don't test ownership,
2434// which matches legacy behavior.
2435#define ImGuiKeyOwner_Any \
2436 ((ImGuiID)0) // Accept key that have an owner, UNLESS a call to SetKeyOwner() explicitly used
2437 // ImGuiInputFlags_LockThisFrame or ImGuiInputFlags_LockUntilRelease.
2438#define ImGuiKeyOwner_NoOwner ((ImGuiID) - 1) // Require key to have no owner.
2439// #define ImGuiKeyOwner_None ImGuiKeyOwner_NoOwner // We previously called this 'ImGuiKeyOwner_None' but it was
2440// inconsistent with our pattern that _None values == 0 and quite dangerous. Also using _NoOwner makes the
2441// IsKeyPressed() calls more explicit.
2442
2443typedef ImS16 ImGuiKeyRoutingIndex;
2444
2445// Routing table entry (sizeof() == 16 bytes)
2446struct ImGuiKeyRoutingData
2447{
2448 ImGuiKeyRoutingIndex NextEntryIndex;
2449 ImU16 Mods; // Technically we'd only need 4-bits but for simplify we store ImGuiMod_ values which need 16-bits.
2450 ImU8 RoutingCurrScore; // [DEBUG] For debug display
2451 ImU8 RoutingNextScore; // Lower is better (0: perfect score)
2452 ImGuiID RoutingCurr;
2453 ImGuiID RoutingNext;
2454
2455 ImGuiKeyRoutingData()
2456 {
2457 NextEntryIndex = -1;
2458 Mods = 0;
2459 RoutingCurrScore = RoutingNextScore = 255;
2460 RoutingCurr = RoutingNext = ImGuiKeyOwner_NoOwner;
2461 }
2462};
2463
2464// Routing table: maintain a desired owner for each possible key-chord (key + mods), and setup owner in NewFrame() when
2465// mods are matching. Stored in main context (1 instance)
2466struct ImGuiKeyRoutingTable
2467{
2468 ImGuiKeyRoutingIndex Index[ImGuiKey_NamedKey_COUNT]; // Index of first entry in Entries[]
2469 ImVector<ImGuiKeyRoutingData> Entries;
2470 ImVector<ImGuiKeyRoutingData> EntriesNext; // Double-buffer to avoid reallocation (could use a shared buffer)
2471
2472 ImGuiKeyRoutingTable()
2473 {
2474 Clear();
2475 }
2476 void Clear()
2477 {
2478 for (int n = 0; n < IM_ARRAYSIZE(Index); n++)
2479 Index[n] = -1;
2480 Entries.clear();
2481 EntriesNext.clear();
2482 }
2483};
2484
2485// This extends ImGuiKeyData but only for named keys (legacy keys don't support the new features)
2486// Stored in main context (1 per named key). In the future it might be merged into ImGuiKeyData.
2487struct ImGuiKeyOwnerData
2488{
2489 ImGuiID OwnerCurr;
2490 ImGuiID OwnerNext;
2491 bool LockThisFrame; // Reading this key requires explicit owner id (until end of frame). Set by
2492 // ImGuiInputFlags_LockThisFrame.
2493 bool LockUntilRelease; // Reading this key requires explicit owner id (until key is released). Set by
2494 // ImGuiInputFlags_LockUntilRelease. When this is true LockThisFrame is always true as well.
2495
2496 ImGuiKeyOwnerData()
2497 {
2498 OwnerCurr = OwnerNext = ImGuiKeyOwner_NoOwner;
2499 LockThisFrame = LockUntilRelease = false;
2500 }
2501};
2502
2503// Extend ImGuiInputFlags_
2504// Flags for extended versions of IsKeyPressed(), IsMouseClicked(), Shortcut(), SetKeyOwner(), SetItemKeyOwner()
2505// Don't mistake with ImGuiInputTextFlags! (which is for ImGui::InputText() function)
2506enum ImGuiInputFlagsPrivate_
2507{
2508 // Flags for IsKeyPressed(), IsKeyChordPressed(), IsMouseClicked(), Shortcut()
2509 // - Repeat mode: Repeat rate selection
2510 ImGuiInputFlags_RepeatRateDefault = 1 << 1, // Repeat rate: Regular (default)
2511 ImGuiInputFlags_RepeatRateNavMove = 1 << 2, // Repeat rate: Fast
2512 ImGuiInputFlags_RepeatRateNavTweak = 1 << 3, // Repeat rate: Faster
2513 // - Repeat mode: Specify when repeating key pressed can be interrupted.
2514 // - In theory ImGuiInputFlags_RepeatUntilOtherKeyPress may be a desirable default, but it would break too many
2515 // behavior so everything is opt-in.
2516 ImGuiInputFlags_RepeatUntilRelease =
2517 1 << 4, // Stop repeating when released (default for all functions except Shortcut). This only exists to allow
2518 // overriding Shortcut() default behavior.
2519 ImGuiInputFlags_RepeatUntilKeyModsChange =
2520 1 << 5, // Stop repeating when released OR if keyboard mods are changed (default for Shortcut)
2521 ImGuiInputFlags_RepeatUntilKeyModsChangeFromNone =
2522 1 << 6, // Stop repeating when released OR if keyboard mods are leaving the None state. Allows going from
2523 // Mod+Key to Key by releasing Mod.
2524 ImGuiInputFlags_RepeatUntilOtherKeyPress =
2525 1 << 7, // Stop repeating when released OR if any other keyboard key is pressed during the repeat
2526
2527 // Flags for SetKeyOwner(), SetItemKeyOwner()
2528 // - Locking key away from non-input aware code. Locking is useful to make input-owner-aware code steal keys from
2529 // non-input-owner-aware code. If all code is input-owner-aware locking would never be necessary.
2530 ImGuiInputFlags_LockThisFrame =
2531 1 << 20, // Further accesses to key data will require EXPLICIT owner ID (ImGuiKeyOwner_Any/0 will NOT accepted
2532 // for polling). Cleared at end of frame.
2533 ImGuiInputFlags_LockUntilRelease =
2534 1 << 21, // Further accesses to key data will require EXPLICIT owner ID (ImGuiKeyOwner_Any/0 will NOT accepted
2535 // for polling). Cleared when the key is released or at end of each frame if key is released.
2536
2537 // - Condition for SetItemKeyOwner()
2538 ImGuiInputFlags_CondHovered = 1 << 22, // Only set if item is hovered (default to both)
2539 ImGuiInputFlags_CondActive = 1 << 23, // Only set if item is active (default to both)
2540 ImGuiInputFlags_CondDefault_ = ImGuiInputFlags_CondHovered | ImGuiInputFlags_CondActive,
2541
2542 // [Internal] Mask of which function support which flags
2543 ImGuiInputFlags_RepeatRateMask_ =
2544 ImGuiInputFlags_RepeatRateDefault | ImGuiInputFlags_RepeatRateNavMove | ImGuiInputFlags_RepeatRateNavTweak,
2545 ImGuiInputFlags_RepeatUntilMask_ = ImGuiInputFlags_RepeatUntilRelease | ImGuiInputFlags_RepeatUntilKeyModsChange |
2546 ImGuiInputFlags_RepeatUntilKeyModsChangeFromNone |
2547 ImGuiInputFlags_RepeatUntilOtherKeyPress,
2548 ImGuiInputFlags_RepeatMask_ =
2549 ImGuiInputFlags_Repeat | ImGuiInputFlags_RepeatRateMask_ | ImGuiInputFlags_RepeatUntilMask_,
2550 ImGuiInputFlags_CondMask_ = ImGuiInputFlags_CondHovered | ImGuiInputFlags_CondActive,
2551 ImGuiInputFlags_RouteTypeMask_ = ImGuiInputFlags_RouteActive | ImGuiInputFlags_RouteFocused |
2552 ImGuiInputFlags_RouteGlobal | ImGuiInputFlags_RouteAlways,
2553 ImGuiInputFlags_RouteOptionsMask_ = ImGuiInputFlags_RouteOverFocused | ImGuiInputFlags_RouteOverActive |
2554 ImGuiInputFlags_RouteUnlessBgFocused | ImGuiInputFlags_RouteFromRootWindow,
2555 ImGuiInputFlags_SupportedByIsKeyPressed = ImGuiInputFlags_RepeatMask_,
2556 ImGuiInputFlags_SupportedByIsMouseClicked = ImGuiInputFlags_Repeat,
2557 ImGuiInputFlags_SupportedByShortcut =
2558 ImGuiInputFlags_RepeatMask_ | ImGuiInputFlags_RouteTypeMask_ | ImGuiInputFlags_RouteOptionsMask_,
2559 ImGuiInputFlags_SupportedBySetNextItemShortcut = ImGuiInputFlags_RepeatMask_ | ImGuiInputFlags_RouteTypeMask_ |
2560 ImGuiInputFlags_RouteOptionsMask_ | ImGuiInputFlags_Tooltip,
2561 ImGuiInputFlags_SupportedBySetKeyOwner = ImGuiInputFlags_LockThisFrame | ImGuiInputFlags_LockUntilRelease,
2562 ImGuiInputFlags_SupportedBySetItemKeyOwner = ImGuiInputFlags_SupportedBySetKeyOwner | ImGuiInputFlags_CondMask_,
2563};
2564
2565//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
2566// [SECTION] Clipper support
2567//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
2568
2569// Note that Max is exclusive, so perhaps should be using a Begin/End convention.
2570struct ImGuiListClipperRange
2571{
2572 int Min;
2573 int Max;
2574 bool PosToIndexConvert; // Begin/End are absolute position (will be converted to indices later)
2575 ImS8 PosToIndexOffsetMin; // Add to Min after converting to indices
2576 ImS8 PosToIndexOffsetMax; // Add to Min after converting to indices
2577
2578 static ImGuiListClipperRange FromIndices(int min, int max)
2579 {
2580 ImGuiListClipperRange r = {min, max, false, 0, 0};
2581 return r;
2582 }
2583 static ImGuiListClipperRange FromPositions(float y1, float y2, int off_min, int off_max)
2584 {
2585 ImGuiListClipperRange r = {(int)y1, (int)y2, true, (ImS8)off_min, (ImS8)off_max};
2586 return r;
2587 }
2588};
2589
2590// Temporary clipper data, buffers shared/reused between instances
2591struct ImGuiListClipperData
2592{
2593 ImGuiListClipper *ListClipper;
2594 float LossynessOffset;
2595 int StepNo;
2596 int ItemsFrozen;
2597 ImVector<ImGuiListClipperRange> Ranges;
2598
2599 ImGuiListClipperData()
2600 {
2601 memset(this, 0, sizeof(*this));
2602 }
2603 void Reset(ImGuiListClipper *clipper)
2604 {
2605 ListClipper = clipper;
2606 StepNo = ItemsFrozen = 0;
2607 Ranges.resize(0);
2608 }
2609};
2610
2611//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
2612// [SECTION] Navigation support
2613//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
2614
2615enum ImGuiActivateFlags_
2616{
2617 ImGuiActivateFlags_None = 0,
2618 ImGuiActivateFlags_PreferInput =
2619 1 << 0, // Favor activation that requires keyboard text input (e.g. for Slider/Drag). Default for Enter key.
2620 ImGuiActivateFlags_PreferTweak = 1 << 1, // Favor activation for tweaking with arrows or gamepad (e.g. for
2621 // Slider/Drag). Default for Space key and if keyboard is not used.
2622 ImGuiActivateFlags_TryToPreserveState =
2623 1 << 2, // Request widget to preserve state if it can (e.g. InputText will try to preserve cursor/selection)
2624 ImGuiActivateFlags_FromTabbing = 1 << 3, // Activation requested by a tabbing request
2625 ImGuiActivateFlags_FromShortcut =
2626 1 << 4, // Activation requested by an item shortcut via SetNextItemShortcut() function.
2627};
2628
2629// Early work-in-progress API for ScrollToItem()
2630enum ImGuiScrollFlags_
2631{
2632 ImGuiScrollFlags_None = 0,
2633 ImGuiScrollFlags_KeepVisibleEdgeX = 1 << 0, // If item is not visible: scroll as little as possible on X axis to
2634 // bring item back into view [default for X axis]
2635 ImGuiScrollFlags_KeepVisibleEdgeY =
2636 1 << 1, // If item is not visible: scroll as little as possible on Y axis to bring item back into view [default
2637 // for Y axis for windows that are already visible]
2638 ImGuiScrollFlags_KeepVisibleCenterX =
2639 1 << 2, // If item is not visible: scroll to make the item centered on X axis [rarely used]
2640 ImGuiScrollFlags_KeepVisibleCenterY = 1 << 3, // If item is not visible: scroll to make the item centered on Y axis
2641 ImGuiScrollFlags_AlwaysCenterX = 1 << 4, // Always center the result item on X axis [rarely used]
2642 ImGuiScrollFlags_AlwaysCenterY =
2643 1 << 5, // Always center the result item on Y axis [default for Y axis for appearing window)
2644 ImGuiScrollFlags_NoScrollParent = 1 << 6, // Disable forwarding scrolling to parent window if required to keep
2645 // item/rect visible (only scroll window the function was applied to).
2646 ImGuiScrollFlags_MaskX_ =
2647 ImGuiScrollFlags_KeepVisibleEdgeX | ImGuiScrollFlags_KeepVisibleCenterX | ImGuiScrollFlags_AlwaysCenterX,
2648 ImGuiScrollFlags_MaskY_ =
2649 ImGuiScrollFlags_KeepVisibleEdgeY | ImGuiScrollFlags_KeepVisibleCenterY | ImGuiScrollFlags_AlwaysCenterY,
2650};
2651
2652enum ImGuiNavRenderCursorFlags_
2653{
2654 ImGuiNavRenderCursorFlags_None = 0,
2655 ImGuiNavRenderCursorFlags_Compact = 1 << 1, // Compact highlight, no padding/distance from focused item
2656 ImGuiNavRenderCursorFlags_AlwaysDraw = 1 << 2, // Draw rectangular highlight if (g.NavId == id) even when
2657 // g.NavCursorVisible == false, aka even when using the mouse.
2658 ImGuiNavRenderCursorFlags_NoRounding = 1 << 3,
2659#ifndef IMGUI_DISABLE_OBSOLETE_FUNCTIONS
2660 ImGuiNavHighlightFlags_None = ImGuiNavRenderCursorFlags_None, // Renamed in 1.91.4
2661 ImGuiNavHighlightFlags_Compact = ImGuiNavRenderCursorFlags_Compact, // Renamed in 1.91.4
2662 ImGuiNavHighlightFlags_AlwaysDraw = ImGuiNavRenderCursorFlags_AlwaysDraw, // Renamed in 1.91.4
2663 ImGuiNavHighlightFlags_NoRounding = ImGuiNavRenderCursorFlags_NoRounding, // Renamed in 1.91.4
2664#endif
2665};
2666
2667enum ImGuiNavMoveFlags_
2668{
2669 ImGuiNavMoveFlags_None = 0,
2670 ImGuiNavMoveFlags_LoopX = 1 << 0, // On failed request, restart from opposite side
2671 ImGuiNavMoveFlags_LoopY = 1 << 1,
2672 ImGuiNavMoveFlags_WrapX = 1 << 2, // On failed request, request from opposite side one line down (when
2673 // NavDir==right) or one line up (when NavDir==left)
2674 ImGuiNavMoveFlags_WrapY = 1 << 3, // This is not super useful but provided for completeness
2675 ImGuiNavMoveFlags_WrapMask_ =
2676 ImGuiNavMoveFlags_LoopX | ImGuiNavMoveFlags_LoopY | ImGuiNavMoveFlags_WrapX | ImGuiNavMoveFlags_WrapY,
2677 ImGuiNavMoveFlags_AllowCurrentNavId =
2678 1 << 4, // Allow scoring and considering the current NavId as a move target candidate. This is used when the
2679 // move source is offset (e.g. pressing PageDown actually needs to send a Up move request, if we are
2680 // pressing PageDown from the bottom-most item we need to stay in place)
2681 ImGuiNavMoveFlags_AlsoScoreVisibleSet =
2682 1 << 5, // Store alternate result in NavMoveResultLocalVisible that only comprise elements that are already
2683 // fully visible (used by PageUp/PageDown)
2684 ImGuiNavMoveFlags_ScrollToEdgeY = 1 << 6, // Force scrolling to min/max (used by Home/End) // FIXME-NAV: Aim to
2685 // remove or reword, probably unnecessary
2686 ImGuiNavMoveFlags_Forwarded = 1 << 7,
2687 ImGuiNavMoveFlags_DebugNoResult = 1 << 8, // Dummy scoring for debug purpose, don't apply result
2688 ImGuiNavMoveFlags_FocusApi = 1 << 9, // Requests from focus API can land/focus/activate items even if they are
2689 // marked with _NoTabStop (see NavProcessItemForTabbingRequest() for details)
2690 ImGuiNavMoveFlags_IsTabbing = 1 << 10, // == Focus + Activate if item is Inputable + DontChangeNavHighlight
2691 ImGuiNavMoveFlags_IsPageMove = 1 << 11, // Identify a PageDown/PageUp request.
2692 ImGuiNavMoveFlags_Activate = 1 << 12, // Activate/select target item.
2693 ImGuiNavMoveFlags_NoSelect = 1 << 13, // Don't trigger selection by not setting g.NavJustMovedTo
2694 ImGuiNavMoveFlags_NoSetNavCursorVisible = 1 << 14, // Do not alter the nav cursor visible state
2695 ImGuiNavMoveFlags_NoClearActiveId = 1 << 15, // (Experimental) Do not clear active id when applying move result
2696};
2697
2698enum ImGuiNavLayer
2699{
2700 ImGuiNavLayer_Main = 0, // Main scrolling layer
2701 ImGuiNavLayer_Menu = 1, // Menu layer (access with Alt)
2702 ImGuiNavLayer_COUNT
2703};
2704
2705// Storage for navigation query/results
2706struct ImGuiNavItemData
2707{
2708 ImGuiWindow
2709 *Window; // Init,Move // Best candidate window (result->ItemWindow->RootWindowForNav == request->Window)
2710 ImGuiID ID; // Init,Move // Best candidate item ID
2711 ImGuiID FocusScopeId; // Init,Move // Best candidate focus scope ID
2712 ImRect RectRel; // Init,Move // Best candidate bounding box in window relative space
2713 ImGuiItemFlags ItemFlags; // ????,Move // Best candidate item flags
2714 float DistBox; // Move // Best candidate box distance to current NavId
2715 float DistCenter; // Move // Best candidate center distance to current NavId
2716 float DistAxial; // Move // Best candidate axial distance to current NavId
2717 ImGuiSelectionUserData SelectionUserData; // I+Mov // Best candidate SetNextItemSelectionUserData() value. Valid
2718 // if (ItemFlags & ImGuiItemFlags_HasSelectionUserData)
2719
2720 ImGuiNavItemData()
2721 {
2722 Clear();
2723 }
2724 void Clear()
2725 {
2726 Window = NULL;
2727 ID = FocusScopeId = 0;
2728 ItemFlags = 0;
2729 SelectionUserData = -1;
2730 DistBox = DistCenter = DistAxial = FLT_MAX;
2731 }
2732};
2733
2734// Storage for PushFocusScope(), g.FocusScopeStack[], g.NavFocusRoute[]
2735struct ImGuiFocusScopeData
2736{
2737 ImGuiID ID;
2738 ImGuiID WindowID;
2739};
2740
2741//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
2742// [SECTION] Typing-select support
2743//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
2744
2745// Flags for GetTypingSelectRequest()
2746enum ImGuiTypingSelectFlags_
2747{
2748 ImGuiTypingSelectFlags_None = 0,
2749 ImGuiTypingSelectFlags_AllowBackspace =
2750 1 << 0, // Backspace to delete character inputs. If using: ensure GetTypingSelectRequest() is not called more
2751 // than once per frame (filter by e.g. focus state)
2752 ImGuiTypingSelectFlags_AllowSingleCharMode =
2753 1 << 1, // Allow "single char" search mode which is activated when pressing the same character multiple times.
2754};
2755
2756// Returned by GetTypingSelectRequest(), designed to eventually be public.
2757struct IMGUI_API ImGuiTypingSelectRequest
2758{
2759 ImGuiTypingSelectFlags Flags; // Flags passed to GetTypingSelectRequest()
2760 int SearchBufferLen;
2761 const char *SearchBuffer; // Search buffer contents (use full string. unless SingleCharMode is set, in which case
2762 // use SingleCharSize).
2763 bool SelectRequest; // Set when buffer was modified this frame, requesting a selection.
2764 bool SingleCharMode; // Notify when buffer contains same character repeated, to implement special mode. In this
2765 // situation it preferred to not display any on-screen search indication.
2766 ImS8 SingleCharSize; // Length in bytes of first letter codepoint (1 for ascii, 2-4 for UTF-8). If
2767 // (SearchBufferLen==RepeatCharSize) only 1 letter has been input.
2768};
2769
2770// Storage for GetTypingSelectRequest()
2771struct IMGUI_API ImGuiTypingSelectState
2772{
2773 ImGuiTypingSelectRequest Request; // User-facing data
2774 char SearchBuffer[64]; // Search buffer: no need to make dynamic as this search is very transient.
2775 ImGuiID FocusScope;
2776 int LastRequestFrame = 0;
2777 float LastRequestTime = 0.0f;
2778 bool SingleCharModeLock =
2779 false; // After a certain single char repeat count we lock into SingleCharMode. Two benefits: 1) buffer never
2780 // fill, 2) we can provide an immediate SingleChar mode without timer elapsing.
2781
2782 ImGuiTypingSelectState()
2783 {
2784 memset(this, 0, sizeof(*this));
2785 }
2786 void Clear()
2787 {
2788 SearchBuffer[0] = 0;
2789 SingleCharModeLock = false;
2790 } // We preserve remaining data for easier debugging
2791};
2792
2793//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
2794// [SECTION] Columns support
2795//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
2796
2797// Flags for internal's BeginColumns(). This is an obsolete API. Prefer using BeginTable() nowadays!
2798enum ImGuiOldColumnFlags_
2799{
2800 ImGuiOldColumnFlags_None = 0,
2801 ImGuiOldColumnFlags_NoBorder = 1 << 0, // Disable column dividers
2802 ImGuiOldColumnFlags_NoResize = 1 << 1, // Disable resizing columns when clicking on the dividers
2803 ImGuiOldColumnFlags_NoPreserveWidths = 1 << 2, // Disable column width preservation when adjusting columns
2804 ImGuiOldColumnFlags_NoForceWithinWindow = 1 << 3, // Disable forcing columns to fit within window
2805 ImGuiOldColumnFlags_GrowParentContentsSize =
2806 1 << 4, // Restore pre-1.51 behavior of extending the parent window contents size but _without affecting the
2807 // columns width at all_. Will eventually remove.
2808
2809 // Obsolete names (will be removed)
2810#ifndef IMGUI_DISABLE_OBSOLETE_FUNCTIONS
2811 // ImGuiColumnsFlags_None = ImGuiOldColumnFlags_None,
2812 // ImGuiColumnsFlags_NoBorder = ImGuiOldColumnFlags_NoBorder,
2813 // ImGuiColumnsFlags_NoResize = ImGuiOldColumnFlags_NoResize,
2814 // ImGuiColumnsFlags_NoPreserveWidths = ImGuiOldColumnFlags_NoPreserveWidths,
2815 // ImGuiColumnsFlags_NoForceWithinWindow = ImGuiOldColumnFlags_NoForceWithinWindow,
2816 // ImGuiColumnsFlags_GrowParentContentsSize = ImGuiOldColumnFlags_GrowParentContentsSize,
2817#endif
2818};
2819
2820struct ImGuiOldColumnData
2821{
2822 float OffsetNorm; // Column start offset, normalized 0.0 (far left) -> 1.0 (far right)
2823 float OffsetNormBeforeResize;
2824 ImGuiOldColumnFlags Flags; // Not exposed
2825 ImRect ClipRect;
2826
2827 ImGuiOldColumnData()
2828 {
2829 memset(this, 0, sizeof(*this));
2830 }
2831};
2832
2833struct ImGuiOldColumns
2834{
2835 ImGuiID ID;
2836 ImGuiOldColumnFlags Flags;
2837 bool IsFirstFrame;
2838 bool IsBeingResized;
2839 int Current;
2840 int Count;
2841 float OffMinX, OffMaxX; // Offsets from HostWorkRect.Min.x
2842 float LineMinY, LineMaxY;
2843 float HostCursorPosY; // Backup of CursorPos at the time of BeginColumns()
2844 float HostCursorMaxPosX; // Backup of CursorMaxPos at the time of BeginColumns()
2845 ImRect HostInitialClipRect; // Backup of ClipRect at the time of BeginColumns()
2846 ImRect HostBackupClipRect; // Backup of ClipRect during PushColumnsBackground()/PopColumnsBackground()
2847 ImRect HostBackupParentWorkRect; // Backup of WorkRect at the time of BeginColumns()
2848 ImVector<ImGuiOldColumnData> Columns;
2849 ImDrawListSplitter Splitter;
2850
2851 ImGuiOldColumns()
2852 {
2853 memset(this, 0, sizeof(*this));
2854 }
2855};
2856
2857//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
2858// [SECTION] Box-select support
2859//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
2860
2861struct ImGuiBoxSelectState
2862{
2863 // Active box-selection data (persistent, 1 active at a time)
2864 ImGuiID ID;
2865 bool IsActive;
2866 bool IsStarting;
2867 bool IsStartedFromVoid; // Starting click was not from an item.
2868 bool IsStartedSetNavIdOnce;
2869 bool RequestClear;
2870 ImGuiKeyChord KeyMods : 16; // Latched key-mods for box-select logic.
2871 ImVec2 StartPosRel; // Start position in window-contents relative space (to support scrolling)
2872 ImVec2 EndPosRel; // End position in window-contents relative space
2873 ImVec2 ScrollAccum; // Scrolling accumulator (to behave at high-frame spaces)
2874 ImGuiWindow *Window;
2875
2876 // Temporary/Transient data
2877 bool UnclipMode; // (Temp/Transient, here in hot area). Set/cleared by the BeginMultiSelect()/EndMultiSelect()
2878 // owning active box-select.
2879 ImRect UnclipRect; // Rectangle where ItemAdd() clipping may be temporarily disabled. Need support by multi-select
2880 // supporting widgets.
2881 ImRect BoxSelectRectPrev; // Selection rectangle in absolute coordinates (derived every frame from
2882 // BoxSelectStartPosRel and MousePos)
2883 ImRect BoxSelectRectCurr;
2884
2885 ImGuiBoxSelectState()
2886 {
2887 memset(this, 0, sizeof(*this));
2888 }
2889};
2890
2891//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
2892// [SECTION] Multi-select support
2893//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
2894
2895// We always assume that -1 is an invalid value (which works for indices and pointers)
2896#define ImGuiSelectionUserData_Invalid ((ImGuiSelectionUserData) - 1)
2897
2898// Temporary storage for multi-select
2899struct IMGUI_API ImGuiMultiSelectTempData
2900{
2901 ImGuiMultiSelectIO IO; // MUST BE FIRST FIELD. Requests are set and returned by BeginMultiSelect()/EndMultiSelect()
2902 // + written to by user during the loop.
2903 ImGuiMultiSelectState *Storage;
2904 ImGuiID FocusScopeId; // Copied from g.CurrentFocusScopeId (unless another selection scope was pushed manually)
2905 ImGuiMultiSelectFlags Flags;
2906 ImVec2 ScopeRectMin;
2907 ImVec2 BackupCursorMaxPos;
2908 ImGuiSelectionUserData LastSubmittedItem; // Copy of last submitted item data, used to merge output ranges.
2909 ImGuiID BoxSelectId;
2910 ImGuiKeyChord KeyMods;
2911 ImS8 LoopRequestSetAll; // -1: no operation, 0: clear all, 1: select all.
2912 bool IsEndIO; // Set when switching IO from BeginMultiSelect() to EndMultiSelect() state.
2913 bool IsFocused; // Set if currently focusing the selection scope (any item of the selection). May be used if you
2914 // have custom shortcut associated to selection.
2915 bool IsKeyboardSetRange; // Set by BeginMultiSelect() when using Shift+Navigation. Because scrolling may be affected
2916 // we can't afford a frame of lag with Shift+Navigation.
2917 bool NavIdPassedBy;
2918 bool RangeSrcPassedBy; // Set by the item that matches RangeSrcItem.
2919 bool RangeDstPassedBy; // Set by the item that matches NavJustMovedToId when IsSetRange is set.
2920
2921 ImGuiMultiSelectTempData()
2922 {
2923 Clear();
2924 }
2925 void Clear()
2926 {
2927 size_t io_sz = sizeof(IO);
2928 ClearIO();
2929 memset((void *)(&IO + 1), 0, sizeof(*this) - io_sz);
2930 } // Zero-clear except IO as we preserve IO.Requests[] buffer allocation.
2931 void ClearIO()
2932 {
2933 IO.Requests.resize(0);
2934 IO.RangeSrcItem = IO.NavIdItem = ImGuiSelectionUserData_Invalid;
2935 IO.NavIdSelected = IO.RangeSrcReset = false;
2936 }
2937};
2938
2939// Persistent storage for multi-select (as long as selection is alive)
2940struct IMGUI_API ImGuiMultiSelectState
2941{
2942 ImGuiWindow *Window;
2943 ImGuiID ID;
2944 int LastFrameActive; // Last used frame-count, for GC.
2945 int LastSelectionSize; // Set by BeginMultiSelect() based on optional info provided by user. May be -1 if unknown.
2946 ImS8 RangeSelected; // -1 (don't have) or true/false
2947 ImS8 NavIdSelected; // -1 (don't have) or true/false
2948 ImGuiSelectionUserData RangeSrcItem; //
2949 ImGuiSelectionUserData NavIdItem; // SetNextItemSelectionUserData() value for NavId (if part of submitted items)
2950
2951 ImGuiMultiSelectState()
2952 {
2953 Window = NULL;
2954 ID = 0;
2955 LastFrameActive = LastSelectionSize = 0;
2956 RangeSelected = NavIdSelected = -1;
2957 RangeSrcItem = NavIdItem = ImGuiSelectionUserData_Invalid;
2958 }
2959};
2960
2961//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
2962// [SECTION] Docking support
2963//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
2964
2965#define DOCKING_HOST_DRAW_CHANNEL_BG 0 // Dock host: background fill
2966#define DOCKING_HOST_DRAW_CHANNEL_FG 1 // Dock host: decorations and contents
2967
2968#ifdef IMGUI_HAS_DOCK
2969
2970// Extend ImGuiDockNodeFlags_
2971enum ImGuiDockNodeFlagsPrivate_
2972{
2973 // [Internal]
2974 ImGuiDockNodeFlags_DockSpace = 1 << 10, // Saved // A dockspace is a node that occupy space within an existing user
2975 // window. Otherwise the node is floating and create its own window.
2976 ImGuiDockNodeFlags_CentralNode = 1 << 11, // Saved // The central node has 2 main properties: stay visible when
2977 // empty, only use "remaining" spaces from its neighbor.
2978 ImGuiDockNodeFlags_NoTabBar =
2979 1 << 12, // Saved // Tab bar is completely unavailable. No triangle in the corner to enable it back.
2980 ImGuiDockNodeFlags_HiddenTabBar =
2981 1 << 13, // Saved // Tab bar is hidden, with a triangle in the corner to show it again (NB: actual tab-bar
2982 // instance may be destroyed as this is only used for single-window tab bar)
2983 ImGuiDockNodeFlags_NoWindowMenuButton =
2984 1 << 14, // Saved // Disable window/docking menu (that one that appears instead of the collapse button)
2985 ImGuiDockNodeFlags_NoCloseButton = 1 << 15, // Saved // Disable close button
2986 ImGuiDockNodeFlags_NoResizeX = 1 << 16, // //
2987 ImGuiDockNodeFlags_NoResizeY = 1 << 17, // //
2988 ImGuiDockNodeFlags_DockedWindowsInFocusRoute =
2989 1 << 18, // // Any docked window will be automatically be focus-route chained
2990 // (window->ParentWindowForFocusRoute set to this) so Shortcut() in this window can run when any
2991 // docked window is focused.
2992
2993 // Disable docking/undocking actions in this dockspace or individual node (existing docked nodes will be preserved)
2994 // Those are not exposed in public because the desirable sharing/inheriting/copy-flag-on-split behaviors are quite
2995 // difficult to design and understand. The two public flags
2996 // ImGuiDockNodeFlags_NoDockingOverCentralNode/ImGuiDockNodeFlags_NoDockingSplit don't have those issues.
2997 ImGuiDockNodeFlags_NoDockingSplitOther = 1 << 19, // // Disable this node from splitting other windows/nodes.
2998 ImGuiDockNodeFlags_NoDockingOverMe =
2999 1 << 20, // // Disable other windows/nodes from being docked over this node.
3000 ImGuiDockNodeFlags_NoDockingOverOther =
3001 1 << 21, // // Disable this node from being docked over another window or non-empty node.
3002 ImGuiDockNodeFlags_NoDockingOverEmpty =
3003 1
3004 << 22, // // Disable this node from being docked over an empty node (e.g. DockSpace with no other windows)
3005 ImGuiDockNodeFlags_NoDocking = ImGuiDockNodeFlags_NoDockingOverMe | ImGuiDockNodeFlags_NoDockingOverOther |
3006 ImGuiDockNodeFlags_NoDockingOverEmpty | ImGuiDockNodeFlags_NoDockingSplit |
3007 ImGuiDockNodeFlags_NoDockingSplitOther,
3008
3009 // Masks
3010 ImGuiDockNodeFlags_SharedFlagsInheritMask_ = ~0,
3011 ImGuiDockNodeFlags_NoResizeFlagsMask_ =
3012 (int)ImGuiDockNodeFlags_NoResize | ImGuiDockNodeFlags_NoResizeX | ImGuiDockNodeFlags_NoResizeY,
3013
3014 // When splitting, those local flags are moved to the inheriting child, never duplicated
3015 ImGuiDockNodeFlags_LocalFlagsTransferMask_ =
3016 (int)ImGuiDockNodeFlags_NoDockingSplit | ImGuiDockNodeFlags_NoResizeFlagsMask_ |
3017 (int)ImGuiDockNodeFlags_AutoHideTabBar | ImGuiDockNodeFlags_CentralNode | ImGuiDockNodeFlags_NoTabBar |
3018 ImGuiDockNodeFlags_HiddenTabBar | ImGuiDockNodeFlags_NoWindowMenuButton | ImGuiDockNodeFlags_NoCloseButton,
3019 ImGuiDockNodeFlags_SavedFlagsMask_ = ImGuiDockNodeFlags_NoResizeFlagsMask_ | ImGuiDockNodeFlags_DockSpace |
3020 ImGuiDockNodeFlags_CentralNode | ImGuiDockNodeFlags_NoTabBar |
3021 ImGuiDockNodeFlags_HiddenTabBar | ImGuiDockNodeFlags_NoWindowMenuButton |
3022 ImGuiDockNodeFlags_NoCloseButton,
3023};
3024
3025// Store the source authority (dock node vs window) of a field
3026enum ImGuiDataAuthority_
3027{
3028 ImGuiDataAuthority_Auto,
3029 ImGuiDataAuthority_DockNode,
3030 ImGuiDataAuthority_Window,
3031};
3032
3033enum ImGuiDockNodeState
3034{
3035 ImGuiDockNodeState_Unknown,
3036 ImGuiDockNodeState_HostWindowHiddenBecauseSingleWindow,
3037 ImGuiDockNodeState_HostWindowHiddenBecauseWindowsAreResizing,
3038 ImGuiDockNodeState_HostWindowVisible,
3039};
3040
3041// sizeof() 156~192
3042struct IMGUI_API ImGuiDockNode
3043{
3044 ImGuiID ID;
3045 ImGuiDockNodeFlags
3046 SharedFlags; // (Write) Flags shared by all nodes of a same dockspace hierarchy (inherited from the root node)
3047 ImGuiDockNodeFlags LocalFlags; // (Write) Flags specific to this node
3048 ImGuiDockNodeFlags LocalFlagsInWindows; // (Write) Flags specific to this node, applied from windows
3049 ImGuiDockNodeFlags MergedFlags; // (Read) Effective flags (== SharedFlags | LocalFlagsInNode | LocalFlagsInWindows)
3050 ImGuiDockNodeState State;
3051 ImGuiDockNode *ParentNode;
3052 ImGuiDockNode
3053 *ChildNodes[2]; // [Split node only] Child nodes (left/right or top/bottom). Consider switching to an array.
3054 ImVector<ImGuiWindow *> Windows; // Note: unordered list! Iterate TabBar->Tabs for user-order.
3055 ImGuiTabBar *TabBar;
3056 ImVec2 Pos; // Current position
3057 ImVec2 Size; // Current size
3058 ImVec2 SizeRef; // [Split node only] Last explicitly written-to size (overridden when using a splitter affecting the
3059 // node), used to calculate Size.
3060 ImGuiAxis SplitAxis; // [Split node only] Split axis (X or Y)
3061 ImGuiWindowClass WindowClass; // [Root node only]
3062 ImU32 LastBgColor;
3063
3064 ImGuiWindow *HostWindow;
3065 ImGuiWindow *VisibleWindow; // Generally point to window which is ID is == SelectedTabID, but when CTRL+Tabbing this
3066 // can be a different window.
3067 ImGuiDockNode *CentralNode; // [Root node only] Pointer to central node.
3068 ImGuiDockNode
3069 *OnlyNodeWithWindows; // [Root node only] Set when there is a single visible node within the hierarchy.
3070 int CountNodeWithWindows; // [Root node only]
3071 int LastFrameAlive; // Last frame number the node was updated or kept alive explicitly with DockSpace() +
3072 // ImGuiDockNodeFlags_KeepAliveOnly
3073 int LastFrameActive; // Last frame number the node was updated.
3074 int LastFrameFocused; // Last frame number the node was focused.
3075 ImGuiID LastFocusedNodeId; // [Root node only] Which of our child docking node (any ancestor in the hierarchy) was
3076 // last focused.
3077 ImGuiID SelectedTabId; // [Leaf node only] Which of our tab/window is selected.
3078 ImGuiID WantCloseTabId; // [Leaf node only] Set when closing a specific tab/window.
3079 ImGuiID RefViewportId; // Reference viewport ID from visible window when HostWindow == NULL.
3080 ImGuiDataAuthority AuthorityForPos : 3;
3081 ImGuiDataAuthority AuthorityForSize : 3;
3082 ImGuiDataAuthority AuthorityForViewport : 3;
3083 bool IsVisible : 1; // Set to false when the node is hidden (usually disabled as it has no active window)
3084 bool IsFocused : 1;
3085 bool IsBgDrawnThisFrame : 1;
3086 bool HasCloseButton : 1; // Provide space for a close button (if any of the docked window has one). Note that button
3087 // may be hidden on window without one.
3088 bool HasWindowMenuButton : 1;
3089 bool HasCentralNodeChild : 1;
3090 bool WantCloseAll : 1; // Set when closing all tabs at once.
3091 bool WantLockSizeOnce : 1;
3092 bool WantMouseMove : 1; // After a node extraction we need to transition toward moving the newly created host window
3093 bool WantHiddenTabBarUpdate : 1;
3094 bool WantHiddenTabBarToggle : 1;
3095
3096 ImGuiDockNode(ImGuiID id);
3097 ~ImGuiDockNode();
3098 bool IsRootNode() const
3099 {
3100 return ParentNode == NULL;
3101 }
3102 bool IsDockSpace() const
3103 {
3104 return (MergedFlags & ImGuiDockNodeFlags_DockSpace) != 0;
3105 }
3106 bool IsFloatingNode() const
3107 {
3108 return ParentNode == NULL && (MergedFlags & ImGuiDockNodeFlags_DockSpace) == 0;
3109 }
3110 bool IsCentralNode() const
3111 {
3112 return (MergedFlags & ImGuiDockNodeFlags_CentralNode) != 0;
3113 }
3114 bool IsHiddenTabBar() const
3115 {
3116 return (MergedFlags & ImGuiDockNodeFlags_HiddenTabBar) != 0;
3117 } // Hidden tab bar can be shown back by clicking the small triangle
3118 bool IsNoTabBar() const
3119 {
3120 return (MergedFlags & ImGuiDockNodeFlags_NoTabBar) != 0;
3121 } // Never show a tab bar
3122 bool IsSplitNode() const
3123 {
3124 return ChildNodes[0] != NULL;
3125 }
3126 bool IsLeafNode() const
3127 {
3128 return ChildNodes[0] == NULL;
3129 }
3130 bool IsEmpty() const
3131 {
3132 return ChildNodes[0] == NULL && Windows.Size == 0;
3133 }
3134 ImRect Rect() const
3135 {
3136 return ImRect(Pos.x, Pos.y, Pos.x + Size.x, Pos.y + Size.y);
3137 }
3138
3139 void SetLocalFlags(ImGuiDockNodeFlags flags)
3140 {
3141 LocalFlags = flags;
3142 UpdateMergedFlags();
3143 }
3144 void UpdateMergedFlags()
3145 {
3146 MergedFlags = SharedFlags | LocalFlags | LocalFlagsInWindows;
3147 }
3148};
3149
3150// List of colors that are stored at the time of Begin() into Docked Windows.
3151// We currently store the packed colors in a simple array window->DockStyle.Colors[].
3152// A better solution may involve appending into a log of colors in ImGuiContext + store offsets into those arrays in
3153// ImGuiWindow, but it would be more complex as we'd need to double-buffer both as e.g. drop target may refer to window
3154// from last frame.
3155enum ImGuiWindowDockStyleCol
3156{
3157 ImGuiWindowDockStyleCol_Text,
3158 ImGuiWindowDockStyleCol_TabHovered,
3159 ImGuiWindowDockStyleCol_TabFocused,
3160 ImGuiWindowDockStyleCol_TabSelected,
3161 ImGuiWindowDockStyleCol_TabSelectedOverline,
3162 ImGuiWindowDockStyleCol_TabDimmed,
3163 ImGuiWindowDockStyleCol_TabDimmedSelected,
3164 ImGuiWindowDockStyleCol_TabDimmedSelectedOverline,
3165 ImGuiWindowDockStyleCol_COUNT
3166};
3167
3168// We don't store style.Alpha: dock_node->LastBgColor embeds it and otherwise it would only affect the docking tab,
3169// which intuitively I would say we don't want to.
3170struct ImGuiWindowDockStyle
3171{
3172 ImU32 Colors[ImGuiWindowDockStyleCol_COUNT];
3173};
3174
3175struct ImGuiDockContext
3176{
3177 ImGuiStorage Nodes; // Map ID -> ImGuiDockNode*: Active nodes
3178 ImVector<ImGuiDockRequest> Requests;
3179 ImVector<ImGuiDockNodeSettings> NodesSettings;
3180 bool WantFullRebuild;
3181 ImGuiDockContext()
3182 {
3183 memset(this, 0, sizeof(*this));
3184 }
3185};
3186
3187#endif // #ifdef IMGUI_HAS_DOCK
3188
3189//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
3190// [SECTION] Viewport support
3191//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
3192
3193// ImGuiViewport Private/Internals fields (cardinal sin: we are using inheritance!)
3194// Every instance of ImGuiViewport is in fact a ImGuiViewportP.
3195struct ImGuiViewportP : public ImGuiViewport
3196{
3197 ImGuiWindow
3198 *Window; // Set when the viewport is owned by a window (and ImGuiViewportFlags_CanHostOtherWindows is NOT set)
3199 int Idx;
3200 int LastFrameActive; // Last frame number this viewport was activated by a window
3201 int LastFocusedStampCount; // Last stamp number from when a window hosted by this viewport was focused (by comparing
3202 // this value between two viewport we have an implicit viewport z-order we use as
3203 // fallback)
3204 ImGuiID LastNameHash;
3205 ImVec2 LastPos;
3206 ImVec2 LastSize;
3207 float Alpha; // Window opacity (when dragging dockable windows/viewports we make them transparent)
3208 float LastAlpha;
3209 bool
3210 LastFocusedHadNavWindow; // Instead of maintaining a LastFocusedWindow (which may harder to correctly maintain),
3211 // we merely store weither NavWindow != NULL last time the viewport was focused.
3212 short PlatformMonitor;
3213 int BgFgDrawListsLastFrame[2]; // Last frame number the background (0) and foreground (1) draw lists were used
3214 ImDrawList
3215 *BgFgDrawLists[2]; // Convenience background (0) and foreground (1) draw lists. We use them to draw software
3216 // mouser cursor when io.MouseDrawCursor is set and to draw most debug overlays.
3217 ImDrawData DrawDataP;
3218 ImDrawDataBuilder DrawDataBuilder; // Temporary data while building final ImDrawData
3219 ImVec2 LastPlatformPos;
3220 ImVec2 LastPlatformSize;
3221 ImVec2 LastRendererSize;
3222
3223 // Per-viewport work area
3224 // - Insets are >= 0.0f values, distance from viewport corners to work area.
3225 // - BeginMainMenuBar() and DockspaceOverViewport() tend to use work area to avoid stepping over existing contents.
3226 // - Generally 'safeAreaInsets' in iOS land, 'DisplayCutout' in Android land.
3227 ImVec2 WorkInsetMin; // Work Area inset locked for the frame. GetWorkRect() always fits within GetMainRect().
3228 ImVec2 WorkInsetMax; // "
3229 ImVec2 BuildWorkInsetMin; // Work Area inset accumulator for current frame, to become next frame's WorkInset
3230 ImVec2 BuildWorkInsetMax; // "
3231
3232 ImGuiViewportP()
3233 {
3234 Window = NULL;
3235 Idx = -1;
3236 LastFrameActive = BgFgDrawListsLastFrame[0] = BgFgDrawListsLastFrame[1] = LastFocusedStampCount = -1;
3237 LastNameHash = 0;
3238 Alpha = LastAlpha = 1.0f;
3239 LastFocusedHadNavWindow = false;
3240 PlatformMonitor = -1;
3241 BgFgDrawLists[0] = BgFgDrawLists[1] = NULL;
3242 LastPlatformPos = LastPlatformSize = LastRendererSize = ImVec2(FLT_MAX, FLT_MAX);
3243 }
3244 ~ImGuiViewportP()
3245 {
3246 if (BgFgDrawLists[0])
3247 IM_DELETE(BgFgDrawLists[0]);
3248 if (BgFgDrawLists[1])
3249 IM_DELETE(BgFgDrawLists[1]);
3250 }
3251 void ClearRequestFlags()
3252 {
3253 PlatformRequestClose = PlatformRequestMove = PlatformRequestResize = false;
3254 }
3255
3256 // Calculate work rect pos/size given a set of offset (we have 1 pair of offset for rect locked from last frame
3257 // data, and 1 pair for currently building rect)
3258 ImVec2 CalcWorkRectPos(const ImVec2 &inset_min) const
3259 {
3260 return ImVec2(Pos.x + inset_min.x, Pos.y + inset_min.y);
3261 }
3262 ImVec2 CalcWorkRectSize(const ImVec2 &inset_min, const ImVec2 &inset_max) const
3263 {
3264 return ImVec2(ImMax(0.0f, Size.x - inset_min.x - inset_max.x), ImMax(0.0f, Size.y - inset_min.y - inset_max.y));
3265 }
3266 void UpdateWorkRect()
3267 {
3268 WorkPos = CalcWorkRectPos(WorkInsetMin);
3269 WorkSize = CalcWorkRectSize(WorkInsetMin, WorkInsetMax);
3270 } // Update public fields
3271
3272 // Helpers to retrieve ImRect (we don't need to store BuildWorkRect as every access tend to change it, hence the
3273 // code asymmetry)
3274 ImRect GetMainRect() const
3275 {
3276 return ImRect(Pos.x, Pos.y, Pos.x + Size.x, Pos.y + Size.y);
3277 }
3278 ImRect GetWorkRect() const
3279 {
3280 return ImRect(WorkPos.x, WorkPos.y, WorkPos.x + WorkSize.x, WorkPos.y + WorkSize.y);
3281 }
3282 ImRect GetBuildWorkRect() const
3283 {
3284 ImVec2 pos = CalcWorkRectPos(BuildWorkInsetMin);
3285 ImVec2 size = CalcWorkRectSize(BuildWorkInsetMin, BuildWorkInsetMax);
3286 return ImRect(pos.x, pos.y, pos.x + size.x, pos.y + size.y);
3287 }
3288};
3289
3290//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
3291// [SECTION] Settings support
3292//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
3293
3294// Windows data saved in imgui.ini file
3295// Because we never destroy or rename ImGuiWindowSettings, we can store the names in a separate buffer easily.
3296// (this is designed to be stored in a ImChunkStream buffer, with the variable-length Name following our structure)
3297struct ImGuiWindowSettings
3298{
3299 ImGuiID ID;
3300 ImVec2ih
3301 Pos; // NB: Settings position are stored RELATIVE to the viewport! Whereas runtime ones are absolute positions.
3302 ImVec2ih Size;
3303 ImVec2ih ViewportPos;
3304 ImGuiID ViewportId;
3305 ImGuiID DockId; // ID of last known DockNode (even if the DockNode is invisible because it has only 1 active
3306 // window), or 0 if none.
3307 ImGuiID ClassId; // ID of window class if specified
3308 short DockOrder; // Order of the last time the window was visible within its DockNode. This is used to reorder
3309 // windows that are reappearing on the same frame. Same value between windows that were active and
3310 // windows that were none are possible.
3311 bool Collapsed;
3312 bool IsChild;
3313 bool WantApply; // Set when loaded from .ini data (to enable merging/loading .ini data into an already running
3314 // context)
3315 bool WantDelete; // Set to invalidate/delete the settings entry
3316
3317 ImGuiWindowSettings()
3318 {
3319 memset(this, 0, sizeof(*this));
3320 DockOrder = -1;
3321 }
3322 char *GetName()
3323 {
3324 return (char *)(this + 1);
3325 }
3326};
3327
3328struct ImGuiSettingsHandler
3329{
3330 const char *TypeName; // Short description stored in .ini file. Disallowed characters: '[' ']'
3331 ImGuiID TypeHash; // == ImHashStr(TypeName)
3332 void (*ClearAllFn)(ImGuiContext *ctx, ImGuiSettingsHandler *handler); // Clear all settings data
3333 void (*ReadInitFn)(ImGuiContext *ctx,
3334 ImGuiSettingsHandler *handler); // Read: Called before reading (in registration order)
3335 void *(*ReadOpenFn)(ImGuiContext *ctx, ImGuiSettingsHandler *handler,
3336 const char *name); // Read: Called when entering into a new ini entry e.g. "[Window][Name]"
3337 void (*ReadLineFn)(ImGuiContext *ctx, ImGuiSettingsHandler *handler, void *entry,
3338 const char *line); // Read: Called for every line of text within an ini entry
3339 void (*ApplyAllFn)(ImGuiContext *ctx,
3340 ImGuiSettingsHandler *handler); // Read: Called after reading (in registration order)
3341 void (*WriteAllFn)(ImGuiContext *ctx, ImGuiSettingsHandler *handler,
3342 ImGuiTextBuffer *out_buf); // Write: Output every entries into 'out_buf'
3343 void *UserData;
3344
3345 ImGuiSettingsHandler()
3346 {
3347 memset(this, 0, sizeof(*this));
3348 }
3349};
3350
3351//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
3352// [SECTION] Localization support
3353//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
3354
3355// This is experimental and not officially supported, it'll probably fall short of features, if/when it does we may
3356// backtrack.
3357enum ImGuiLocKey : int
3358{
3359 ImGuiLocKey_VersionStr,
3360 ImGuiLocKey_TableSizeOne,
3361 ImGuiLocKey_TableSizeAllFit,
3362 ImGuiLocKey_TableSizeAllDefault,
3363 ImGuiLocKey_TableResetOrder,
3364 ImGuiLocKey_WindowingMainMenuBar,
3365 ImGuiLocKey_WindowingPopup,
3366 ImGuiLocKey_WindowingUntitled,
3367 ImGuiLocKey_OpenLink_s,
3368 ImGuiLocKey_CopyLink,
3369 ImGuiLocKey_DockingHideTabBar,
3370 ImGuiLocKey_DockingHoldShiftToDock,
3371 ImGuiLocKey_DockingDragToUndockOrMoveNode,
3372 ImGuiLocKey_COUNT
3373};
3374
3375struct ImGuiLocEntry
3376{
3377 ImGuiLocKey Key;
3378 const char *Text;
3379};
3380
3381//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
3382// [SECTION] Error handling, State recovery support
3383//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
3384
3385// Macros used by Recoverable Error handling
3386// - Only dispatch error if _EXPR: evaluate as assert (similar to an assert macro).
3387// - The message will always be a string literal, in order to increase likelihood of being display by an assert handler.
3388// - See 'Demo->Configuration->Error Handling' and ImGuiIO definitions for details on error handling.
3389// - Read https://github.com/ocornut/imgui/wiki/Error-Handling for details on error handling.
3390#ifndef IM_ASSERT_USER_ERROR
3391#define IM_ASSERT_USER_ERROR(_EXPR, _MSG) \
3392 do \
3393 { \
3394 if (!(_EXPR) && ImGui::ErrorLog(_MSG)) \
3395 { \
3396 IM_ASSERT((_EXPR) && _MSG); \
3397 } \
3398 } while (0) // Recoverable User Error
3399#endif
3400
3401// The error callback is currently not public, as it is expected that only advanced users will rely on it.
3402typedef void (*ImGuiErrorCallback)(ImGuiContext *ctx, void *user_data,
3403 const char *msg); // Function signature for g.ErrorCallback
3404
3405//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
3406// [SECTION] Metrics, Debug Tools
3407//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
3408
3409// See IMGUI_DEBUG_LOG() and IMGUI_DEBUG_LOG_XXX() macros.
3410enum ImGuiDebugLogFlags_
3411{
3412 // Event types
3413 ImGuiDebugLogFlags_None = 0,
3414 ImGuiDebugLogFlags_EventError = 1 << 0, // Error submitted by IM_ASSERT_USER_ERROR()
3415 ImGuiDebugLogFlags_EventActiveId = 1 << 1,
3416 ImGuiDebugLogFlags_EventFocus = 1 << 2,
3417 ImGuiDebugLogFlags_EventPopup = 1 << 3,
3418 ImGuiDebugLogFlags_EventNav = 1 << 4,
3419 ImGuiDebugLogFlags_EventClipper = 1 << 5,
3420 ImGuiDebugLogFlags_EventSelection = 1 << 6,
3421 ImGuiDebugLogFlags_EventIO = 1 << 7,
3422 ImGuiDebugLogFlags_EventFont = 1 << 8,
3423 ImGuiDebugLogFlags_EventInputRouting = 1 << 9,
3424 ImGuiDebugLogFlags_EventDocking = 1 << 10,
3425 ImGuiDebugLogFlags_EventViewport = 1 << 11,
3426
3427 ImGuiDebugLogFlags_EventMask_ =
3428 ImGuiDebugLogFlags_EventError | ImGuiDebugLogFlags_EventActiveId | ImGuiDebugLogFlags_EventFocus |
3429 ImGuiDebugLogFlags_EventPopup | ImGuiDebugLogFlags_EventNav | ImGuiDebugLogFlags_EventClipper |
3430 ImGuiDebugLogFlags_EventSelection | ImGuiDebugLogFlags_EventIO | ImGuiDebugLogFlags_EventFont |
3431 ImGuiDebugLogFlags_EventInputRouting | ImGuiDebugLogFlags_EventDocking | ImGuiDebugLogFlags_EventViewport,
3432 ImGuiDebugLogFlags_OutputToTTY = 1 << 20, // Also send output to TTY
3433 ImGuiDebugLogFlags_OutputToTestEngine = 1 << 21, // Also send output to Test Engine
3434};
3435
3436struct ImGuiDebugAllocEntry
3437{
3438 int FrameCount;
3439 ImS16 AllocCount;
3440 ImS16 FreeCount;
3441};
3442
3443struct ImGuiDebugAllocInfo
3444{
3445 int TotalAllocCount; // Number of call to MemAlloc().
3446 int TotalFreeCount;
3447 ImS16 LastEntriesIdx; // Current index in buffer
3448 ImGuiDebugAllocEntry LastEntriesBuf[6]; // Track last 6 frames that had allocations
3449
3450 ImGuiDebugAllocInfo()
3451 {
3452 memset(this, 0, sizeof(*this));
3453 }
3454};
3455
3456struct ImGuiMetricsConfig
3457{
3458 bool ShowDebugLog = false;
3459 bool ShowIDStackTool = false;
3460 bool ShowWindowsRects = false;
3461 bool ShowWindowsBeginOrder = false;
3462 bool ShowTablesRects = false;
3463 bool ShowDrawCmdMesh = true;
3464 bool ShowDrawCmdBoundingBoxes = true;
3465 bool ShowTextEncodingViewer = false;
3466 bool ShowDockingNodes = false;
3467 int ShowWindowsRectsType = -1;
3468 int ShowTablesRectsType = -1;
3469 int HighlightMonitorIdx = -1;
3470 ImGuiID HighlightViewportID = 0;
3471};
3472
3473struct ImGuiStackLevelInfo
3474{
3475 ImGuiID ID;
3476 ImS8 QueryFrameCount; // >= 1: Query in progress
3477 bool QuerySuccess; // Obtained result from DebugHookIdInfo()
3478 ImGuiDataType DataType : 8;
3479 char Desc[57]; // Arbitrarily sized buffer to hold a result (FIXME: could replace Results[] with a chunk stream?)
3480 // FIXME: Now that we added CTRL+C this should be fixed.
3481
3482 ImGuiStackLevelInfo()
3483 {
3484 memset(this, 0, sizeof(*this));
3485 }
3486};
3487
3488// State for ID Stack tool queries
3489struct ImGuiIDStackTool
3490{
3491 int LastActiveFrame;
3492 int StackLevel; // -1: query stack and resize Results, >= 0: individual stack level
3493 ImGuiID QueryId; // ID to query details for
3494 ImVector<ImGuiStackLevelInfo> Results;
3495 bool CopyToClipboardOnCtrlC;
3496 float CopyToClipboardLastTime;
3497 ImGuiTextBuffer ResultPathBuf;
3498
3499 ImGuiIDStackTool()
3500 {
3501 memset(this, 0, sizeof(*this));
3502 CopyToClipboardLastTime = -FLT_MAX;
3503 }
3504};
3505
3506//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
3507// [SECTION] Generic context hooks
3508//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
3509
3510typedef void (*ImGuiContextHookCallback)(ImGuiContext *ctx, ImGuiContextHook *hook);
3511enum ImGuiContextHookType
3512{
3513 ImGuiContextHookType_NewFramePre,
3514 ImGuiContextHookType_NewFramePost,
3515 ImGuiContextHookType_EndFramePre,
3516 ImGuiContextHookType_EndFramePost,
3517 ImGuiContextHookType_RenderPre,
3518 ImGuiContextHookType_RenderPost,
3519 ImGuiContextHookType_Shutdown,
3520 ImGuiContextHookType_PendingRemoval_
3521};
3522
3523struct ImGuiContextHook
3524{
3525 ImGuiID HookId; // A unique ID assigned by AddContextHook()
3526 ImGuiContextHookType Type;
3527 ImGuiID Owner;
3528 ImGuiContextHookCallback Callback;
3529 void *UserData;
3530
3531 ImGuiContextHook()
3532 {
3533 memset(this, 0, sizeof(*this));
3534 }
3535};
3536
3537//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
3538// [SECTION] ImGuiContext (main Dear ImGui context)
3539//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
3540
3541struct ImGuiContext
3542{
3543 bool Initialized;
3544 bool FontAtlasOwnedByContext; // IO.Fonts-> is owned by the ImGuiContext and will be destructed along with it.
3545 ImGuiIO IO;
3546 ImGuiPlatformIO PlatformIO;
3547 ImGuiStyle Style;
3548 ImGuiConfigFlags ConfigFlagsCurrFrame; // = g.IO.ConfigFlags at the time of NewFrame()
3549 ImGuiConfigFlags ConfigFlagsLastFrame;
3550 ImFont *Font; // (Shortcut) == FontStack.empty() ? IO.Font : FontStack.back()
3551 float FontSize; // (Shortcut) == FontBaseSize * g.CurrentWindow->FontWindowScale == window->FontSize(). Text height
3552 // for current window.
3553 float FontBaseSize; // (Shortcut) == IO.FontGlobalScale * Font->Scale * Font->FontSize. Base text height.
3554 float FontScale; // == FontSize / Font->FontSize
3555 float CurrentDpiScale; // Current window/viewport DpiScale == CurrentViewport->DpiScale
3556 ImDrawListSharedData DrawListSharedData;
3557 double Time;
3558 int FrameCount;
3559 int FrameCountEnded;
3560 int FrameCountPlatformEnded;
3561 int FrameCountRendered;
3562 ImGuiID WithinEndChildID; // Set within EndChild()
3563 bool WithinFrameScope; // Set by NewFrame(), cleared by EndFrame()
3564 bool WithinFrameScopeWithImplicitWindow; // Set by NewFrame(), cleared by EndFrame() when the implicit debug window
3565 // has been pushed
3566 bool GcCompactAll; // Request full GC
3567 bool TestEngineHookItems; // Will call test engine hooks: ImGuiTestEngineHook_ItemAdd(),
3568 // ImGuiTestEngineHook_ItemInfo(), ImGuiTestEngineHook_Log()
3569 void *TestEngine; // Test engine user data
3570 char ContextName[16]; // Storage for a context name (to facilitate debugging multi-context setups)
3571
3572 // Inputs
3573 ImVector<ImGuiInputEvent> InputEventsQueue; // Input events which will be trickled/written into IO structure.
3574 ImVector<ImGuiInputEvent> InputEventsTrail; // Past input events processed in NewFrame(). This is to allow
3575 // domain-specific application to access e.g mouse/pen trail.
3576 ImGuiMouseSource InputEventsNextMouseSource;
3577 ImU32 InputEventsNextEventId;
3578
3579 // Windows state
3580 ImVector<ImGuiWindow *> Windows; // Windows, sorted in display order, back to front
3581 ImVector<ImGuiWindow *> WindowsFocusOrder; // Root windows, sorted in focus order, back to front.
3582 ImVector<ImGuiWindow *> WindowsTempSortBuffer; // Temporary buffer used in EndFrame() to reorder windows so parents
3583 // are kept before their child
3584 ImVector<ImGuiWindowStackData> CurrentWindowStack;
3585 ImGuiStorage WindowsById; // Map window's ImGuiID to ImGuiWindow*
3586 int WindowsActiveCount; // Number of unique windows submitted by frame
3587 float WindowsBorderHoverPadding; // Padding around resizable windows for which hovering on counts as hovering the
3588 // window == ImMax(style.TouchExtraPadding, style.WindowBorderHoverPadding). This
3589 // isn't so multi-dpi friendly.
3590 ImGuiID DebugBreakInWindow; // Set to break in Begin() call.
3591 ImGuiWindow *CurrentWindow; // Window being drawn into
3592 ImGuiWindow *HoveredWindow; // Window the mouse is hovering. Will typically catch mouse inputs.
3593 ImGuiWindow
3594 *HoveredWindowUnderMovingWindow; // Hovered window ignoring MovingWindow. Only set if MovingWindow is set.
3595 ImGuiWindow *HoveredWindowBeforeClear; // Window the mouse is hovering. Filled even with _NoMouse. This is currently
3596 // useful for multi-context compositors.
3597 ImGuiWindow *MovingWindow; // Track the window we clicked on (in order to preserve focus). The actual window that is
3598 // moved is generally MovingWindow->RootWindowDockTree.
3599 ImGuiWindow *WheelingWindow; // Track the window we started mouse-wheeling on. Until a timer elapse or mouse has
3600 // moved, generally keep scrolling the same window even if during the course of
3601 // scrolling the mouse ends up hovering a child window.
3602 ImVec2 WheelingWindowRefMousePos;
3603 int WheelingWindowStartFrame; // This may be set one frame before WheelingWindow is != NULL
3604 int WheelingWindowScrolledFrame;
3605 float WheelingWindowReleaseTimer;
3606 ImVec2 WheelingWindowWheelRemainder;
3607 ImVec2 WheelingAxisAvg;
3608
3609 // Item/widgets state and tracking information
3610 ImGuiID DebugDrawIdConflicts; // Set when we detect multiple items with the same identifier
3611 ImGuiID DebugHookIdInfo; // Will call core hooks: DebugHookIdInfo() from GetID functions, used by ID Stack Tool
3612 // [next HoveredId/ActiveId to not pull in an extra cache-line]
3613 ImGuiID HoveredId; // Hovered widget, filled during the frame
3614 ImGuiID HoveredIdPreviousFrame;
3615 int HoveredIdPreviousFrameItemCount; // Count numbers of items using the same ID as last frame's hovered id
3616 float HoveredIdTimer; // Measure contiguous hovering time
3617 float HoveredIdNotActiveTimer; // Measure contiguous hovering time where the item has not been active
3618 bool HoveredIdAllowOverlap;
3619 bool HoveredIdIsDisabled; // At least one widget passed the rect test, but has been discarded by disabled flag or
3620 // popup inhibit. May be true even if HoveredId == 0.
3621 bool ItemUnclipByLog; // Disable ItemAdd() clipping, essentially a memory-locality friendly copy of LogEnabled
3622 ImGuiID ActiveId; // Active widget
3623 ImGuiID ActiveIdIsAlive; // Active widget has been seen this frame (we can't use a bool as the ActiveId may change
3624 // within the frame)
3625 float ActiveIdTimer;
3626 bool ActiveIdIsJustActivated; // Set at the time of activation for one frame
3627 bool ActiveIdAllowOverlap; // Active widget allows another widget to steal active id (generally for overlapping
3628 // widgets, but not always)
3629 bool ActiveIdNoClearOnFocusLoss; // Disable losing active id if the active id window gets unfocused.
3630 bool ActiveIdHasBeenPressedBefore; // Track whether the active id led to a press (this is to allow changing between
3631 // PressOnClick and PressOnRelease without pressing twice). Used by range_select
3632 // branch.
3633 bool ActiveIdHasBeenEditedBefore; // Was the value associated to the widget Edited over the course of the Active
3634 // state.
3635 bool ActiveIdHasBeenEditedThisFrame;
3636 bool ActiveIdFromShortcut;
3637 int ActiveIdMouseButton : 8;
3638 ImVec2 ActiveIdClickOffset; // Clicked offset from upper-left corner, if applicable (currently only set by
3639 // ButtonBehavior)
3640 ImGuiWindow *ActiveIdWindow;
3641 ImGuiInputSource ActiveIdSource; // Activating source: ImGuiInputSource_Mouse OR ImGuiInputSource_Keyboard OR
3642 // ImGuiInputSource_Gamepad
3643 ImGuiID ActiveIdPreviousFrame;
3644 ImGuiDeactivatedItemData DeactivatedItemData;
3645 ImGuiDataTypeStorage ActiveIdValueOnActivation; // Backup of initial value at the time of activation. ONLY SET BY
3646 // SPECIFIC WIDGETS: DragXXX and SliderXXX.
3647 ImGuiID LastActiveId; // Store the last non-zero ActiveId, useful for animation.
3648 float LastActiveIdTimer; // Store the last non-zero ActiveId timer since the beginning of activation, useful for
3649 // animation.
3650
3651 // Key/Input Ownership + Shortcut Routing system
3652 // - The idea is that instead of "eating" a given key, we can link to an owner.
3653 // - Input query can then read input by specifying ImGuiKeyOwner_Any (== 0), ImGuiKeyOwner_NoOwner (== -1) or a
3654 // custom ID.
3655 // - Routing is requested ahead of time for a given chord (Key + Mods) and granted in NewFrame().
3656 double
3657 LastKeyModsChangeTime; // Record the last time key mods changed (affect repeat delay when using shortcut logic)
3658 double LastKeyModsChangeFromNoneTime; // Record the last time key mods changed away from being 0 (affect repeat
3659 // delay when using shortcut logic)
3660 double LastKeyboardKeyPressTime; // Record the last time a keyboard key (ignore mouse/gamepad ones) was pressed.
3661 ImBitArrayForNamedKeys KeysMayBeCharInput; // Lookup to tell if a key can emit char input, see
3662 // IsKeyChordPotentiallyCharInput(). sizeof() = 20 bytes
3663 ImGuiKeyOwnerData KeysOwnerData[ImGuiKey_NamedKey_COUNT];
3664 ImGuiKeyRoutingTable KeysRoutingTable;
3665 ImU32 ActiveIdUsingNavDirMask; // Active widget will want to read those nav move requests (e.g. can activate a
3666 // button and move away from it)
3667 bool ActiveIdUsingAllKeyboardKeys; // Active widget will want to read all keyboard keys inputs. (this is a shortcut
3668 // for not taking ownership of 100+ keys, frequently used by drag operations)
3669 ImGuiKeyChord DebugBreakInShortcutRouting; // Set to break in SetShortcutRouting()/Shortcut() calls.
3670 // ImU32 ActiveIdUsingNavInputMask; // [OBSOLETE] Since (IMGUI_VERSION_NUM >= 18804) :
3671 // 'g.ActiveIdUsingNavInputMask |= (1 << ImGuiNavInput_Cancel);' becomes --> 'SetKeyOwner(ImGuiKey_Escape,
3672 // g.ActiveId) and/or SetKeyOwner(ImGuiKey_NavGamepadCancel, g.ActiveId);'
3673
3674 // Next window/item data
3675 ImGuiID CurrentFocusScopeId; // Value for currently appending items == g.FocusScopeStack.back(). Not to be mistaken
3676 // with g.NavFocusScopeId.
3677 ImGuiItemFlags CurrentItemFlags; // Value for currently appending items == g.ItemFlagsStack.back()
3678 ImGuiID DebugLocateId; // Storage for DebugLocateItemOnHover() feature: this is read by ItemAdd() so we keep it in a
3679 // hot/cached location
3680 ImGuiNextItemData NextItemData; // Storage for SetNextItem** functions
3681 ImGuiLastItemData LastItemData; // Storage for last submitted item (setup by ItemAdd)
3682 ImGuiNextWindowData NextWindowData; // Storage for SetNextWindow** functions
3683 bool DebugShowGroupRects;
3684
3685 // Shared stacks
3686 ImGuiCol DebugFlashStyleColorIdx; // (Keep close to ColorStack to share cache line)
3687 ImVector<ImGuiColorMod> ColorStack; // Stack for PushStyleColor()/PopStyleColor() - inherited by Begin()
3688 ImVector<ImGuiStyleMod> StyleVarStack; // Stack for PushStyleVar()/PopStyleVar() - inherited by Begin()
3689 ImVector<ImFont *> FontStack; // Stack for PushFont()/PopFont() - inherited by Begin()
3690 ImVector<ImGuiFocusScopeData> FocusScopeStack; // Stack for PushFocusScope()/PopFocusScope() - inherited by
3691 // BeginChild(), pushed into by Begin()
3692 ImVector<ImGuiItemFlags> ItemFlagsStack; // Stack for PushItemFlag()/PopItemFlag() - inherited by Begin()
3693 ImVector<ImGuiGroupData> GroupStack; // Stack for BeginGroup()/EndGroup() - not inherited by Begin()
3694 ImVector<ImGuiPopupData> OpenPopupStack; // Which popups are open (persistent)
3695 ImVector<ImGuiPopupData> BeginPopupStack; // Which level of BeginPopup() we are in (reset every frame)
3696 ImVector<ImGuiTreeNodeStackData> TreeNodeStack; // Stack for TreeNode()
3697
3698 // Viewports
3699 ImVector<ImGuiViewportP *> Viewports; // Active viewports (always 1+, and generally 1 unless multi-viewports are
3700 // enabled). Each viewports hold their copy of ImDrawData.
3701 ImGuiViewportP *CurrentViewport; // We track changes of viewport (happening in Begin) so we can call
3702 // Platform_OnChangedViewport()
3703 ImGuiViewportP *MouseViewport;
3704 ImGuiViewportP *MouseLastHoveredViewport; // Last known viewport that was hovered by mouse (even if we are not
3705 // hovering any viewport any more) + honoring the _NoInputs flag.
3706 ImGuiID PlatformLastFocusedViewportId;
3707 ImGuiPlatformMonitor
3708 FallbackMonitor; // Virtual monitor used as fallback if backend doesn't provide monitor information.
3709 ImRect PlatformMonitorsFullWorkRect; // Bounding box of all platform monitors
3710 int ViewportCreatedCount; // Unique sequential creation counter (mostly for testing/debugging)
3711 int PlatformWindowsCreatedCount; // Unique sequential creation counter (mostly for testing/debugging)
3712 int ViewportFocusedStampCount; // Every time the front-most window changes, we stamp its viewport with an
3713 // incrementing counter
3714
3715 // Keyboard/Gamepad Navigation
3716 bool NavCursorVisible; // Nav focus cursor/rectangle is visible? We hide it after a mouse click. We show it after a
3717 // nav move.
3718 bool NavHighlightItemUnderNav; // Disable mouse hovering highlight. Highlight navigation focused item instead of
3719 // mouse hovered item.
3720 // bool NavDisableHighlight; // Old name for !g.NavCursorVisible before 1.91.4
3721 // (2024/10/18). OPPOSITE VALUE (g.NavDisableHighlight == !g.NavCursorVisible) bool NavDisableMouseHover; // Old
3722 // name for g.NavHighlightItemUnderNav before 1.91.1 (2024/10/18) this was called When user starts using
3723 // keyboard/gamepad, we hide mouse hovering highlight until mouse is touched again.
3724 bool NavMousePosDirty; // When set we will update mouse position if io.ConfigNavMoveSetMousePos is set (not enabled
3725 // by default)
3726 bool NavIdIsAlive; // Nav widget has been seen this frame ~~ NavRectRel is valid
3727 ImGuiID NavId; // Focused item for navigation
3728 ImGuiWindow *NavWindow; // Focused window for navigation. Could be called 'FocusedWindow'
3729 ImGuiID NavFocusScopeId; // Focused focus scope (e.g. selection code often wants to "clear other items" when landing
3730 // on an item of the same scope)
3731 ImGuiNavLayer NavLayer; // Focused layer (main scrolling layer, or menu/title bar layer)
3732 ImGuiID
3733 NavActivateId; // ~~ (g.ActiveId == 0) && (IsKeyPressed(ImGuiKey_Space) || IsKeyDown(ImGuiKey_Enter) ||
3734 // IsKeyPressed(ImGuiKey_NavGamepadActivate)) ? NavId : 0, also set when calling ActivateItem()
3735 ImGuiID NavActivateDownId; // ~~ IsKeyDown(ImGuiKey_Space) || IsKeyDown(ImGuiKey_Enter) ||
3736 // IsKeyDown(ImGuiKey_NavGamepadActivate) ? NavId : 0
3737 ImGuiID NavActivatePressedId; // ~~ IsKeyPressed(ImGuiKey_Space) || IsKeyPressed(ImGuiKey_Enter) ||
3738 // IsKeyPressed(ImGuiKey_NavGamepadActivate) ? NavId : 0 (no repeat)
3739 ImGuiActivateFlags NavActivateFlags;
3740 ImVector<ImGuiFocusScopeData>
3741 NavFocusRoute; // Reversed copy focus scope stack for NavId (should contains NavFocusScopeId). This essentially
3742 // follow the window->ParentWindowForFocusRoute chain.
3743 ImGuiID NavHighlightActivatedId;
3744 float NavHighlightActivatedTimer;
3745 ImGuiID NavNextActivateId; // Set by ActivateItem(), queued until next frame.
3746 ImGuiActivateFlags NavNextActivateFlags;
3747 ImGuiInputSource NavInputSource; // Keyboard or Gamepad mode? THIS CAN ONLY BE ImGuiInputSource_Keyboard or
3748 // ImGuiInputSource_Mouse
3749 ImGuiSelectionUserData
3750 NavLastValidSelectionUserData; // Last valid data passed to SetNextItemSelectionUser(), or -1. For current
3751 // window. Not reset when focusing an item that doesn't have selection data.
3752 ImS8 NavCursorHideFrames;
3753
3754 // Navigation: Init & Move Requests
3755 bool NavAnyRequest; // ~~ NavMoveRequest || NavInitRequest this is to perform early out in ItemAdd()
3756 bool NavInitRequest; // Init request for appearing window to select first item
3757 bool NavInitRequestFromMove;
3758 ImGuiNavItemData NavInitResult; // Init request result (first item of the window, or one for which
3759 // SetItemDefaultFocus() was called)
3760 bool NavMoveSubmitted; // Move request submitted, will process result on next NewFrame()
3761 bool NavMoveScoringItems; // Move request submitted, still scoring incoming items
3762 bool NavMoveForwardToNextFrame;
3763 ImGuiNavMoveFlags NavMoveFlags;
3764 ImGuiScrollFlags NavMoveScrollFlags;
3765 ImGuiKeyChord NavMoveKeyMods;
3766 ImGuiDir NavMoveDir; // Direction of the move request (left/right/up/down)
3767 ImGuiDir NavMoveDirForDebug;
3768 ImGuiDir NavMoveClipDir; // FIXME-NAV: Describe the purpose of this better. Might want to rename?
3769 ImRect NavScoringRect; // Rectangle used for scoring, in screen space. Based of window->NavRectRel[], modified for
3770 // directional navigation scoring.
3771 ImRect NavScoringNoClipRect; // Some nav operations (such as PageUp/PageDown) enforce a region which clipper will
3772 // attempt to always keep submitted
3773 int NavScoringDebugCount; // Metrics for debugging
3774 int NavTabbingDir; // Generally -1 or +1, 0 when tabbing without a nav id
3775 int NavTabbingCounter; // >0 when counting items for tabbing
3776 ImGuiNavItemData NavMoveResultLocal; // Best move request candidate within NavWindow

3778 // (when using ImGuiNavMoveFlags_AlsoScoreVisibleSet flag)
3779 ImGuiNavItemData NavMoveResultOther; // Best move request candidate within NavWindow's flattened hierarchy (when
3780 // using ImGuiWindowFlags_NavFlattened flag)
3781 ImGuiNavItemData NavTabbingResultFirst; // First tabbing request candidate within NavWindow and flattened hierarchy
3782

3784 ImGuiID
3785 NavJustMovedFromFocusScopeId; // Just navigated from this focus scope id (result of a successfully MoveRequest).
3786 ImGuiID NavJustMovedToId; // Just navigated to this id (result of a successfully MoveRequest).
3787 ImGuiID NavJustMovedToFocusScopeId; // Just navigated to this focus scope id (result of a successfully MoveRequest).
3788 ImGuiKeyChord NavJustMovedToKeyMods;

3791 // Maybe we should just store ImGuiNavItemData.
3792
3793 // Navigation: Windowing (CTRL+TAB for list, or Menu button + keys or directional pads to move/resize)

3795 // ImGuiKey_NavGamepadMenu). When false, the button may still be used to toggle
3796 // Menu layer.

3798 // X). For reconfiguration (see #4828)

3800 // ImGuiMod_Shift | ImGuiKey_Tab on OS X)
3801 ImGuiWindow *NavWindowingTarget; // Target window when doing CTRL+Tab (or Pad Menu + FocusPrev/Next), this window is
3802 // temporarily displayed top-most!
3803 ImGuiWindow *NavWindowingTargetAnim; // Record of last valid NavWindowingTarget until DimBgRatio and
3804 // NavWindowingHighlightAlpha becomes 0.0f, so the fade-out can stay on it.

3818 bool DragDropActive;

3820 bool DragDropWithinTarget; // Set when within a BeginDragDropXXX/EndDragDropXXX block for a drag target.

3830 // smaller surface)
3831 ImGuiID DragDropAcceptIdCurr; // Target item id (set at the time of accepting the payload)
3832 ImGuiID DragDropAcceptIdPrev; // Target item id from previous frame (we need to store this to allow for overlapping
3833 // drag and drop targets)
3834 int DragDropAcceptFrameCount; // Last time a target expressed a desire to accept the source
3835 ImGuiID DragDropHoldJustPressedId; // Set when holding a payload just made ButtonBehavior() return a press.
3836 ImVector<unsigned char>
3837 DragDropPayloadBufHeap; // We don't expose the ImVector<> directly, ImGuiPayload only holds pointer+size
3838 unsigned char DragDropPayloadBufLocal[16]; // Local buffer for small payloads

3848 // generally don't use TablesTempData.Size)

3876 // the item.

3893 ImGuiColorEditFlags ColorEditOptions; // Store user options for color edit widgets
3894 ImGuiID ColorEditCurrentID; // Set temporarily while inside of the parent-most ColorEdit4/ColorPicker4 (because they
3895 // call each others).
3896 ImGuiID ColorEditSavedID; // ID we are saving/restoring HS for
