3898 // round trips
3899 float ColorEditSavedSat; // Backup of last Saturation associated to LastColor, so we can restore Saturation in lossy
3900 // RGB<>HSV round trips
3901 ImU32 ColorEditSavedColor; // RGB value with alpha set to 0.
3902 ImVec4 ColorPickerRef; // Initial/reference color at the time of opening the color picker.
3903 ImGuiComboPreviewData ComboPreviewData;
3904 ImRect WindowResizeBorderExpectedRect; // Expected border rect, switch to relative edit if moving
3905 bool WindowResizeRelativeMode;
3906 short ScrollbarSeekMode; // 0: scroll to clicked location, -1/+1: prev/next page.
3907 float ScrollbarClickDeltaToGrabCenter; // When scrolling to mouse location: distance between mouse and center of
3908 // grab box, normalized in parent space.
3909 float SliderGrabClickOffset;
3910 float SliderCurrentAccum; // Accumulated slider delta when using navigation controls.
3911 bool SliderCurrentAccumDirty; // Has the accumulated slider delta changed since last time we tried to apply it?
3912 bool DragCurrentAccumDirty;
3913 float DragCurrentAccum; // Accumulator for dragging modification. Always high-precision, not rounded by end-user
3914 // precision settings
3915 float DragSpeedDefaultRatio; // If speed == 0.0f, uses (max-min) * DragSpeedDefaultRatio
3916 float DisabledAlphaBackup; // Backup for style.Alpha for BeginDisabled()
3917 short DisabledStackSize;
3918 short TooltipOverrideCount;
3919 ImGuiWindow *TooltipPreviousWindow; // Window of last tooltip submitted during the frame
3920 ImVector<char> ClipboardHandlerData; // If no custom clipboard handler is defined
3921 ImVector<ImGuiID> MenusIdSubmittedThisFrame; // A list of menu IDs that were rendered at least once
3922 ImGuiTypingSelectState TypingSelectState; // State for GetTypingSelectRequest()
3923
3924 // Platform support
3925 ImGuiPlatformImeData PlatformImeData; // Data updated by current frame
3926 ImGuiPlatformImeData PlatformImeDataPrev; // Previous frame data. When changed we call the
3927 // platform_io.Platform_SetImeDataFn() handler.
3928 ImGuiID PlatformImeViewport;
3929
3930 // Extensions
3931 // FIXME: We could provide an API to register one slot in an array held in ImGuiContext?
3932 ImGuiDockContext DockContext;
3933 void (*DockNodeWindowMenuHandler)(ImGuiContext *ctx, ImGuiDockNode *node, ImGuiTabBar *tab_bar);
3934
3935 // Settings
3936 bool SettingsLoaded;
3937 float SettingsDirtyTimer; // Save .ini Settings to memory when time reaches zero
3938 ImGuiTextBuffer SettingsIniData; // In memory .ini settings
3939 ImVector<ImGuiSettingsHandler> SettingsHandlers; // List of .ini settings handlers
3940 ImChunkStream<ImGuiWindowSettings> SettingsWindows; // ImGuiWindow .ini settings entries
3941 ImChunkStream<ImGuiTableSettings> SettingsTables; // ImGuiTable .ini settings entries
3942 ImVector<ImGuiContextHook> Hooks; // Hooks for extensions (e.g. test engine)
3943 ImGuiID HookIdNext; // Next available HookId
3944
3945 // Localization
3946 const char *LocalizationTable[ImGuiLocKey_COUNT];
3947
3948 // Capture/Logging
3949 bool LogEnabled; // Currently capturing
3950 ImGuiLogFlags LogFlags; // Capture flags/type
3951 ImGuiWindow *LogWindow;
3952 ImFileHandle LogFile; // If != NULL log to stdout/ file
3953 ImGuiTextBuffer LogBuffer; // Accumulation buffer when log to clipboard. This is pointer so our GImGui static
3954 // constructor doesn't call heap allocators.
3955 const char *LogNextPrefix;
3956 const char *LogNextSuffix;
3957 float LogLinePosY;
3958 bool LogLineFirstItem;
3959 int LogDepthRef;
3960 int LogDepthToExpand;
3961 int LogDepthToExpandDefault; // Default/stored value for LogDepthMaxExpand if not specified in the LogXXX function
3962 // call.
3963
3964 // Error Handling
3965 ImGuiErrorCallback ErrorCallback; // = NULL. May be exposed in public API eventually.
3966 void *ErrorCallbackUserData; // = NULL
3967 ImVec2 ErrorTooltipLockedPos;
3968 bool ErrorFirst;
3969 int ErrorCountCurrentFrame; // [Internal] Number of errors submitted this frame.
3970 ImGuiErrorRecoveryState StackSizesInNewFrame; // [Internal]
3971 ImGuiErrorRecoveryState *StackSizesInBeginForCurrentWindow; // [Internal]
3972
3973 // Debug Tools
3974 // (some of the highly frequently used data are interleaved in other structures above: DebugBreakXXX fields,
3975 // DebugHookIdInfo, DebugLocateId etc.)
3976 int DebugDrawIdConflictsCount; // Locked count (preserved when holding CTRL)
3977 ImGuiDebugLogFlags DebugLogFlags;
3978 ImGuiTextBuffer DebugLogBuf;
3979 ImGuiTextIndex DebugLogIndex;
3980 int DebugLogSkippedErrors;
3981 ImGuiDebugLogFlags DebugLogAutoDisableFlags;
3982 ImU8 DebugLogAutoDisableFrames;
3983 ImU8 DebugLocateFrames; // For DebugLocateItemOnHover(). This is used together with DebugLocateId which is in a
3984 // hot/cached spot above.
3985 bool DebugBreakInLocateId; // Debug break in ItemAdd() call for g.DebugLocateId.
3986 ImGuiKeyChord DebugBreakKeyChord; // = ImGuiKey_Pause
3987 ImS8 DebugBeginReturnValueCullDepth; // Cycle between 0..9 then wrap around.
3988 bool DebugItemPickerActive; // Item picker is active (started with DebugStartItemPicker())
3989 ImU8 DebugItemPickerMouseButton;
3990 ImGuiID DebugItemPickerBreakId; // Will call IM_DEBUG_BREAK() when encountering this ID
3991 float DebugFlashStyleColorTime;
3992 ImVec4 DebugFlashStyleColorBackup;
3993 ImGuiMetricsConfig DebugMetricsConfig;
3994 ImGuiIDStackTool DebugIDStackTool;
3995 ImGuiDebugAllocInfo DebugAllocInfo;
3996 ImGuiDockNode *DebugHoveredDockNode; // Hovered dock node.
3997
3998 // Misc
3999 float FramerateSecPerFrame[60]; // Calculate estimate of framerate for user over the last 60 frames..
4000 int FramerateSecPerFrameIdx;
4001 int FramerateSecPerFrameCount;
4002 float FramerateSecPerFrameAccum;
4003 int WantCaptureMouseNextFrame; // Explicit capture override via
4004 // SetNextFrameWantCaptureMouse()/SetNextFrameWantCaptureKeyboard(). Default to -1.
4005 int WantCaptureKeyboardNextFrame; // "
4006 int WantTextInputNextFrame;
4007 ImVector<char> TempBuffer; // Temporary text buffer
4008 char TempKeychordName[64];
4009
4010 ImGuiContext(ImFontAtlas *shared_font_atlas);
4011};
4012
4013//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
4014// [SECTION] ImGuiWindowTempData, ImGuiWindow
4015//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
4016
4017// Transient per-window data, reset at the beginning of the frame. This used to be called ImGuiDrawContext, hence the DC
4018// variable name in ImGuiWindow. (That's theory, in practice the delimitation between ImGuiWindow and
4019// ImGuiWindowTempData is quite tenuous and could be reconsidered..) (This doesn't need a constructor because we
4020// zero-clear it as part of ImGuiWindow and all frame-temporary data are setup on Begin)
4021struct IMGUI_API ImGuiWindowTempData
4022{
4023 // Layout
4024 ImVec2 CursorPos; // Current emitting position, in absolute coordinates.
4025 ImVec2 CursorPosPrevLine;
4026 ImVec2 CursorStartPos; // Initial position after Begin(), generally ~ window position + WindowPadding.
4027 ImVec2 CursorMaxPos; // Used to implicitly calculate ContentSize at the beginning of next frame, for scrolling range
4028 // and auto-resize. Always growing during the frame.
4029 ImVec2 IdealMaxPos; // Used to implicitly calculate ContentSizeIdeal at the beginning of next frame, for auto-resize
4030 // only. Always growing during the frame.
4031 ImVec2 CurrLineSize;
4032 ImVec2 PrevLineSize;
4033 float CurrLineTextBaseOffset; // Baseline offset (0.0f by default on a new line, generally == style.FramePadding.y
4034 // when a framed item has been added).
4035 float PrevLineTextBaseOffset;
4036 bool IsSameLine;
4037 bool IsSetPos;
4038 ImVec1 Indent; // Indentation / start position from left of window (increased by TreePush/TreePop, etc.)
4039 ImVec1 ColumnsOffset; // Offset to the current column (if ColumnsCurrent > 0). FIXME: This and the above should be a
4040 // stack to allow use cases like Tree->Column->Tree. Need revamp columns API.
4041 ImVec1 GroupOffset;
4042 ImVec2 CursorStartPosLossyness; // Record the loss of precision of CursorStartPos due to really large scrolling
4043 // amount. This is used by clipper to compensate and fix the most common use case of
4044 // large scroll area.
4045
4046 // Keyboard/Gamepad navigation
4047 ImGuiNavLayer NavLayerCurrent; // Current layer, 0..31 (we currently only use 0..1)
4048 short NavLayersActiveMask; // Which layers have been written to (result from previous frame)
4049 short NavLayersActiveMaskNext; // Which layers have been written to (accumulator for current frame)
4050 bool NavIsScrollPushableX; // Set when current work location may be scrolled horizontally when moving left / right.
4051 // This is generally always true UNLESS within a column.
4052 bool NavHideHighlightOneFrame;
4053 bool NavWindowHasScrollY; // Set per window when scrolling can be used (== ScrollMax.y > 0.0f)
4054
4055 // Miscellaneous
4056 bool MenuBarAppending; // FIXME: Remove this
4057 ImVec2 MenuBarOffset; // MenuBarOffset.x is sort of equivalent of a per-layer CursorPos.x, saved/restored as we
4058 // switch to the menu bar. The only situation when MenuBarOffset.y is > 0 if when
4059 // (SafeAreaPadding.y > FramePadding.y), often used on TVs.
4060 ImGuiMenuColumns MenuColumns; // Simplified columns storage for menu items measurement
4061 int TreeDepth; // Current tree depth.
4062 ImU32 TreeHasStackDataDepthMask; // Store whether given depth has ImGuiTreeNodeStackData data. Could be turned into
4063 // a ImU64 if necessary.
4064 ImVector<ImGuiWindow *> ChildWindows;
4065 ImGuiStorage *StateStorage; // Current persistent per-window storage (store e.g. tree node open/close state)
4066 ImGuiOldColumns *CurrentColumns; // Current columns set
4067 int CurrentTableIdx; // Current table index (into g.Tables)
4068 ImGuiLayoutType LayoutType;
4069 ImGuiLayoutType ParentLayoutType; // Layout type of parent window at the time of Begin()
4070 ImU32 ModalDimBgColor;
4071
4072 // Status flags
4073 ImGuiItemStatusFlags WindowItemStatusFlags;
4074 ImGuiItemStatusFlags ChildItemStatusFlags;
4075 ImGuiItemStatusFlags DockTabItemStatusFlags;
4076 ImRect DockTabItemRect;
4077
4078 // Local parameters stacks
4079 // We store the current settings outside of the vectors to increase memory locality (reduce cache misses). The
4080 // vectors are rarely modified. Also it allows us to not heap allocate for short-lived windows which are not using
4081 // those settings.
4082 float ItemWidth; // Current item width (>0.0: width in pixels, <0.0: align xx pixels to the right of window).
4083 float TextWrapPos; // Current text wrap pos.
4084 ImVector<float> ItemWidthStack; // Store item widths to restore (attention: .back() is not == ItemWidth)
4085 ImVector<float> TextWrapPosStack; // Store text wrap pos to restore (attention: .back() is not == TextWrapPos)
4086};
4087
4088// Storage for one window
4089struct IMGUI_API ImGuiWindow
4090{
4091 ImGuiContext *Ctx; // Parent UI context (needs to be set explicitly by parent).
4092 char *Name; // Window name, owned by the window.
4093 ImGuiID ID; // == ImHashStr(Name)
4094 ImGuiWindowFlags Flags, FlagsPreviousFrame; // See enum ImGuiWindowFlags_
4095 ImGuiChildFlags ChildFlags; // Set when window is a child window. See enum ImGuiChildFlags_
4096 ImGuiWindowClass WindowClass; // Advanced users only. Set with SetNextWindowClass()
4097 ImGuiViewportP *
4098 Viewport; // Always set in Begin(). Inactive windows may have a NULL value here if their viewport was discarded.
4099 ImGuiID ViewportId; // We backup the viewport id (since the viewport may disappear or never be created if the window
4100 // is inactive)
4101 ImVec2 ViewportPos; // We backup the viewport position (since the viewport may disappear or never be created if the
4102 // window is inactive)
4103 int ViewportAllowPlatformMonitorExtend; // Reset to -1 every frame (index is guaranteed to be valid between
4104 // NewFrame..EndFrame), only used in the Appearing frame of a tooltip/popup
4105 // to enforce clamping to a given monitor
4106 ImVec2 Pos; // Position (always rounded-up to nearest pixel)
4107 ImVec2 Size; // Current size (==SizeFull or collapsed title bar size)
4108 ImVec2 SizeFull; // Size when non collapsed
4109 ImVec2 ContentSize; // Size of contents/scrollable client area (calculated from the extents reach of the cursor)
4110 // from previous frame. Does not include window decoration or window padding.
4111 ImVec2 ContentSizeIdeal;
4112 ImVec2 ContentSizeExplicit; // Size of contents/scrollable client area explicitly request by the user via
4113 // SetNextWindowContentSize().
4114 ImVec2 WindowPadding; // Window padding at the time of Begin().
4115 float WindowRounding; // Window rounding at the time of Begin(). May be clamped lower to avoid rendering artifacts
4116 // with title bar, menu bar etc.
4117 float WindowBorderSize; // Window border size at the time of Begin().
4118 float TitleBarHeight, MenuBarHeight; // Note that those used to be function before 2024/05/28. If you have old code
4119 // calling TitleBarHeight() you can change it to TitleBarHeight.
4120 float DecoOuterSizeX1,
4121 DecoOuterSizeY1; // Left/Up offsets. Sum of non-scrolling outer decorations (X1 generally == 0.0f. Y1 generally
4122 // = TitleBarHeight + MenuBarHeight). Locked during Begin().
4123 float DecoOuterSizeX2,
4124 DecoOuterSizeY2; // Right/Down offsets (X2 generally == ScrollbarSize.x, Y2 == ScrollbarSizes.y).
4125 float DecoInnerSizeX1, DecoInnerSizeY1; // Applied AFTER/OVER InnerRect. Specialized for Tables as they use
4126 // specialized form of clipping and frozen rows/columns are inside InnerRect
4127 // (and not part of regular decoration sizes).
4128 int NameBufLen; // Size of buffer storing Name. May be larger than strlen(Name)!
4129 ImGuiID MoveId; // == window->GetID("#MOVE")
4130 ImGuiID TabId; // == window->GetID("#TAB")
4131 ImGuiID ChildId; // ID of corresponding item in parent window (for navigation to return from child window to parent
4132 // window)
4133 ImGuiID PopupId; // ID in the popup stack when this window is used as a popup/menu (because we use generic Name/ID
4134 // for recycling)
4135 ImVec2 Scroll;
4136 ImVec2 ScrollMax;
4137 ImVec2 ScrollTarget; // target scroll position. stored as cursor position with scrolling canceled out, so the
4138 // highest point is always 0.0f. (FLT_MAX for no change)
4139 ImVec2 ScrollTargetCenterRatio; // 0.0f = scroll so that target position is at top, 0.5f = scroll so that target
4140 // position is centered
4141 ImVec2 ScrollTargetEdgeSnapDist; // 0.0f = no snapping, >0.0f snapping threshold
4142 ImVec2 ScrollbarSizes; // Size taken by each scrollbars on their smaller axis. Pay attention! ScrollbarSizes.x ==
4143 // width of the vertical scrollbar, ScrollbarSizes.y = height of the horizontal scrollbar.
4144 bool ScrollbarX, ScrollbarY; // Are scrollbars visible?
4145 bool ScrollbarXStabilizeEnabled; // Was ScrollbarX previously auto-stabilized?
4146 ImU8 ScrollbarXStabilizeToggledHistory; // Used to stabilize scrollbar visibility in case of feedback loops
4147 bool ViewportOwned;
4148 bool Active; // Set to true on Begin(), unless Collapsed
4149 bool WasActive;
4150 bool WriteAccessed; // Set to true when any widget access the current window
4151 bool Collapsed; // Set when collapsing window to become only title-bar
4152 bool WantCollapseToggle;
4153 bool SkipItems; // Set when items can safely be all clipped (e.g. window not visible or collapsed)
4154 bool SkipRefresh; // [EXPERIMENTAL] Reuse previous frame drawn contents, Begin() returns false.
4155 bool Appearing; // Set during the frame where the window is appearing (or re-appearing)
4156 bool Hidden; // Do not display (== HiddenFrames*** > 0)
4157 bool IsFallbackWindow; // Set on the "Debug##Default" window.
4158 bool IsExplicitChild; // Set when passed _ChildWindow, left to false by BeginDocked()
4159 bool HasCloseButton; // Set when the window has a close button (p_open != NULL)
4160 signed char ResizeBorderHovered; // Current border being hovered for resize (-1: none, otherwise 0-3)
4161 signed char ResizeBorderHeld; // Current border being held for resize (-1: none, otherwise 0-3)
4162 short BeginCount; // Number of Begin() during the current frame (generally 0 or 1, 1+ if appending via multiple
4163 // Begin/End pairs)
4164 short BeginCountPreviousFrame; // Number of Begin() during the previous frame
4165 short
4166 BeginOrderWithinParent; // Begin() order within immediate parent window, if we are a child window. Otherwise 0.
4167 short BeginOrderWithinContext; // Begin() order within entire imgui context. This is mostly used for debugging
4168 // submission order related issues.
4169 short FocusOrder; // Order within WindowsFocusOrder[], altered when windows are focused.
4170 ImS8 AutoFitFramesX, AutoFitFramesY;
4171 bool AutoFitOnlyGrows;
4172 ImGuiDir AutoPosLastDirection;
4173 ImS8 HiddenFramesCanSkipItems; // Hide the window for N frames
4174 ImS8 HiddenFramesCannotSkipItems; // Hide the window for N frames while allowing items to be submitted so we can
4175 // measure their size
4176 ImS8 HiddenFramesForRenderOnly; // Hide the window until frame N at Render() time only
4177 ImS8 DisableInputsFrames; // Disable window interactions for N frames
4178 ImGuiCond SetWindowPosAllowFlags : 8; // store acceptable condition flags for SetNextWindowPos() use.
4179 ImGuiCond SetWindowSizeAllowFlags : 8; // store acceptable condition flags for SetNextWindowSize() use.
4180 ImGuiCond SetWindowCollapsedAllowFlags : 8; // store acceptable condition flags for SetNextWindowCollapsed() use.
4181 ImGuiCond SetWindowDockAllowFlags : 8; // store acceptable condition flags for SetNextWindowDock() use.
4182 ImVec2 SetWindowPosVal; // store window position when using a non-zero Pivot (position set needs to be processed
4183 // when we know the window size)
4184 ImVec2 SetWindowPosPivot; // store window pivot for positioning. ImVec2(0, 0) when positioning from top-left corner;
4185 // ImVec2(0.5f, 0.5f) for centering; ImVec2(1, 1) for bottom right.
4186
4187 ImVector<ImGuiID> IDStack; // ID stack. ID are hashes seeded with the value at the top of the stack. (In theory this
4188 // should be in the TempData structure)
4189 ImGuiWindowTempData DC; // Temporary per-window data, reset at the beginning of the frame. This used to be called
4190 // ImGuiDrawContext, hence the "DC" variable name.
4191
4192 // The best way to understand what those rectangles are is to use the 'Metrics->Tools->Show Windows Rectangles'
4193 // viewer. The main 'OuterRect', omitted as a field, is window->Rect().
4194 ImRect OuterRectClipped; // == Window->Rect() just after setup in Begin(). == window->Rect() for root window.
4195 ImRect InnerRect; // Inner rectangle (omit title bar, menu bar, scroll bar)
4196 ImRect InnerClipRect; // == InnerRect shrunk by WindowPadding*0.5f on each side, clipped within viewport or parent
4197 // clip rect.
4198 ImRect WorkRect; // Initially covers the whole scrolling region. Reduced by containers e.g columns/tables when
4199 // active. Shrunk by WindowPadding*1.0f on each side. This is meant to replace ContentRegionRect
4200 // over time (from 1.71+ onward).
4201 ImRect ParentWorkRect; // Backup of WorkRect before entering a container such as columns/tables. Used by e.g.
4202 // SpanAllColumns functions to easily access. Stacked containers are responsible for
4203 // maintaining this. // FIXME-WORKRECT: Could be a stack?
4204 ImRect ClipRect; // Current clipping/scissoring rectangle, evolve as we are using PushClipRect(), etc. ==
4205 // DrawList->clip_rect_stack.back().
4206 ImRect ContentRegionRect; // FIXME: This is currently confusing/misleading. It is essentially WorkRect but not
4207 // handling of scrolling. We currently rely on it as right/bottom aligned sizing operation
4208 // need some size to rely on.
4209 ImVec2ih HitTestHoleSize; // Define an optional rectangular hole where mouse will pass-through the window.
4210 ImVec2ih HitTestHoleOffset;
4211
4212 int LastFrameActive; // Last frame number the window was Active.
4213 int LastFrameJustFocused; // Last frame number the window was made Focused.
4214 float LastTimeActive; // Last timestamp the window was Active (using float as we don't need high precision there)
4215 float ItemWidthDefault;
4216 ImGuiStorage StateStorage;
4217 ImVector<ImGuiOldColumns> ColumnsStorage;
4218 float FontWindowScale; // User scale multiplier per-window, via SetWindowFontScale()
4219 float FontWindowScaleParents;
4220 float FontDpiScale;
4221 float FontRefSize; // This is a copy of window->CalcFontSize() at the time of Begin(), trying to phase out
4222 // CalcFontSize() especially as it may be called on non-current window.
4223 int SettingsOffset; // Offset into SettingsWindows[] (offsets are always valid as we only grow the array from the
4224 // back)
4225
4226 ImDrawList *DrawList; // == &DrawListInst (for backward compatibility reason with code using imgui_internal.h we
4227 // keep this a pointer)
4228 ImDrawList DrawListInst;
4229 ImGuiWindow *ParentWindow; // If we are a child _or_ popup _or_ docked window, this is pointing to our parent.
4230 // Otherwise NULL.
4231 ImGuiWindow *ParentWindowInBeginStack;
4232 ImGuiWindow *RootWindow; // Point to ourself or first ancestor that is not a child window. Doesn't cross through
4233 // popups/dock nodes.
4234 ImGuiWindow *RootWindowPopupTree; // Point to ourself or first ancestor that is not a child window. Cross through
4235 // popups parent<>child.
4236 ImGuiWindow
4237 *RootWindowDockTree; // Point to ourself or first ancestor that is not a child window. Cross through dock nodes.
4238 ImGuiWindow *RootWindowForTitleBarHighlight; // Point to ourself or first ancestor which will display TitleBgActive
4239 // color when this window is active.
4240 ImGuiWindow *RootWindowForNav; // Point to ourself or first ancestor which doesn't have the NavFlattened flag.
4241 ImGuiWindow *ParentWindowForFocusRoute; // Set to manual link a window to its logical parent so that Shortcut()
4242 // chain are honoerd (e.g. Tool linked to Document)
4243
4244 ImGuiWindow *NavLastChildNavWindow; // When going to the menu bar, we remember the child window we came from. (This
4245 // could probably be made implicit if we kept g.Windows sorted by last focused
4246 // including child window.)
4247 ImGuiID NavLastIds[ImGuiNavLayer_COUNT]; // Last known NavId for this window, per layer (0/1)
4248 ImRect NavRectRel[ImGuiNavLayer_COUNT]; // Reference rectangle, in window relative space
4249 ImVec2 NavPreferredScoringPosRel[ImGuiNavLayer_COUNT]; // Preferred X/Y position updated when moving on a given
4250 // axis, reset to FLT_MAX.
4251 ImGuiID NavRootFocusScopeId; // Focus Scope ID at the time of Begin()
4252
4253 int MemoryDrawListIdxCapacity; // Backup of last idx/vtx count, so when waking up the window we can preallocate and
4254 // avoid iterative alloc/copy
4255 int MemoryDrawListVtxCapacity;
4256 bool MemoryCompacted; // Set when window extraneous data have been garbage collected
4257
4258 // Docking
4259 bool DockIsActive : 1; // When docking artifacts are actually visible. When this is set, DockNode is guaranteed to
4260 // be != NULL. ~~ (DockNode != NULL) && (DockNode->Windows.Size > 1).
4261 bool DockNodeIsVisible : 1;
4262 bool DockTabIsVisible : 1; // Is our window visible this frame? ~~ is the corresponding tab selected?
4263 bool DockTabWantClose : 1;
4264 short DockOrder; // Order of the last time the window was visible within its DockNode. This is used to reorder
4265 // windows that are reappearing on the same frame. Same value between windows that were active and
4266 // windows that were none are possible.
4267 ImGuiWindowDockStyle DockStyle;
4268 ImGuiDockNode *DockNode; // Which node are we docked into. Important: Prefer testing DockIsActive in many cases as
4269 // this will still be set when the dock node is hidden.
4270 ImGuiDockNode *DockNodeAsHost; // Which node are we owning (for parent windows)
4271 ImGuiID DockId; // Backup of last valid DockNode->ID, so single window remember their dock node id even when they
4272 // are not bound any more
4273
4274 public:
4275 ImGuiWindow(ImGuiContext *context, const char *name);
4276 ~ImGuiWindow();
4277
4278 ImGuiID GetID(const char *str, const char *str_end = NULL);
4279 ImGuiID GetID(const void *ptr);
4280 ImGuiID GetID(int n);
4281 ImGuiID GetIDFromPos(const ImVec2 &p_abs);
4282 ImGuiID GetIDFromRectangle(const ImRect &r_abs);
4283
4284 // We don't use g.FontSize because the window may be != g.CurrentWindow.
4285 ImRect Rect() const
4286 {
4287 return ImRect(Pos.x, Pos.y, Pos.x + Size.x, Pos.y + Size.y);
4288 }
4289 float CalcFontSize() const
4290 {
4291 ImGuiContext &g = *Ctx;
4292 return g.FontBaseSize * FontWindowScale * FontDpiScale * FontWindowScaleParents;
4293 }
4294 ImRect TitleBarRect() const
4295 {
4296 return ImRect(Pos, ImVec2(Pos.x + SizeFull.x, Pos.y + TitleBarHeight));
4297 }
4298 ImRect MenuBarRect() const
4299 {
4300 float y1 = Pos.y + TitleBarHeight;
4301 return ImRect(Pos.x, y1, Pos.x + SizeFull.x, y1 + MenuBarHeight);
4302 }
4303};
4304
4305//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
4306// [SECTION] Tab bar, Tab item support
4307//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
4308
4309// Extend ImGuiTabBarFlags_
4310enum ImGuiTabBarFlagsPrivate_
4311{
4312 ImGuiTabBarFlags_DockNode = 1 << 20, // Part of a dock node [we don't use this in the master branch but it
4313 // facilitate branch syncing to keep this around]
4314 ImGuiTabBarFlags_IsFocused = 1 << 21,
4315 ImGuiTabBarFlags_SaveSettings = 1 << 22, // FIXME: Settings are handled by the docking system, this only request the
4316 // tab bar to mark settings dirty when reordering tabs
4317};
4318
4319// Extend ImGuiTabItemFlags_
4320enum ImGuiTabItemFlagsPrivate_
4321{
4322 ImGuiTabItemFlags_SectionMask_ = ImGuiTabItemFlags_Leading | ImGuiTabItemFlags_Trailing,
4323 ImGuiTabItemFlags_NoCloseButton = 1 << 20, // Track whether p_open was set or not (we'll need this info on the next
4324 // frame to recompute ContentWidth during layout)
4325 ImGuiTabItemFlags_Button = 1 << 21, // Used by TabItemButton, change the tab item behavior to mimic a button
4326 ImGuiTabItemFlags_Invisible = 1 << 22, // To reserve space e.g. with ImGuiTabItemFlags_Leading
4327 ImGuiTabItemFlags_Unsorted =
4328 1
4329 << 23, // [Docking] Trailing tabs with the _Unsorted flag will be sorted based on the DockOrder of their Window.
4330};
4331
4332// Storage for one active tab item (sizeof() 48 bytes)
4333struct ImGuiTabItem
4334{
4335 ImGuiID ID;
4336 ImGuiTabItemFlags Flags;
4337 ImGuiWindow *Window; // When TabItem is part of a DockNode's TabBar, we hold on to a window.
4338 int LastFrameVisible;
4339 int LastFrameSelected; // This allows us to infer an ordered list of the last activated tabs with little maintenance
4340 float Offset; // Position relative to beginning of tab
4341 float Width; // Width currently displayed
4342 float ContentWidth; // Width of label, stored during BeginTabItem() call
4343 float RequestedWidth; // Width optionally requested by caller, -1.0f is unused
4344 ImS32 NameOffset; // When Window==NULL, offset to name within parent ImGuiTabBar::TabsNames
4345 ImS16 BeginOrder; // BeginTabItem() order, used to re-order tabs after toggling ImGuiTabBarFlags_Reorderable
4346 ImS16 IndexDuringLayout; // Index only used during TabBarLayout(). Tabs gets reordered so 'Tabs[n].IndexDuringLayout
4347 // == n' but may mismatch during additions.
4348 bool WantClose; // Marked as closed by SetTabItemClosed()
4349
4350 ImGuiTabItem()
4351 {
4352 memset(this, 0, sizeof(*this));
4353 LastFrameVisible = LastFrameSelected = -1;
4354 RequestedWidth = -1.0f;
4355 NameOffset = -1;
4356 BeginOrder = IndexDuringLayout = -1;
4357 }
4358};
4359
4360// Storage for a tab bar (sizeof() 160 bytes)
4361struct IMGUI_API ImGuiTabBar
4362{
4363 ImGuiWindow *Window;
4364 ImVector<ImGuiTabItem> Tabs;
4365 ImGuiTabBarFlags Flags;
4366 ImGuiID ID; // Zero for tab-bars used by docking
4367 ImGuiID SelectedTabId; // Selected tab/window
4368 ImGuiID NextSelectedTabId; // Next selected tab/window. Will also trigger a scrolling animation
4369 ImGuiID VisibleTabId; // Can occasionally be != SelectedTabId (e.g. when previewing contents for CTRL+TAB preview)
4370 int CurrFrameVisible;
4371 int PrevFrameVisible;
4372 ImRect BarRect;
4373 float CurrTabsContentsHeight;
4374 float PrevTabsContentsHeight; // Record the height of contents submitted below the tab bar
4375 float WidthAllTabs; // Actual width of all tabs (locked during layout)
4376 float WidthAllTabsIdeal; // Ideal width if all tabs were visible and not clipped
4377 float ScrollingAnim;
4378 float ScrollingTarget;
4379 float ScrollingTargetDistToVisibility;
4380 float ScrollingSpeed;
4381 float ScrollingRectMinX;
4382 float ScrollingRectMaxX;
4383 float SeparatorMinX;
4384 float SeparatorMaxX;
4385 ImGuiID ReorderRequestTabId;
4386 ImS16 ReorderRequestOffset;
4387 ImS8 BeginCount;
4388 bool WantLayout;
4389 bool VisibleTabWasSubmitted;
4390 bool TabsAddedNew; // Set to true when a new tab item or button has been added to the tab bar during last frame
4391 ImS16 TabsActiveCount; // Number of tabs submitted this frame.
4392 ImS16 LastTabItemIdx; // Index of last BeginTabItem() tab for use by EndTabItem()
4393 float ItemSpacingY;
4394 ImVec2 FramePadding; // style.FramePadding locked at the time of BeginTabBar()
4395 ImVec2 BackupCursorPos;
4396 ImGuiTextBuffer TabsNames; // For non-docking tab bar we re-append names in a contiguous buffer.
4397
4398 ImGuiTabBar();
4399};
4400
4401//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
4402// [SECTION] Table support
4403//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
4404
4405#define IM_COL32_DISABLE IM_COL32(0, 0, 0, 1) // Special sentinel code which cannot be used as a regular color.
4406#define IMGUI_TABLE_MAX_COLUMNS 512 // May be further lifted
4407
4408// Our current column maximum is 64 but we may raise that in the future.
4409typedef ImS16 ImGuiTableColumnIdx;
4410typedef ImU16 ImGuiTableDrawChannelIdx;
4411
4412// [Internal] sizeof() ~ 112
4413// We use the terminology "Enabled" to refer to a column that is not Hidden by user/api.
4414// We use the terminology "Clipped" to refer to a column that is out of sight because of scrolling/clipping.
4415// This is in contrast with some user-facing api such as IsItemVisible() / IsRectVisible() which use "Visible" to mean
4416// "not clipped".
4417struct ImGuiTableColumn
4418{
4419 ImGuiTableColumnFlags
4420 Flags; // Flags after some patching (not directly same as provided by user). See ImGuiTableColumnFlags_
4421 float
4422 WidthGiven; // Final/actual width visible == (MaxX - MinX), locked in TableUpdateLayout(). May be > WidthRequest
4423 // to honor minimum width, may be < WidthRequest to honor shrinking columns down in tight space.
4424 float MinX; // Absolute positions
4425 float MaxX;
4426 float WidthRequest; // Master width absolute value when !(Flags & _WidthStretch). When Stretch this is derived every
4427 // frame from StretchWeight in TableUpdateLayout()
4428 float WidthAuto; // Automatic width
4429 float WidthMax; // Maximum width (FIXME: overwritten by each instance)
4430 float StretchWeight; // Master width weight when (Flags & _WidthStretch). Often around ~1.0f initially.
4431 float InitStretchWeightOrWidth; // Value passed to TableSetupColumn(). For Width it is a content width (_without
4432 // padding_).
4433 ImRect ClipRect; // Clipping rectangle for the column
4434 ImGuiID UserID; // Optional, value passed to TableSetupColumn()
4435 float WorkMinX; // Contents region min ~(MinX + CellPaddingX + CellSpacingX1) == cursor start position when entering
4436 // column
4437 float WorkMaxX; // Contents region max ~(MaxX - CellPaddingX - CellSpacingX2)
4438 float ItemWidth; // Current item width for the column, preserved across rows
4439 float ContentMaxXFrozen; // Contents maximum position for frozen rows (apart from headers), from which we can infer
4440 // content width.
4441 float ContentMaxXUnfrozen;
4442 float ContentMaxXHeadersUsed; // Contents maximum position for headers rows (regardless of freezing). TableHeader()
4443 // automatically softclip itself + report ideal desired size, to avoid creating
4444 // extraneous draw calls
4445 float ContentMaxXHeadersIdeal;
4446 ImS16 NameOffset; // Offset into parent ColumnsNames[]
4447 ImGuiTableColumnIdx DisplayOrder; // Index within Table's IndexToDisplayOrder[] (column may be reordered by users)
4448 ImGuiTableColumnIdx IndexWithinEnabledSet; // Index within enabled/visible set (<= IndexToDisplayOrder)
4449 ImGuiTableColumnIdx
4450 PrevEnabledColumn; // Index of prev enabled/visible column within Columns[], -1 if first enabled/visible column
4451 ImGuiTableColumnIdx
4452 NextEnabledColumn; // Index of next enabled/visible column within Columns[], -1 if last enabled/visible column
4453 ImGuiTableColumnIdx SortOrder; // Index of this column within sort specs, -1 if not sorting on this column, 0 for
4454 // single-sort, may be >0 on multi-sort
4455 ImGuiTableDrawChannelIdx DrawChannelCurrent; // Index within DrawSplitter.Channels[]
4456 ImGuiTableDrawChannelIdx DrawChannelFrozen; // Draw channels for frozen rows (often headers)
4457 ImGuiTableDrawChannelIdx DrawChannelUnfrozen; // Draw channels for unfrozen rows
4458 bool IsEnabled; // IsUserEnabled && (Flags & ImGuiTableColumnFlags_Disabled) == 0
4459 bool IsUserEnabled; // Is the column not marked Hidden by the user? (unrelated to being off view, e.g. clipped by
4460 // scrolling).
4461 bool IsUserEnabledNextFrame;
4462 bool IsVisibleX; // Is actually in view (e.g. overlapping the host window clipping rectangle, not scrolled).
4463 bool IsVisibleY;
4464 bool IsRequestOutput; // Return value for TableSetColumnIndex() / TableNextColumn(): whether we request user to
4465 // output contents or not.
4466 bool IsSkipItems; // Do we want item submissions to this column to be completely ignored (no layout will happen).
4467 bool IsPreserveWidthAuto;
4468 ImS8 NavLayerCurrent; // ImGuiNavLayer in 1 byte
4469 ImU8 AutoFitQueue; // Queue of 8 values for the next 8 frames to request auto-fit
4470 ImU8 CannotSkipItemsQueue; // Queue of 8 values for the next 8 frames to disable Clipped/SkipItem
4471 ImU8 SortDirection : 2; // ImGuiSortDirection_Ascending or ImGuiSortDirection_Descending
4472 ImU8 SortDirectionsAvailCount : 2; // Number of available sort directions (0 to 3)
4473 ImU8 SortDirectionsAvailMask : 4; // Mask of available sort directions (1-bit each)
4474 ImU8 SortDirectionsAvailList; // Ordered list of available sort directions (2-bits each, total 8-bits)
4475
4476 ImGuiTableColumn()
4477 {
4478 memset(this, 0, sizeof(*this));
4479 StretchWeight = WidthRequest = -1.0f;
4480 NameOffset = -1;
4481 DisplayOrder = IndexWithinEnabledSet = -1;
4482 PrevEnabledColumn = NextEnabledColumn = -1;
4483 SortOrder = -1;
4484 SortDirection = ImGuiSortDirection_None;
4485 DrawChannelCurrent = DrawChannelFrozen = DrawChannelUnfrozen = (ImU8)-1;
4486 }
4487};
4488
4489// Transient cell data stored per row.
4490// sizeof() ~ 6 bytes
4491struct ImGuiTableCellData
4492{
4493 ImU32 BgColor; // Actual color
4494 ImGuiTableColumnIdx Column; // Column number
4495};
4496
4497// Parameters for TableAngledHeadersRowEx()
4498// This may end up being refactored for more general purpose.
4499// sizeof() ~ 12 bytes
4500struct ImGuiTableHeaderData
4501{
4502 ImGuiTableColumnIdx Index; // Column index
4503 ImU32 TextColor;
4504 ImU32 BgColor0;
4505 ImU32 BgColor1;
4506};
4507
4508// Per-instance data that needs preserving across frames (seemingly most others do not need to be preserved aside from
4509// debug needs. Does that means they could be moved to ImGuiTableTempData?) sizeof() ~ 24 bytes
4510struct ImGuiTableInstanceData
4511{
4512 ImGuiID TableInstanceID;
4513 float LastOuterHeight; // Outer height from last frame
4514 float LastTopHeadersRowHeight; // Height of first consecutive header rows from last frame (FIXME: this is used
4515 // assuming consecutive headers are in same frozen set)
4516 float LastFrozenHeight; // Height of frozen section from last frame
4517 int HoveredRowLast; // Index of row which was hovered last frame.
4518 int HoveredRowNext; // Index of row hovered this frame, set after encountering it.
4519
4520 ImGuiTableInstanceData()
4521 {
4522 TableInstanceID = 0;
4523 LastOuterHeight = LastTopHeadersRowHeight = LastFrozenHeight = 0.0f;
4524 HoveredRowLast = HoveredRowNext = -1;
4525 }
4526};
4527
4528// sizeof() ~ 592 bytes + heap allocs described in TableBeginInitMemory()
4529struct IMGUI_API ImGuiTable
4530{
4531 ImGuiID ID;
4532 ImGuiTableFlags Flags;
4533 void *RawData; // Single allocation to hold Columns[], DisplayOrderToIndex[], and RowCellData[]
4534 ImGuiTableTempData *TempData; // Transient data while table is active. Point within g.CurrentTableStack[]
4535 ImSpan<ImGuiTableColumn> Columns; // Point within RawData[]
4536 ImSpan<ImGuiTableColumnIdx> DisplayOrderToIndex; // Point within RawData[]. Store display order of columns (when not
4537 // reordered, the values are 0...Count-1)
4538 ImSpan<ImGuiTableCellData> RowCellData; // Point within RawData[]. Store cells background requests for current row.
4539 ImBitArrayPtr EnabledMaskByDisplayOrder; // Column DisplayOrder -> IsEnabled map
4540 ImBitArrayPtr EnabledMaskByIndex; // Column Index -> IsEnabled map (== not hidden by user/api) in a format adequate
4541 // for iterating column without touching cold data
4542 ImBitArrayPtr VisibleMaskByIndex; // Column Index -> IsVisibleX|IsVisibleY map (== not hidden by user/api && not
4543 // hidden by scrolling/cliprect)
4544 ImGuiTableFlags SettingsLoadedFlags; // Which data were loaded from the .ini file (e.g. when order is not altered we
4545 // won't save order)
4546 int SettingsOffset; // Offset in g.SettingsTables
4547 int LastFrameActive;
4548 int ColumnsCount; // Number of columns declared in BeginTable()
4549 int CurrentRow;
4550 int CurrentColumn;
4551 ImS16 InstanceCurrent; // Count of BeginTable() calls with same ID in the same frame (generally 0). This is a little
4552 // bit similar to BeginCount for a window, but multiple tables with the same ID are multiple
4553 // tables, they are just synced.
4554 ImS16 InstanceInteracted; // Mark which instance (generally 0) of the same ID is being interacted with
4555 float RowPosY1;
4556 float RowPosY2;
4557 float RowMinHeight; // Height submitted to TableNextRow()
4558 float RowCellPaddingY; // Top and bottom padding. Reloaded during row change.
4559 float RowTextBaseline;
4560 float RowIndentOffsetX;
4561 ImGuiTableRowFlags RowFlags : 16; // Current row flags, see ImGuiTableRowFlags_
4562 ImGuiTableRowFlags LastRowFlags : 16;
4563 int RowBgColorCounter; // Counter for alternating background colors (can be fast-forwarded by e.g clipper), not same
4564 // as CurrentRow because header rows typically don't increase this.
4565 ImU32 RowBgColor[2]; // Background color override for current row.
4566 ImU32 BorderColorStrong;
4567 ImU32 BorderColorLight;
4568 float BorderX1;
4569 float BorderX2;
4570 float HostIndentX;
4571 float MinColumnWidth;
4572 float OuterPaddingX;
4573 float CellPaddingX; // Padding from each borders. Locked in BeginTable()/Layout.
4574 float CellSpacingX1; // Spacing between non-bordered cells. Locked in BeginTable()/Layout.
4575 float CellSpacingX2;
4576 float InnerWidth; // User value passed to BeginTable(), see comments at the top of BeginTable() for details.
4577 float ColumnsGivenWidth; // Sum of current column width
4578 float ColumnsAutoFitWidth; // Sum of ideal column width in order nothing to be clipped, used for auto-fitting and
4579 // content width submission in outer window
4580 float ColumnsStretchSumWeights; // Sum of weight of all enabled stretching columns
4581 float ResizedColumnNextWidth;
4582 float ResizeLockMinContentsX2; // Lock minimum contents width while resizing down in order to not create feedback
4583 // loops. But we allow growing the table.
4584 float RefScale; // Reference scale to be able to rescale columns on font/dpi changes.
4585 float AngledHeadersHeight; // Set by TableAngledHeadersRow(), used in TableUpdateLayout()
4586 float AngledHeadersSlope; // Set by TableAngledHeadersRow(), used in TableUpdateLayout()
4587 ImRect OuterRect; // Note: for non-scrolling table, OuterRect.Max.y is often FLT_MAX until EndTable(), unless a
4588 // height has been specified in BeginTable().
4589 ImRect InnerRect; // InnerRect but without decoration. As with OuterRect, for non-scrolling tables, InnerRect.Max.y
4590 // is "
4591 ImRect WorkRect;
4592 ImRect InnerClipRect;
4593 ImRect BgClipRect; // We use this to cpu-clip cell background color fill, evolve during the frame as we cross frozen
4594 // rows boundaries
4595 ImRect Bg0ClipRectForDrawCmd; // Actual ImDrawCmd clip rect for BG0/1 channel. This tends to be ==
4596 // OuterWindow->ClipRect at BeginTable() because output in BG0/BG1 is cpu-clipped
4597 ImRect Bg2ClipRectForDrawCmd; // Actual ImDrawCmd clip rect for BG2 channel. This tends to be a correct, tight-fit,
4598 // because output to BG2 are done by widgets relying on regular ClipRect.
4599 ImRect HostClipRect; // This is used to check if we can eventually merge our columns draw calls into the current
4600 // draw call of the current window.
4601 ImRect HostBackupInnerClipRect; // Backup of InnerWindow->ClipRect during PushTableBackground()/PopTableBackground()
4602 ImGuiWindow *OuterWindow; // Parent window for the table
4603 ImGuiWindow *InnerWindow; // Window holding the table data (== OuterWindow or a child window)
4604 ImGuiTextBuffer ColumnsNames; // Contiguous buffer holding columns names
4605 ImDrawListSplitter *DrawSplitter; // Shortcut to TempData->DrawSplitter while in table. Isolate draw commands per
4606 // columns to avoid switching clip rect constantly
4607 ImGuiTableInstanceData InstanceDataFirst;
4608 ImVector<ImGuiTableInstanceData> InstanceDataExtra; // FIXME-OPT: Using a small-vector pattern would be good.
4609 ImGuiTableColumnSortSpecs SortSpecsSingle;
4610 ImVector<ImGuiTableColumnSortSpecs> SortSpecsMulti; // FIXME-OPT: Using a small-vector pattern would be good.
4611 ImGuiTableSortSpecs SortSpecs; // Public facing sorts specs, this is what we return in TableGetSortSpecs()
4612 ImGuiTableColumnIdx SortSpecsCount;
4613 ImGuiTableColumnIdx ColumnsEnabledCount; // Number of enabled columns (<= ColumnsCount)
4614 ImGuiTableColumnIdx ColumnsEnabledFixedCount; // Number of enabled columns using fixed width (<= ColumnsCount)
4615 ImGuiTableColumnIdx DeclColumnsCount; // Count calls to TableSetupColumn()
4616 ImGuiTableColumnIdx AngledHeadersCount; // Count columns with angled headers
4617 ImGuiTableColumnIdx HoveredColumnBody; // Index of column whose visible region is being hovered. Important: ==
4618 // ColumnsCount when hovering empty region after the right-most column!
4619 ImGuiTableColumnIdx HoveredColumnBorder; // Index of column whose right-border is being hovered (for resizing).
4620 ImGuiTableColumnIdx HighlightColumnHeader; // Index of column which should be highlighted.
4621 ImGuiTableColumnIdx AutoFitSingleColumn; // Index of single column requesting auto-fit.
4622 ImGuiTableColumnIdx ResizedColumn; // Index of column being resized. Reset when InstanceCurrent==0.
4623 ImGuiTableColumnIdx LastResizedColumn; // Index of column being resized from previous frame.
4624 ImGuiTableColumnIdx HeldHeaderColumn; // Index of column header being held.
4625 ImGuiTableColumnIdx ReorderColumn; // Index of column being reordered. (not cleared)
4626 ImGuiTableColumnIdx ReorderColumnDir; // -1 or +1
4627 ImGuiTableColumnIdx LeftMostEnabledColumn; // Index of left-most non-hidden column.
4628 ImGuiTableColumnIdx RightMostEnabledColumn; // Index of right-most non-hidden column.
4629 ImGuiTableColumnIdx LeftMostStretchedColumn; // Index of left-most stretched column.
4630 ImGuiTableColumnIdx RightMostStretchedColumn; // Index of right-most stretched column.
4631 ImGuiTableColumnIdx
4632 ContextPopupColumn; // Column right-clicked on, of -1 if opening context menu from a neutral/empty spot
4633 ImGuiTableColumnIdx FreezeRowsRequest; // Requested frozen rows count
4634 ImGuiTableColumnIdx
4635 FreezeRowsCount; // Actual frozen row count (== FreezeRowsRequest, or == 0 when no scrolling offset)
4636 ImGuiTableColumnIdx FreezeColumnsRequest; // Requested frozen columns count
4637 ImGuiTableColumnIdx
4638 FreezeColumnsCount; // Actual frozen columns count (== FreezeColumnsRequest, or == 0 when no scrolling offset)
4639 ImGuiTableColumnIdx RowCellDataCurrent; // Index of current RowCellData[] entry in current row
4640 ImGuiTableDrawChannelIdx DummyDrawChannel; // Redirect non-visible columns here.
4641 ImGuiTableDrawChannelIdx Bg2DrawChannelCurrent; // For Selectable() and other widgets drawing across columns after
4642 // the freezing line. Index within DrawSplitter.Channels[]
4643 ImGuiTableDrawChannelIdx Bg2DrawChannelUnfrozen;
4644 ImS8 NavLayer; // ImGuiNavLayer at the time of BeginTable().
4645 bool IsLayoutLocked; // Set by TableUpdateLayout() which is called when beginning the first row.
4646 bool IsInsideRow; // Set when inside TableBeginRow()/TableEndRow().
4647 bool IsInitializing;
4648 bool IsSortSpecsDirty;
4649 bool IsUsingHeaders; // Set when the first row had the ImGuiTableRowFlags_Headers flag.
4650 bool
4651 IsContextPopupOpen; // Set when default context menu is open (also see: ContextPopupColumn, InstanceInteracted).
4652 bool DisableDefaultContextMenu; // Disable default context menu contents. You may submit your own using
4653 // TableBeginContextMenuPopup()/EndPopup()
4654 bool IsSettingsRequestLoad;
4655 bool
4656 IsSettingsDirty; // Set when table settings have changed and needs to be reported into ImGuiTableSetttings data.
4657 bool IsDefaultDisplayOrder; // Set when display order is unchanged from default (DisplayOrder contains 0...Count-1)
4658 bool IsResetAllRequest;
4659 bool IsResetDisplayOrderRequest;
4660 bool IsUnfrozenRows; // Set when we got past the frozen row.
4661 bool IsDefaultSizingPolicy; // Set if user didn't explicitly set a sizing policy in BeginTable()
4662 bool IsActiveIdAliveBeforeTable;
4663 bool IsActiveIdInTable;
4664 bool HasScrollbarYCurr; // Whether ANY instance of this table had a vertical scrollbar during the current frame.
4665 bool HasScrollbarYPrev; // Whether ANY instance of this table had a vertical scrollbar during the previous.
4666 bool MemoryCompacted;
4667 bool HostSkipItems; // Backup of InnerWindow->SkipItem at the end of BeginTable(), because we will overwrite
4668 // InnerWindow->SkipItem on a per-column basis
4669
4670 ImGuiTable()
4671 {
4672 memset(this, 0, sizeof(*this));
4673 LastFrameActive = -1;
4674 }
4675 ~ImGuiTable()
4676 {
4677 IM_FREE(RawData);
4678 }
4679};
4680
4681// Transient data that are only needed between BeginTable() and EndTable(), those buffers are shared (1 per level of
4682// stacked table).
4683// - Accessing those requires chasing an extra pointer so for very frequently used data we leave them in the main table
4684// structure.
4685// - We also leave out of this structure data that tend to be particularly useful for debugging/metrics.
4686// FIXME-TABLE: more transient data could be stored in a stacked ImGuiTableTempData: e.g. SortSpecs.
4687// sizeof() ~ 136 bytes.
4688struct IMGUI_API ImGuiTableTempData
4689{
4690 int TableIndex; // Index in g.Tables.Buf[] pool
4691 float LastTimeActive; // Last timestamp this structure was used
4692 float AngledHeadersExtraWidth; // Used in EndTable()
4693 ImVector<ImGuiTableHeaderData> AngledHeadersRequests; // Used in TableAngledHeadersRow()
4694
4695 ImVec2 UserOuterSize; // outer_size.x passed to BeginTable()
4696 ImDrawListSplitter DrawSplitter;
4697
4698 ImRect HostBackupWorkRect; // Backup of InnerWindow->WorkRect at the end of BeginTable()
4699 ImRect HostBackupParentWorkRect; // Backup of InnerWindow->ParentWorkRect at the end of BeginTable()
4700 ImVec2 HostBackupPrevLineSize; // Backup of InnerWindow->DC.PrevLineSize at the end of BeginTable()
4701 ImVec2 HostBackupCurrLineSize; // Backup of InnerWindow->DC.CurrLineSize at the end of BeginTable()
4702 ImVec2 HostBackupCursorMaxPos; // Backup of InnerWindow->DC.CursorMaxPos at the end of BeginTable()
4703 ImVec1 HostBackupColumnsOffset; // Backup of OuterWindow->DC.ColumnsOffset at the end of BeginTable()
4704 float HostBackupItemWidth; // Backup of OuterWindow->DC.ItemWidth at the end of BeginTable()
4705 int HostBackupItemWidthStackSize; // Backup of OuterWindow->DC.ItemWidthStack.Size at the end of BeginTable()
4706
4707 ImGuiTableTempData()
4708 {
4709 memset(this, 0, sizeof(*this));
4710 LastTimeActive = -1.0f;
4711 }
4712};
4713
4714// sizeof() ~ 16
4715struct ImGuiTableColumnSettings
4716{
4717 float WidthOrWeight;
4718 ImGuiID UserID;
4719 ImGuiTableColumnIdx Index;
4720 ImGuiTableColumnIdx DisplayOrder;
4721 ImGuiTableColumnIdx SortOrder;
4722 ImU8 SortDirection : 2;
4723 ImS8 IsEnabled : 2; // "Visible" in ini file
4724 ImU8 IsStretch : 1;
4725
4726 ImGuiTableColumnSettings()
4727 {
4728 WidthOrWeight = 0.0f;
4729 UserID = 0;
4730 Index = -1;
4731 DisplayOrder = SortOrder = -1;
4732 SortDirection = ImGuiSortDirection_None;
4733 IsEnabled = -1;
4734 IsStretch = 0;
4735 }
4736};
4737
4738// This is designed to be stored in a single ImChunkStream (1 header followed by N ImGuiTableColumnSettings, etc.)
4739struct ImGuiTableSettings
4740{
4741 ImGuiID ID; // Set to 0 to invalidate/delete the setting
4742 ImGuiTableFlags SaveFlags; // Indicate data we want to save using the Resizable/Reorderable/Sortable/Hideable flags
4743 // (could be using its own flags..)
4744 float RefScale; // Reference scale to be able to rescale columns on font/dpi changes.
4745 ImGuiTableColumnIdx ColumnsCount;
4746 ImGuiTableColumnIdx ColumnsCountMax; // Maximum number of columns this settings instance can store, we can recycle a
4747 // settings instance with lower number of columns but not higher
4748 bool WantApply; // Set when loaded from .ini data (to enable merging/loading .ini data into an already running
4749 // context)
4750
4751 ImGuiTableSettings()
4752 {
4753 memset(this, 0, sizeof(*this));
4754 }
4755 ImGuiTableColumnSettings *GetColumnSettings()
4756 {
4757 return (ImGuiTableColumnSettings *)(this + 1);
4758 }
4759};
4760
4761//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
4762// [SECTION] ImGui internal API
4763// No guarantee of forward compatibility here!
4764//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
4765
4766namespace ImGui
4767{
4768// Windows
4769// We should always have a CurrentWindow in the stack (there is an implicit "Debug" window)
4770// If this ever crashes because g.CurrentWindow is NULL, it means that either:
4771// - ImGui::NewFrame() has never been called, which is illegal.
4772// - You are calling ImGui functions after ImGui::EndFrame()/ImGui::Render() and before the next ImGui::NewFrame(),
4773// which is also illegal.
4774IMGUI_API ImGuiIO &GetIO(ImGuiContext *ctx);
4775IMGUI_API ImGuiPlatformIO &GetPlatformIO(ImGuiContext *ctx);
4776inline ImGuiWindow *GetCurrentWindowRead()
4777{
4778 ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
4779 return g.CurrentWindow;
4780}
4781inline ImGuiWindow *GetCurrentWindow()
4782{
4783 ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
4784 g.CurrentWindow->WriteAccessed = true;
4785 return g.CurrentWindow;
4786}
4787IMGUI_API ImGuiWindow *FindWindowByID(ImGuiID id);
4788IMGUI_API ImGuiWindow *FindWindowByName(const char *name);
4789IMGUI_API void UpdateWindowParentAndRootLinks(ImGuiWindow *window, ImGuiWindowFlags flags, ImGuiWindow *parent_window);
4790IMGUI_API void UpdateWindowSkipRefresh(ImGuiWindow *window);
4791IMGUI_API ImVec2 CalcWindowNextAutoFitSize(ImGuiWindow *window);
4792IMGUI_API bool IsWindowChildOf(ImGuiWindow *window, ImGuiWindow *potential_parent, bool popup_hierarchy,
4793 bool dock_hierarchy);
4794IMGUI_API bool IsWindowWithinBeginStackOf(ImGuiWindow *window, ImGuiWindow *potential_parent);
4795IMGUI_API bool IsWindowAbove(ImGuiWindow *potential_above, ImGuiWindow *potential_below);
4796IMGUI_API bool IsWindowNavFocusable(ImGuiWindow *window);
4797IMGUI_API void SetWindowPos(ImGuiWindow *window, const ImVec2 &pos, ImGuiCond cond = 0);
4798IMGUI_API void SetWindowSize(ImGuiWindow *window, const ImVec2 &size, ImGuiCond cond = 0);
4799IMGUI_API void SetWindowCollapsed(ImGuiWindow *window, bool collapsed, ImGuiCond cond = 0);
4800IMGUI_API void SetWindowHitTestHole(ImGuiWindow *window, const ImVec2 &pos, const ImVec2 &size);
4801IMGUI_API void SetWindowHiddenAndSkipItemsForCurrentFrame(ImGuiWindow *window);
4802inline void SetWindowParentWindowForFocusRoute(ImGuiWindow *window, ImGuiWindow *parent_window)
4803{
4804 window->ParentWindowForFocusRoute = parent_window;
4805} // You may also use SetNextWindowClass()'s FocusRouteParentWindowId field.
4806inline ImRect WindowRectAbsToRel(ImGuiWindow *window, const ImRect &r)
4807{
4808 ImVec2 off = window->DC.CursorStartPos;
4809 return ImRect(r.Min.x - off.x, r.Min.y - off.y, r.Max.x - off.x, r.Max.y - off.y);
4810}
4811inline ImRect WindowRectRelToAbs(ImGuiWindow *window, const ImRect &r)
4812{
4813 ImVec2 off = window->DC.CursorStartPos;
4814 return ImRect(r.Min.x + off.x, r.Min.y + off.y, r.Max.x + off.x, r.Max.y + off.y);
4815}
4816inline ImVec2 WindowPosAbsToRel(ImGuiWindow *window, const ImVec2 &p)
4817{
4818 ImVec2 off = window->DC.CursorStartPos;
4819 return ImVec2(p.x - off.x, p.y - off.y);
4820}
4821inline ImVec2 WindowPosRelToAbs(ImGuiWindow *window, const ImVec2 &p)
4822{
4823 ImVec2 off = window->DC.CursorStartPos;
4824 return ImVec2(p.x + off.x, p.y + off.y);
4825}
4826
4827// Windows: Display Order and Focus Order
4828IMGUI_API void FocusWindow(ImGuiWindow *window, ImGuiFocusRequestFlags flags = 0);

5047// Focus/Activation
5048// This should be part of a larger set of API: FocusItem(offset = -1), FocusItemByID(id), ActivateItem(offset = -1),
5049// ActivateItemByID(id) etc. which are much harder to design and implement than expected. I have a couple of private
5050// branches on this matter but it's not simple. For now implementing the easy ones.
5051IMGUI_API void FocusItem(); // Focus last item (no selection/activation).
5052IMGUI_API void ActivateItemByID(
5053 ImGuiID id); // Activate an item by ID (button, checkbox, tree node etc.). Activation is queued and processed on the
5054 // next frame when the item is encountered again.

5056// Inputs
5057// FIXME: Eventually we should aim to move e.g. IsActiveIdUsingKey() into IsKeyXXX functions.
5058inline bool IsNamedKey(ImGuiKey key)
5059{
5060 return key >= ImGuiKey_NamedKey_BEGIN && key < ImGuiKey_NamedKey_END;
5061}
5062inline bool IsNamedKeyOrMod(ImGuiKey key)
5063{
5064 return (key >= ImGuiKey_NamedKey_BEGIN && key < ImGuiKey_NamedKey_END) || key == ImGuiMod_Ctrl ||
5065 key == ImGuiMod_Shift || key == ImGuiMod_Alt || key == ImGuiMod_Super;
5066}
5067inline bool IsLegacyKey(ImGuiKey key)
5068{
5069 return key >= ImGuiKey_LegacyNativeKey_BEGIN && key < ImGuiKey_LegacyNativeKey_END;
5070}
5071inline bool IsKeyboardKey(ImGuiKey key)
5072{
5073 return key >= ImGuiKey_Keyboard_BEGIN && key < ImGuiKey_Keyboard_END;
5074}
5075inline bool IsGamepadKey(ImGuiKey key)
5076{
5077 return key >= ImGuiKey_Gamepad_BEGIN && key < ImGuiKey_Gamepad_END;
5078}
5079inline bool IsMouseKey(ImGuiKey key)
5080{
5081 return key >= ImGuiKey_Mouse_BEGIN && key < ImGuiKey_Mouse_END;
5082}
5083inline bool IsAliasKey(ImGuiKey key)
5084{
5085 return key >= ImGuiKey_Aliases_BEGIN && key < ImGuiKey_Aliases_END;
5086}
5087inline bool IsLRModKey(ImGuiKey key)
5088{
5089 return key >= ImGuiKey_LeftCtrl && key <= ImGuiKey_RightSuper;
5090}
5091ImGuiKeyChord FixupKeyChord(ImGuiKeyChord key_chord);
5092inline ImGuiKey ConvertSingleModFlagToKey(ImGuiKey key)
5093{
5094 if (key == ImGuiMod_Ctrl)
5095 return ImGuiKey_ReservedForModCtrl;
5096 if (key == ImGuiMod_Shift)
5097 return ImGuiKey_ReservedForModShift;
5098 if (key == ImGuiMod_Alt)
5099 return ImGuiKey_ReservedForModAlt;
5100 if (key == ImGuiMod_Super)
5101 return ImGuiKey_ReservedForModSuper;
5102 return key;
5103}
5104
5105IMGUI_API ImGuiKeyData *GetKeyData(ImGuiContext *ctx, ImGuiKey key);
5106inline ImGuiKeyData *GetKeyData(ImGuiKey key)
5107{
5108 ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
5109 return GetKeyData(&g, key);
5110}
5111IMGUI_API const char *GetKeyChordName(ImGuiKeyChord key_chord);
5112inline ImGuiKey MouseButtonToKey(ImGuiMouseButton button)
5113{
5114 IM_ASSERT(button >= 0 && button < ImGuiMouseButton_COUNT);
5115 return (ImGuiKey)(ImGuiKey_MouseLeft + button);
5116}
5117IMGUI_API bool IsMouseDragPastThreshold(ImGuiMouseButton button, float lock_threshold = -1.0f);
5118IMGUI_API ImVec2 GetKeyMagnitude2d(ImGuiKey key_left, ImGuiKey key_right, ImGuiKey key_up, ImGuiKey key_down);
5119IMGUI_API float GetNavTweakPressedAmount(ImGuiAxis axis);
5120IMGUI_API int CalcTypematicRepeatAmount(float t0, float t1, float repeat_delay, float repeat_rate);
5121IMGUI_API void GetTypematicRepeatRate(ImGuiInputFlags flags, float *repeat_delay, float *repeat_rate);
5122IMGUI_API void TeleportMousePos(const ImVec2 &pos);
5123IMGUI_API void SetActiveIdUsingAllKeyboardKeys();
5124inline bool IsActiveIdUsingNavDir(ImGuiDir dir)
5125{
5126 ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
5127 return (g.ActiveIdUsingNavDirMask & (1 << dir)) != 0;
5128}
5129
5130// [EXPERIMENTAL] Low-Level: Key/Input Ownership
5131// - The idea is that instead of "eating" a given input, we can link to an owner id.
5132// - Ownership is most often claimed as a result of reacting to a press/down event (but occasionally may be claimed
5133// ahead).
5134// - Input queries can then read input by specifying ImGuiKeyOwner_Any (== 0), ImGuiKeyOwner_NoOwner (== -1) or a custom
5135// ID.
5136// - Legacy input queries (without specifying an owner or _Any or _None) are equivalent to using ImGuiKeyOwner_Any (==
5137// 0).
5138// - Input ownership is automatically released on the frame after a key is released. Therefore:
5139// - for ownership registration happening as a result of a down/press event, the SetKeyOwner() call may be done once
5140// (common case).
5141// - for ownership registration happening ahead of a down/press event, the SetKeyOwner() call needs to be made every
5142// frame (happens if e.g. claiming ownership on hover).
5143// - SetItemKeyOwner() is a shortcut for common simple case. A custom widget will probably want to call SetKeyOwner()
5144// multiple times directly based on its interaction state.
5145// - This is marked experimental because not all widgets are fully honoring the Set/Test idioms. We will need to move
5146// forward step by step.
5147// Please open a GitHub Issue to submit your usage scenario or if there's a use case you need solved.
5148IMGUI_API ImGuiID GetKeyOwner(ImGuiKey key);
5149IMGUI_API void SetKeyOwner(ImGuiKey key, ImGuiID owner_id, ImGuiInputFlags flags = 0);
5150IMGUI_API void SetKeyOwnersForKeyChord(ImGuiKeyChord key, ImGuiID owner_id, ImGuiInputFlags flags = 0);
5151IMGUI_API void SetItemKeyOwner(
5152 ImGuiKey key, ImGuiInputFlags flags); // Set key owner to last item if it is hovered or active. Equivalent to 'if
5153 // (IsItemHovered() || IsItemActive()) { SetKeyOwner(key, GetItemID());'.
5154IMGUI_API bool TestKeyOwner(ImGuiKey key,
5155 ImGuiID owner_id); // Test that key is either not owned, either owned by 'owner_id'
5156inline ImGuiKeyOwnerData *GetKeyOwnerData(ImGuiContext *ctx, ImGuiKey key)
5157{
5158 if (key & ImGuiMod_Mask_)
5159 key = ConvertSingleModFlagToKey(key);
5160 IM_ASSERT(IsNamedKey(key));
5161 return &ctx->KeysOwnerData[key - ImGuiKey_NamedKey_BEGIN];
5162}
5163
5164// [EXPERIMENTAL] High-Level: Input Access functions w/ support for Key/Input Ownership
5165// - Important: legacy IsKeyPressed(ImGuiKey, bool repeat=true) _DEFAULTS_ to repeat, new IsKeyPressed() requires
5166// _EXPLICIT_ ImGuiInputFlags_Repeat flag.
5167// - Expected to be later promoted to public API, the prototypes are designed to replace existing ones (since owner_id
5168// can default to Any == 0)
5169// - Specifying a value for 'ImGuiID owner' will test that EITHER the key is NOT owned (UNLESS locked), EITHER the key
5170// is owned by 'owner'.
5171// Legacy functions use ImGuiKeyOwner_Any meaning that they typically ignore ownership, unless a call to SetKeyOwner()
5172// explicitly used ImGuiInputFlags_LockThisFrame or ImGuiInputFlags_LockUntilRelease.
5173// - Binding generators may want to ignore those for now, or suffix them with Ex() until we decide if this gets moved
5174// into public API.
5175IMGUI_API bool IsKeyDown(ImGuiKey key, ImGuiID owner_id);
5176IMGUI_API bool IsKeyPressed(
5177 ImGuiKey key, ImGuiInputFlags flags,
5178 ImGuiID owner_id = 0); // Important: when transitioning from old to new IsKeyPressed(): old API has "bool repeat =
5179 // true", so would default to repeat. New API requiress explicit ImGuiInputFlags_Repeat.
5180IMGUI_API bool IsKeyReleased(ImGuiKey key, ImGuiID owner_id);
5181IMGUI_API bool IsKeyChordPressed(ImGuiKeyChord key_chord, ImGuiInputFlags flags, ImGuiID owner_id = 0);
5182IMGUI_API bool IsMouseDown(ImGuiMouseButton button, ImGuiID owner_id);
5183IMGUI_API bool IsMouseClicked(ImGuiMouseButton button, ImGuiInputFlags flags, ImGuiID owner_id = 0);
5184IMGUI_API bool IsMouseReleased(ImGuiMouseButton button, ImGuiID owner_id);
5185IMGUI_API bool IsMouseDoubleClicked(ImGuiMouseButton button, ImGuiID owner_id);
5186
5187// Shortcut Testing & Routing
5188// - Set Shortcut() and SetNextItemShortcut() in imgui.h
5189// - When a policy (except for ImGuiInputFlags_RouteAlways *) is set, Shortcut() will register itself with
5190// SetShortcutRouting(),
5191// allowing the system to decide where to route the input among other route-aware calls.
5192// (* using ImGuiInputFlags_RouteAlways is roughly equivalent to calling IsKeyChordPressed(key) and bypassing route
5193// registration and check)
5194// - When using one of the routing option:
5195// - The default route is ImGuiInputFlags_RouteFocused (accept inputs if window is in focus stack. Deep-most focused
5196// window takes inputs. ActiveId takes inputs over deep-most focused window.)
5197// - Routes are requested given a chord (key + modifiers) and a routing policy.
5198// - Routes are resolved during NewFrame(): if keyboard modifiers are matching current ones: SetKeyOwner() is called +
5199// route is granted for the frame.
5200// - Each route may be granted to a single owner. When multiple requests are made we have policies to select the
5201// winning route (e.g. deep most window).
5202// - Multiple read sites may use the same owner id can all access the granted route.
5203// - When owner_id is 0 we use the current Focus Scope ID as a owner ID in order to identify our location.
5204// - You can chain two unrelated windows in the focus stack using SetWindowParentWindowForFocusRoute()
5205// e.g. if you have a tool window associated to a document, and you want document shortcuts to run when the tool is
5206// focused.
5207IMGUI_API bool Shortcut(ImGuiKeyChord key_chord, ImGuiInputFlags flags, ImGuiID owner_id);
5208IMGUI_API bool SetShortcutRouting(ImGuiKeyChord key_chord, ImGuiInputFlags flags,
5209 ImGuiID owner_id); // owner_id needs to be explicit and cannot be 0
5210IMGUI_API bool TestShortcutRouting(ImGuiKeyChord key_chord, ImGuiID owner_id);
5211IMGUI_API ImGuiKeyRoutingData *GetShortcutRoutingData(ImGuiKeyChord key_chord);
5212
5213// Docking
5214// (some functions are only declared in imgui.cpp, see Docking section)
5215IMGUI_API void DockContextInitialize(ImGuiContext *ctx);
5216IMGUI_API void DockContextShutdown(ImGuiContext *ctx);
5217IMGUI_API void DockContextClearNodes(ImGuiContext *ctx, ImGuiID root_id,
5218 bool clear_settings_refs); // Use root_id==0 to clear all
5219IMGUI_API void DockContextRebuildNodes(ImGuiContext *ctx);
5220IMGUI_API void DockContextNewFrameUpdateUndocking(ImGuiContext *ctx);
5221IMGUI_API void DockContextNewFrameUpdateDocking(ImGuiContext *ctx);
5222IMGUI_API void DockContextEndFrame(ImGuiContext *ctx);
5223IMGUI_API ImGuiID DockContextGenNodeID(ImGuiContext *ctx);
5224IMGUI_API void DockContextQueueDock(ImGuiContext *ctx, ImGuiWindow *target, ImGuiDockNode *target_node,
5225 ImGuiWindow *payload, ImGuiDir split_dir, float split_ratio, bool split_outer);
5226IMGUI_API void DockContextQueueUndockWindow(ImGuiContext *ctx, ImGuiWindow *window);
5227IMGUI_API void DockContextQueueUndockNode(ImGuiContext *ctx, ImGuiDockNode *node);
5228IMGUI_API void DockContextProcessUndockWindow(ImGuiContext *ctx, ImGuiWindow *window,
5229 bool clear_persistent_docking_ref = true);
5230IMGUI_API void DockContextProcessUndockNode(ImGuiContext *ctx, ImGuiDockNode *node);
5231IMGUI_API bool DockContextCalcDropPosForDocking(ImGuiWindow *target, ImGuiDockNode *target_node,
5232 ImGuiWindow *payload_window, ImGuiDockNode *payload_node,
5233 ImGuiDir split_dir, bool split_outer, ImVec2 *out_pos);
5234IMGUI_API ImGuiDockNode *DockContextFindNodeByID(ImGuiContext *ctx, ImGuiID id);
5235IMGUI_API void DockNodeWindowMenuHandler_Default(ImGuiContext *ctx, ImGuiDockNode *node, ImGuiTabBar *tab_bar);
5236IMGUI_API bool DockNodeBeginAmendTabBar(ImGuiDockNode *node);
5237IMGUI_API void DockNodeEndAmendTabBar();
5238inline ImGuiDockNode *DockNodeGetRootNode(ImGuiDockNode *node)
5239{
5240 while (node->ParentNode)
5241 node = node->ParentNode;
5242 return node;
5243}
5244inline bool DockNodeIsInHierarchyOf(ImGuiDockNode *node, ImGuiDockNode *parent)
5245{
5246 while (node)
5247 {
5248 if (node == parent)
5249 return true;
5250 node = node->ParentNode;
5251 }
5252 return false;
5253}
5254inline int DockNodeGetDepth(const ImGuiDockNode *node)
5255{
5256 int depth = 0;
5257 while (node->ParentNode)
5258 {
5259 node = node->ParentNode;
5260 depth++;
5261 }
5262 return depth;
5263}
5264inline ImGuiID DockNodeGetWindowMenuButtonId(const ImGuiDockNode *node)
5265{
5266 return ImHashStr("#COLLAPSE", 0, node->ID);
5267}
5268inline ImGuiDockNode *GetWindowDockNode()
5269{
5270 ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
5271 return g.CurrentWindow->DockNode;
5272}
5273IMGUI_API bool GetWindowAlwaysWantOwnTabBar(ImGuiWindow *window);
5274IMGUI_API void BeginDocked(ImGuiWindow *window, bool *p_open);
5275IMGUI_API void BeginDockableDragDropSource(ImGuiWindow *window);
5276IMGUI_API void BeginDockableDragDropTarget(ImGuiWindow *window);
5277IMGUI_API void SetWindowDock(ImGuiWindow *window, ImGuiID dock_id, ImGuiCond cond);
5278
5279// Docking - Builder function needs to be generally called before the node is used/submitted.
5280// - The DockBuilderXXX functions are designed to _eventually_ become a public API, but it is too early to expose it and
5281// guarantee stability.
5282// - Do not hold on ImGuiDockNode* pointers! They may be invalidated by any split/merge/remove operation and every
5283// frame.
5284// - To create a DockSpace() node, make sure to set the ImGuiDockNodeFlags_DockSpace flag when calling
5285// DockBuilderAddNode().
5286// You can create dockspace nodes (attached to a window) _or_ floating nodes (carry its own window) with this API.
5287// - DockBuilderSplitNode() create 2 child nodes within 1 node. The initial node becomes a parent node.
5288// - If you intend to split the node immediately after creation using DockBuilderSplitNode(), make sure
5289// to call DockBuilderSetNodeSize() beforehand. If you don't, the resulting split sizes may not be reliable.
5290// - Call DockBuilderFinish() after you are done.
5291IMGUI_API void DockBuilderDockWindow(const char *window_name, ImGuiID node_id);
5292IMGUI_API ImGuiDockNode *DockBuilderGetNode(ImGuiID node_id);
5293inline ImGuiDockNode *DockBuilderGetCentralNode(ImGuiID node_id)
5294{
5295 ImGuiDockNode *node = DockBuilderGetNode(node_id);
5296 if (!node)
5297 return NULL;
5298 return DockNodeGetRootNode(node)->CentralNode;
5299}
5300IMGUI_API ImGuiID DockBuilderAddNode(ImGuiID node_id = 0, ImGuiDockNodeFlags flags = 0);
5301IMGUI_API void DockBuilderRemoveNode(ImGuiID node_id); // Remove node and all its child, undock all windows
5302IMGUI_API void DockBuilderRemoveNodeDockedWindows(ImGuiID node_id, bool clear_settings_refs = true);
5303IMGUI_API void DockBuilderRemoveNodeChildNodes(
5304 ImGuiID node_id); // Remove all split/hierarchy. All remaining docked windows will be re-docked to the remaining
5305 // root node (node_id).
5306IMGUI_API void DockBuilderSetNodePos(ImGuiID node_id, ImVec2 pos);
5307IMGUI_API void DockBuilderSetNodeSize(ImGuiID node_id, ImVec2 size);
5308IMGUI_API ImGuiID DockBuilderSplitNode(ImGuiID node_id, ImGuiDir split_dir, float size_ratio_for_node_at_dir,
5309 ImGuiID *out_id_at_dir,
5310 ImGuiID *out_id_at_opposite_dir); // Create 2 child nodes in this parent node.
5311IMGUI_API void DockBuilderCopyDockSpace(ImGuiID src_dockspace_id, ImGuiID dst_dockspace_id,
5312 ImVector<const char *> *in_window_remap_pairs);
5313IMGUI_API void DockBuilderCopyNode(ImGuiID src_node_id, ImGuiID dst_node_id, ImVector<ImGuiID> *out_node_remap_pairs);
5314IMGUI_API void DockBuilderCopyWindowSettings(const char *src_name, const char *dst_name);
5315IMGUI_API void DockBuilderFinish(ImGuiID node_id);
5316
5317// [EXPERIMENTAL] Focus Scope
5318// This is generally used to identify a unique input location (for e.g. a selection set)
5319// There is one per window (automatically set in Begin), but:
5320// - Selection patterns generally need to react (e.g. clear a selection) when landing on one item of the set.
5321// So in order to identify a set multiple lists in same window may each need a focus scope.
5322// If you imagine an hypothetical BeginSelectionGroup()/EndSelectionGroup() api, it would likely call
5323// PushFocusScope()/EndFocusScope()
5324// - Shortcut routing also use focus scope as a default location identifier if an owner is not provided.
5325// We don't use the ID Stack for this as it is common to want them separate.
5326IMGUI_API void PushFocusScope(ImGuiID id);
5327IMGUI_API void PopFocusScope();
5328inline ImGuiID GetCurrentFocusScope()
5329{
5330 ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
5331 return g.CurrentFocusScopeId;
5332} // Focus scope we are outputting into, set by PushFocusScope()
5333

5336IMGUI_API bool BeginDragDropTargetCustom(const ImRect &bb, ImGuiID id);
5337IMGUI_API void ClearDragDrop();
5338IMGUI_API bool IsDragDropPayloadBeingAccepted();
5339IMGUI_API void RenderDragDropTargetRect(const ImRect &bb, const ImRect &item_clip_rect);

5343// feature) (this is currently not documented nor used by main library, but should work. See "widgets_typingselect" in
5344// imgui_test_suite for usage code. Please let us know if you use this!)

5496// Render helpers
5497// AVOID USING OUTSIDE OF IMGUI.CPP! NOT FOR PUBLIC CONSUMPTION. THOSE FUNCTIONS ARE A MESS. THEIR SIGNATURE AND
5498// BEHAVIOR WILL CHANGE, THEY NEED TO BE REFACTORED INTO SOMETHING DECENT. NB: All position are in absolute pixels
5499// coordinates (we are never using window coordinates internally)

5503 const ImVec2 *text_size_if_known, const ImVec2 &align = ImVec2(0, 0),
5504 const ImRect *clip_rect = NULL);

5506 const char *text, const char *text_end, const ImVec2 *text_size_if_known,
5507 const ImVec2 &align = ImVec2(0, 0), const ImRect *clip_rect = NULL);

5509 float ellipsis_max_x, const char *text, const char *text_end,
5510 const ImVec2 *text_size_if_known);

5586
5587// Template functions are instantiated in imgui_widgets.cpp for a finite number of types.
5588// To use them externally (for custom widget) you may need an "extern template" statement in your code in order to link
5589// to existing instances and silence Clang warnings (see #2036). e.g. " extern template IMGUI_API float
5590// RoundScalarWithFormatT<float, float>(const char* format, ImGuiDataType data_type, float v); "
5591template <typename T, typename SIGNED_T, typename FLOAT_T>
5592IMGUI_API float ScaleRatioFromValueT(ImGuiDataType data_type, T v, T v_min, T v_max, bool is_logarithmic,
5593 float logarithmic_zero_epsilon, float zero_deadzone_size);
5594template <typename T, typename SIGNED_T, typename FLOAT_T>
5595IMGUI_API T ScaleValueFromRatioT(ImGuiDataType data_type, float t, T v_min, T v_max, bool is_logarithmic,
5596 float logarithmic_zero_epsilon, float zero_deadzone_size);
5597template <typename T, typename SIGNED_T, typename FLOAT_T>
5598IMGUI_API bool DragBehaviorT(ImGuiDataType data_type, T *v, float v_speed, T v_min, T v_max, const char *format,
5599 ImGuiSliderFlags flags);
5600template <typename T, typename SIGNED_T, typename FLOAT_T>
5601IMGUI_API bool SliderBehaviorT(const ImRect &bb, ImGuiID id, ImGuiDataType data_type, T *v, T v_min, T v_max,
5602 const char *format, ImGuiSliderFlags flags, ImRect *out_grab_bb);
5603template <typename T>
5604IMGUI_API T RoundScalarWithFormatT(const char *format, ImGuiDataType data_type, T v);
5605template <typename T>
5606IMGUI_API bool CheckboxFlagsT(const char *label, T *flags, T flags_value);
5607

5609IMGUI_API const ImGuiDataTypeInfo *DataTypeGetInfo(ImGuiDataType data_type);
5610IMGUI_API int DataTypeFormatString(char *buf, int buf_size, ImGuiDataType data_type, const void *p_data,
5611 const char *format);
5612IMGUI_API void DataTypeApplyOp(ImGuiDataType data_type, int op, void *output, const void *arg_1, const void *arg_2);
5613IMGUI_API bool DataTypeApplyFromText(const char *buf, ImGuiDataType data_type, void *p_data, const char *format,
5614 void *p_data_when_empty = NULL);
5615IMGUI_API int DataTypeCompare(ImGuiDataType data_type, const void *arg_1, const void *arg_2);
5616IMGUI_API bool DataTypeClamp(ImGuiDataType data_type, void *p_data, const void *p_min, const void *p_max);
5617IMGUI_API bool DataTypeIsZero(ImGuiDataType data_type, const void *p_data);

5623IMGUI_API bool TempInputText(const ImRect &bb, ImGuiID id, const char *label, char *buf, int buf_size,
5624 ImGuiInputTextFlags flags);
5625IMGUI_API bool TempInputScalar(const ImRect &bb, ImGuiID id, const char *label, ImGuiDataType data_type, void *p_data,
5626 const char *format, const void *p_clamp_min = NULL, const void *p_clamp_max = NULL);
5627inline bool TempInputIsActive(ImGuiID id)
5628{
5629 ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
5630 return (g.ActiveId == id && g.TempInputId == id);
5631}
5632inline ImGuiInputTextState *GetInputTextState(ImGuiID id)
5633{
5634 ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
5635 return (id != 0 && g.InputTextState.ID == id) ? &g.InputTextState : NULL;
5636} // Get input text state if active
5637IMGUI_API void SetNextItemRefVal(ImGuiDataType data_type, void *p_data);
5638inline bool IsItemActiveAsInputText()
5639{
5640 ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
5641 return g.ActiveId != 0 && g.ActiveId == g.LastItemData.ID && g.InputTextState.ID == g.LastItemData.ID;
5642} // This may be useful to apply workaround that a based on distinguish whenever an item is active as a text input
5643 // field.

5719// Obsolete functions
5720#ifndef IMGUI_DISABLE_OBSOLETE_FUNCTIONS
5721// inline void SetItemUsingMouseWheel() {
5722// SetItemKeyOwner(ImGuiKey_MouseWheelY); } // Changed in 1.89 inline bool TreeNodeBehaviorIsOpen(ImGuiID id,
5723// ImGuiTreeNodeFlags flags = 0) { return TreeNodeUpdateNextOpen(id, flags); } // Renamed in 1.89 inline bool
5724// IsKeyPressedMap(ImGuiKey key, bool repeat = true) { IM_ASSERT(IsNamedKey(key)); return
5725// IsKeyPressed(key, repeat); } // Removed in 1.87: Mapping from named key is always identity!
5726
5727// Refactored focus/nav/tabbing system in 1.82 and 1.84. If you have old/custom copy-and-pasted widgets which used
5728// FocusableItemRegister():
5729// (Old) IMGUI_VERSION_NUM < 18209: using 'ItemAdd(....)' and 'bool tab_focused =
5730// FocusableItemRegister(...)' (Old) IMGUI_VERSION_NUM >= 18209: using 'ItemAdd(..., ImGuiItemAddFlags_Focusable)' and
5731// 'bool tab_focused = (g.LastItemData.StatusFlags & ImGuiItemStatusFlags_Focused) != 0' (New) IMGUI_VERSION_NUM >=
5732// 18413: using 'ItemAdd(..., ImGuiItemFlags_Inputable)' and 'bool tab_focused = (g.NavActivateId == id &&
5733// (g.NavActivateFlags & ImGuiActivateFlags_PreferInput))'
5734// inline bool FocusableItemRegister(ImGuiWindow* window, ImGuiID id) // -> pass
5735// ImGuiItemAddFlags_Inputable flag to ItemAdd() inline void FocusableItemUnregister(ImGuiWindow* window) // ->
5736// unnecessary: TempInputText() uses ImGuiInputTextFlags_MergedItem
5737#endif
5738
5739} // namespace ImGui

5744
5745// This structure is likely to evolve as we add support for incremental atlas updates.
5746// Conceptually this could be in ImGuiPlatformIO, but we are far from ready to make this public.
5747struct ImFontBuilderIO
5748{
5749 bool (*FontBuilder_Build)(ImFontAtlas *atlas);
5750};

5777//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
5778// [SECTION] Test Engine specific hooks (imgui_test_engine)
5779//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
5780
5781#ifdef IMGUI_ENABLE_TEST_ENGINE
5782extern void ImGuiTestEngineHook_ItemAdd(ImGuiContext *ctx, ImGuiID id, const ImRect &bb,
5783 const ImGuiLastItemData *item_data); // item_data may be NULL
5784extern void ImGuiTestEngineHook_ItemInfo(ImGuiContext *ctx, ImGuiID id, const char *label, ImGuiItemStatusFlags flags);
5785extern void ImGuiTestEngineHook_Log(ImGuiContext *ctx, const char *fmt, ...);
5786extern const char *ImGuiTestEngine_FindItemDebugLabel(ImGuiContext *ctx, ImGuiID id);
5787
5788// In IMGUI_VERSION_NUM >= 18934: changed IMGUI_TEST_ENGINE_ITEM_ADD(bb,id) to
5789// IMGUI_TEST_ENGINE_ITEM_ADD(id,bb,item_data);
5790#define IMGUI_TEST_ENGINE_ITEM_ADD(_ID, _BB, _ITEM_DATA) \
5791 if (g.TestEngineHookItems) \
5792 ImGuiTestEngineHook_ItemAdd(&g, _ID, _BB, _ITEM_DATA) // Register item bounding box
5793#define IMGUI_TEST_ENGINE_ITEM_INFO(_ID, _LABEL, _FLAGS) \
5794 if (g.TestEngineHookItems) \
5795 ImGuiTestEngineHook_ItemInfo(&g, _ID, _LABEL, _FLAGS) // Register item label and status flags (optional)
5796#define IMGUI_TEST_ENGINE_LOG(_FMT, ...) \
5797 ImGuiTestEngineHook_Log(&g, _FMT, __VA_ARGS__) // Custom log entry from user land into test log
5798#else
5799#define IMGUI_TEST_ENGINE_ITEM_ADD(_BB, _ID) ((void)0)
5800#define IMGUI_TEST_ENGINE_ITEM_INFO(_ID, _LABEL, _FLAGS) ((void)g)
5801#endif
